review_content: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago for business in JAX , being at a Hampton is pretty enjoyable regardless of the location but I appreciated the customer service and friendliness of the staff of this specific Hampton- especially Blake R! Kudos to all!I recommend staying here if you're in the area; great people, great experience!First comment : Don't pay  ahead of time !I made the mistake of paying in full and reserving ahead of time and when I had a friend offer me to stay at her home I called the Hampton and they said as part of the Hilton policy and the rate I received I could not get a refund for canceling ahead of schedule .However , that being said my stay here was great!  . I arrived around 8pm exhausted from a full day of travels .  the front desk staff was very attentive and nice . My room was wonderful . Very clean and comfortable . The next morning the free breakfast was not bad . I appreciated how they had fresh berries and Greek yogurt .I would only suggest making the pancakes a little better .  Overall , I would book this hotel for any of my relatives !This hotel is just your average hotel set up but with some freebies (free parking, wifi, breakfast, extra cable channels) that aren't always free with the larger chains. There is a lot less crowded area since the hotel is smaller. It's a good in and out hotel but I've have been to other Jacksonville hotels with a better pool, ect...The hotel service is wonderful. Jacksonville seems to have some of the friendliest people. The service from the front desk to the housekeeping were happy and sweet any time I saw them. There isn't a restaurant on site but there is a place next door that delivers to the rooms. Also, there are a handful of other businesses which makes this standard hotel a little more active if a guest gets bored. The free breakfast was not so good. A lot of things were gone---fruit bowl, orange juice, and some other empties that were once filled. Cereal, waffles, toast, yogurt were available along with no so good looking eggs and potatoes. Free is free though. The rooms come with a good amount of space and a fairly large fridge with microwave. I had a few things missing though: my luggage rack (I always use mine), my do not disturb sign (housekeeping woke me up), my clock was 2 hours late (I panicked once because I thought I was late for something). The room was clean and supplied the average hotel items.The pool was small but no one was out there. It could seat 6-8 people on the deck comfortably and 3 people in the pool. There was a lot of shade though. The gym was a good size and had the average set up. My room view was not bad! I expected a nasty parking lot (yes, I had that) but from my room I saw the city and right in the middle was an American flag (nice!).Returnable: 30% because there other hotels I'd use. A good price for your value of stay though. If it was the only hotel in the area it would have been an 80%.I am very happy with my stay at this hampton inn.  People at the check-in are nice and friendly.   The room was very clean and comes with a nice comfy bed, flat screen tv, microwave and big fridge.  The bathroom is spacious and has a big granite countertop.  The shower head has many different water streams.  The complimentary breakfast has several different cereals, bagels, muffins, and hot items (omletes, maple sausage and oat meal).  They are not bad.  I recommend this place if you are looking for a basic clean hotel with good service and in a good location for a reasonable price.So far so good. It's 7:30, we checked in at 5:15.I was able to take a cat nap and shower. Comfy bed, decent water pressure and the a/c blows cold.I stayed here for 5 days because I was working in the area. Overall, the stay was just ok. The rooms need to be better maintained as the first room I was placed in had several holes in the sheets as if it had gotten caught on something in the dryer and the refrigerator was leaking so badly that It could not be used. (Needless to say I requested another room)The decor and furnishings of the hotel need to be "updated" as it had a late 1990's feel to it and was stained badly (at-least in my room the furniture was so stained that I didn't feel comfortable sitting in it or even placing my things on them) Here are some pros and cons in a snapshot:Pros: The front staff was very friendly and helpfulThe staff did a great job keeping the hot beverages actually hot in the lobby area (and their coffee actually tasted good)They have a laundry room on site with one washer and one dryerTheir business center is actually decent as they have two computers, one printer, a hole punch, and stapler The rooms were spacious They have a recycle bin in the lobby Cons:The rooms don't have a rack or anything to hang your hand towel to allow it to dryI noticed fruit flies throughout the hotel (including my room which made me uncomfortable leaving my fruit out)My room had a weird smell to it when the A/C wasn't on and the shower wasn't properly cleaned as it had hairs on the wall, shower curtain, and shower floorThe breakfast was just "ok" definitely nothing to write home about (they offered your typical cereal, fruit, juice from the machine, yogurt, and breads like most hotels to name a few)I didn't see a sign stating what floor the laundry room was on and once in the laundry room, no sign was posted to tell you how long the wash & dryer cycles wereAlthough the business center was decent, the printer kept malfunctioning stating there was a paper jam when there wasn't onethis is an update to my previous review. I just want to say that Andrea Spencer the general manager here stepped up and contacted my wife and made the situation right. my wife is there now and has been treated like royalty and its customer service like this that retains a loyal customer.thank you Andrea for fixing the problem and not letting it go by the wayside.it is much appreciatedThe staff was extremely helpful and the hotel is very clean.  The room was very clean and comes with a nice comfy bed, flat screen tv, microwave and big fridge.  The complimentary breakfast, beautiful lobby and an outdoor pool. The bed was super comfy and the room was extremely quiet.I stay at a lot of Hampton Inns and this is as good as it gets.  Fantastic staff.  Clean and quiet.  Nice pool.  Well stocked and hot full breakfast.  Nice location.  Really hard to beat.  Bed was comfortable.  Really would not ask for anything more.  Will stay again.Clean hotel with easy access to restaurants and the local beltway around Jax.  The rooms are spacious and the staff are very friendly, very typical of Hampton Inns.Great hotel! I stayed here for 2 nights, and the front desk was helpful and friendly. When the business center printer was jammed, they let me use the front desk computers to print out my boarding pass!The Wifi is FREE and works very well, unlike most of the hotels I've ever been to. The TV is a flat LCD TV and there's also a refrigerator and microwave. The rooms themselves are very clean and nice and the whole building and area seem pretty new. The plaza that the hotel is in contains many restaurants, so you'll never be hungry.Continental breakfast was way more than I expected, not just your simple danishes and coffee. There were eggs, bacon, potatoes, sausage, milk and cereal, donuts, bagels, all kinds of juices, yogurt, and more. The breakfast potatoes were amazing! Oh yeah, how could I forget...they have waffle makers too!I think the only thing I would complain about is that it was difficult to keep the bathroom floor dry during showers. I realized on my second night there that the bottom of the shower curtains have magnets that you stick to the inside of the bathtub. Genius! The floor was dry that night. :)There happened to be a Santa convention (yeah you read that right) staying here at the same time as my group, and that really made our day. We even took pictures with them sitting on their laps at breakfast. I know they're not part of this hotel, but the fact that they're staying at this hotel must mean the hotel is on the "Good" List! :DHey, this is a really nice place with great front desk help on all shifts.  I enjoyed all of the amenities of this hotel. It was 15 min from downtown (which is were I a was working and 20 min from the beach)  The breakfast was good and hot, with waffels, eggs, bacon. They also had hot and cold cereal with a juice bar.  The price was pretty good plus I booked on my phone and got 16% mobile discount.   There is a Publix and a package store across the street, also Sneakers Bar, Outback Steakhouse, Carrabba's and a Broklynn Pizza.My out of town friends stayed here recently and they enjoyed it a lot.  They loved their room and said the hotel staff were very nice.  I loved their lobby, it is all new and comfortable.Stayed here for business. Beds were not your typical Hampton Cloud Nine (pretty hard) but overall the stay was comfortable, room was clean. Hotel was slightly dated but internet worked well. Location was very close to 295, within walking distance of an Outback and Carabbas and less than a mile to a Publix. Breakfast was annoying, there is a very small room and an awkward set up for seating, you're probably better dining out than fighting the morning rush.I have stayed there 5x this year. Same staff every time. There is comfort in consistancy.Kelli does a great of running the front desk and keeping all of the guests happy. Rooms are clean and adequate. More importantly it is quiet! Breakfast consisted of cheese omlets, bacon and french toast.. Other morning was scrambled eggs, sausage and  potatoes. Both mornings there were home made waffles, and the usual bagels, breads, cereals, etc. Three coffee choices. The scrambled eggs were overcooked and the french toast was nothing to write home about but everything else was delicious. When you stay here there is no need to drive anywhere to get to a restaurant. Plenty of offerings right actross the parking lot.Clean, quiet, and convenient. This location was very easy to spot off 295 outside of Jacksonville. I would have given 5 stars, but I was really disappointed that we had a handicap room without a bathtub. We requested a tub when we were booking the room, but when we arrived they didn't have another room to give us. The employees were very friendly and apologetic, but I was still disappointed after having driven for  7 hours from Charlotte. The bed was super comfy and the room was extremely quiet, except for the AC unit that rattled a bit when it switched on. The complimentary breakfast was decent and the coffee was hot and flavorful.Here on business in October.  Not a luxury hotel, but above average for Jacksonville.  People at the front desk for helpful and nice.  Clean room.  Quiet room.  Nice bed.  Can't go wrong by staying here.Stayed in a room with two queens. It was a standard room with a clean bathroom stacked with towels and a tray of complementary toiletries. There was a small LCD TV with 30-something channels and desk. What left a lasting impression and a 4 star review is how plush and amazing the beds were. The mattress itself was very comfortable (it was on the softer side, but still firm enough) and I haven't felt such soft blankets and pillows since my last trip to Vegas at the Bellagio.  The breakfast buffet they serve when compared on an absolute scale something I would be pissed to buy, but considering it's an average hotel with a small breakfast area, its not all that bad. For the two mornings I was there, they served a continental type breakfast with fruits, cereal, and an assortment of juices. They also have a new waffle maker if that tickles your pickle.So, in the past year I have been traveling a lot. When you are literally living out of a carry on you come to appreciate the little things, and this place has got it down. It has free wifi, clean sheets and room, decent gym, good continental breakfast, etc, but these usually come standard in most hotels these days. What sets this place apart in customer service. Maybe its just me, but they remember my name and things that we last talked about. Take one of my experiences as an example. There was a trip when I got in at 9:45pm after spending most of the day traveling. I had a really bad day, I was tired, in need of a long shower, and had a craving for milk and cookies. As I was checking in what was on the counter you ask. A PLATE OF COOKIES! I was as happy as Little Timmy was on Christmas morning. Unfortunately Big Bertha and her side kick BIGGER Bertha were in front of me. Needless to say, the dynamic duo took ALL of the freaking COOKIES!!!! They were complaining about a lack of restaurants in the area and how the portions were getting smaller. I couldn't remember exactly what she was saying. I was focused on all the cookies the duo had in their chubby fingers. I remember thinking to myself, Lady, the portions are the same. It's you who has changed.  (Yes, I know I am going to hell) There had to be at least 15 good sized cookies on that plate. Yes, I was mad, but I was just too tired to get angry. So, I guess I came off as super sad: think of the faces of the starving kids on the commercials where they ask for donations to help support the hungry kids. The young brunette receptionist who was also studying for an exam witnessed the injustice. I asked if they had anymore cookies to which she replied they were all out. She asked if I was okay, I responded with a smile, I guess it's too much to ask for a guy to get some milk and cookies after a bad day or something to that effect.  After I settled in and took a shower. I heard a knock at the door. Turn down service with a happy ending? Even better! It was room service with a glass of milk and a stack of oatmeal raisin cookies courtesy of the receptionist! I am definitely coming back to this place for the extra effort that they always provide me with.Note: I have nothing against big ppl. I just have something against ppl (big or small) who TAKE ALL OF THE COOKIES!!!!

The biggest win for this property is it's staff- they are fantastic! Jessica (Jessika?) at the front desk checked me in and she was AMAZING!!!!! SO friendly, she made great conversation while she checked me in and was still quite efficient! She also offered to provide area recommendations and she promised to call to check on the condition of my room. She ended up seeing me walk through the lobby about 10 minutes later and followed up on if my room was okay. She was the epitome of hospitality. Besides, Jessica the rest of the staff I interacted with, which was limited to a maintenance man outside who went out of his way to hold the door open for me, and a phone operator who set up my wake up call was super nice. The location for me was convenient for the work travel I was doing. It is closed to 295 and located just off of a main road with lots of food, gas stations, grocery and convenience stores nearby. This hotel also offers a free hot breakfast. I thought the menu was decent- make your own waffles, breads and pastries, yogurts, fresh fruit, oatmeal as well as scrambled eggs and sausage. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate and water are available around the clock. There were also cookies at the front desk when I checked in which was nice!The lobby is well maintained and features a business computer and printer if you need it!The hotel features a fitness center which is open 24 hours. It only had a few machines, but good variety. There is also an outdoor pool available, although I did not use it. The only "meh" part of the stay is the room. I felt my room was clean, but it is clear that this is an older property. The rooms and hallways could use some refreshing as decor does appear older and warn. Compared to similar comparably priced properties I feel the rooms are not on par with the competition.'Real" rating: 1.5 (but Yelp does not allow "1/2 stars").The "good part:  But, it was not all bad.  Both employees at the front desk were quite pleasant and reflected positively on the owner.But there was muuuuch more bad than good:  1.  The room was really, really small.  Maybe a booking error?  I don't know.  But the room was the size one might expect in a Microtel, Red Roof Inn, etc.  Double (not Queen) bed.2.  The bed was really uncomfortable.  Really.  The mattress felt like it should have been replaced years ago.3.  The pillows was pretty much useless -- also should have been replaced long ago.4.  The HVAC, which was right next to the bed in this tiny room, was really noisy.  Really noisy.5. When we left the toilet was running; never shut off the entire time we were there.  (Wonder why the housekeeping folks don't report things like this -- or maybe the owner does not care?)6.  The breakfast, such as it was, was quite poor.  I thought Holiday Inn Express facilities were bad (they are), but this was worse.7.  The HVAC system was dusty and our allergies started acting up.  (See the photos -- the dust was plentiful -- and obvious.  It's rather clear they're seldom or never cleaned.)Would we return?  Absolutely not!   This facility is an embarrassment to the Marriott system.The Good:-Location....right off the highway and easy to find-Customer Service....front desk employee, a manager, and even the employee stocking and cleaning the breakfast buffet...all EXCEEDINGLY friendly and customer-oriented-Cleanliness-Nice bed linens...soft & clean-Free breakfast (pretty much the basics-fruit, muffins, bagels, eggs, sausage, oatmeal, cereal, and make-your-own waffle station)-Nice breakfast area-Free WiFi-Lobby smells really niceThe Bad-Rooms have very bad, musty odor-Carpet in room feels damp to the touch-Air conditioning in our room was very loud and actually started malfunctiong-The property is obviously very dated and in disrepair-Maintenance workers where making awful noise in the crawl space above our room for 2 hours after we checked in-Crack in window to our room-Broken furniture in room-Uncomfortable bed-The water (both shower and sink) has a strange odor to itUnfortunately, the negatives outweigh the positives and I can't say that I'd return to this Fairfield Inn.I wish I could rate this higher based solely off of how friendly the staff was but I cant. The exterior of the hotel is clean and we'll maintained. There is also plenty of parking spaces and the lot suitably lit.We got a room on the third floor. The room had an overpowering odor, closely resembling a basement.  The room had an odd setup,  making watching TV from bed very difficult. And onto the bed, which was disappointing.  We got the king sized bed, which was lumpy and inconsistent in firmness in different areas of the bed. They were also doing maintenance right outside of our room a large part of the day, making relaxing after an eight hour drive insanely difficult. As I mentioned earlier,  the guest service was the best part of the experience, but due to the quality of the room,  I most likely will not be returning.Staff at the front desk American and speak English!!Rooms are brand new and still smell like a brand new house. Very clean and odor free. completely updated thruoutRooms and hotel in general seem to be dated. Marriott should take more pride in not letting their properties falling behind on the times. Musty odor and overall not very clean. Disappointed is an understatement and I wouldn't recommend this property to anyone. Do yourself the favor and pay the extra $ for one of the other hotels, get what you pay for couldn't be a truer statement. Thumbs downIf you are on a strict budget, probably not the worst place to stay. On the plus side, the place is clean, free wi-fi, and it includes breakfast; on the negative side the rooms are old and my room felt damp.The place is in need of an upgrade.  If you can shell out a couple of more bucks, the Courtyard across the way is a better option.Although we received a confirmation email, and we called this hotel multiple times to confirm our reservation, the hotel totally messed up our reservation. I won't stay here or another Fairfield again.I paid what I would have paid at a Motel 6, but this one is so much better! Friendly staff, no problems. The free WiFi has a weak signal, but no big issues.Older hotel, friendly staff,

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Orange Park - Wells Rd.
review_content: Super clean hotel, from check-in to check-out was a great experience. King bed room was very large and spotless. We checked in and then received a call from front desk to make sure everything was OK. Exceptional Customer service!Super nice  decor inside and outside . Free beer when you check in . They have a huge pitcher of fruit water as well at all times in lobby .Only one onsight laundry room , 3 floor.Plenty of vending machines .Fridge and microwave . They have a nice out door pool and patio area . Located around a lot of restaurants if your willing to walk a tiny bit.Awesome , friendly staff !!!!I finally made it to try this buffet that was on my to do list. Being Fathers day I figured it would be packed and the price would be higher but I called for a reservation and asked if the price was the same and they stated no price change. The menu for the meat on the buffet included Ribs, Chicken, Honey ham and a carving station. There were fresh salads and fruits plus numerous desserts. I was very excited that there was no overcrowding and that the food was up to the HIH standards. I will defiantly be a Sunday regular for this well priced feast...We had a room here last weekend after our friends wedding.  The hotel is pretty new and very clean.  I thought the rooms were very nice.  We hung out at the lobby bar and they were extremely nice.  Mandy was awesome tending to all our needs.  They didn't even mind when we orded pizza after midnight and dirtied up their plates with outside food.  Great staff and a good clean hotel!This is the first and only hotel I've ever stayed in that hands you an ice cold bottle of beer at the registration desk! (or bottle of water if you prefer). I found this pretty funny.The hotel is very nice and VERY clean with a friendly and helpful staff.  I didn't use any of the amenities but I did check out the workout room and pool areas and found them to very nice as well. They have a restaurant and bar which I didn't have time to check out.The hotel is in a nice area of town. Although there were not many restaurants or stores in the immediate area, there were many to choose from not far away.I highly recommend this hotel.::SIGHS::  Spur of the moment trip to Jacksonville to visit dying grandmother landed myself and my family in this dump.  My dad made the arrangements.  When we arrived (myself, two brother, dad and his gf) the place looked decent, dare I say nice?  The woman offered us a free beer with check-in (ok whatever) and that is where is ended.  The would not allow us to put an extra cot in the room my brothers shared so that I could avoid the awkward room sharing with my dad and his gf.  They said it was because of fire code.  Ok fine, whatever.  I accepted this answer.What I really dislike about this hotel, other than everything, is the rooms.  They smelled so bad, like mold and musty air.  The sheets were really scratchy, and the pillows were very hard.  They also kept a spare pillow on the floor behind a chair (I'm pretty sure this has to be some sort of violation).  The GROSSEST part was the bugs.  As I crawled into bed I noticed there was a dead flying ant next to my pillows.  My brother had two cockroaches in their room.  One in the bed, and one the next morning in their clothes.  Finally, day one - the complimentary coffee was awful, almost see through, day two no coffee at all.My mom is in a small little Florida town called Green Cove Springs.  There's not much there, and as for hotels it's kinda feast/famine.  So, staying in Orange Park is a good choice if you need to get in/around Jacksonville (to the north), or GCS (to the south).  I've been to Orange Park, and around that area for several years now, and have tried the various hotels there.  All were, basically, Motels.  Nothing special.However, this hotel is just off-the-charts great compared to where I'd previously been.  Spacious rooms.  CLEAN rooms.  A fantastic bar/restaurant built right into the lobby.  Even a nice pool/jacuzzi as well.  Did I mention the FREE nightly hors d'oeuvres and EVEN MORE FREE ice cream?  (Well, it's a bunch of ice cream in a freezer that you can pick out for yourself around 8pm, but still).The only negative is this place claimed free Wi-Fi, but most of us did not find that our devices could "sniff out" the network.  Bummer.  But still, I'll definitely be back here.  It was a great stay, and well worth it.AWSOME place stayed there a Monday and  Tuesday couldn't stay for one more day because they we're booked but definitely love this place and the balcony is nice tooThis hotel is making inroads on going green by reducing its use of detergent back into the environment and giving its customers the option of recycling the towel and sheets. Brilliant! This is just the beginning of great things to come. Apart from that, it has switched the energy saving bulbs and much more. This is a step in sustainability that most progressive organizations have included into their business model.The staff is friendly and attentive to your needs. Plus you get a complimentary breakfast for two. You have access to the business center, gym, pool and hot tub.Booked rooms for a conference months in advance. Arrive at the hotel to find out they over booked themselves and kicked out 15 reservations from our conference this weekend with no notice until we arrived.This is my second visit here. Last was for business but I was so impressed that I brought my hubby with me. Room was clean and quiet. Bed was spacious and comfortable. Room service was fast and had great food. Staff was beyond awesome!This a newer hotel with full restaurant and bar . Rooms are super clean and staff is very friendly. Not much of a work out faculty two treadmills and a electrical bike but other then that it's a very nice hotelThey have a strict --not well publicized NO REFUND POLICY.  So if you change your plans, you pay for your room anyway.  When I called to make sure I understood this correctly, their response was "that's the policy."  I will never use this hotel ever again!  I think anyone who is handed a beer at the counter is expected to write a good review!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Jacksonville Butler Blvd.
review_content: My stay was for business over 2 days and the location was convenient for my purposes; right at I-95 for getting around quickly and on the southern portion of the city for heading back to Tampa when finished up.The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice...exceptionally nice in one particular case: the lady  servicing the breakfast was VERY helpful and I almost felt like I was being waited on at a diner. She prepared my waffle fresh for me, refilled my OJ when it was low, brought a paper to me, and encouraged me to eat a banana because it would "get me through the day." All of that with a smile at 6am!The only knocks I will give on the place is that in the room- the heavy curtain only covers 1/4 of the way on each side...leaving the middle 1/2 portion only covered with a shear cloth for light to get in. I improvised and used a clothes hanger to clip them together.There was a fridge, microwave, and coffee & single cup maker in the room...you expect those these days until you run into a few that leave them out. The free WiFi was also appreciated, as many still charge for that.Enjoyed the stay.I am a current guest, checking in for a week for a continuing education class.  The first night of my stay, much to my dismay, no hot water.  I contacted the front desk and was told there was no issue and that most people most likely shower in the morning. The next morning, no hot water again.  I let the front desk know and they informed me that I should let the water run for a few minutes and it would get hot.  Didn't work.  I've read through many reviews and this is a documented issue.  Apparently this property does not care.  My classmates had the same issue.  I woke up at 5am sharp on Wednesday morning to ensure a hot shower, which I got. Wednesday evening after my run.. NO HOT WATER.  This morning... 6am... NO HOT WATER.  This is completely unacceptable.  There are many other great options within walking distance of this hotel.  I would suggest them first.  Hampton Inn, Courtyard by Marriott, Townplace Suites, Ramada, and a couple other properties.  DO NOT STAY HERE!!This hotel was phenominal. I did have a issue that was turned around 100%. The most impressive part about staying here aside from the outstanding comfort in the rooms was the breakfast. Fresh eggs and potatoes! A special shout out to Annastasia and Ashley. The both were personable and professional. I hope to see them promoted one day. Also Uriel Castro was great helping turn my issue around! Highly recommend and will return!Cannot believe I have not reviewed this place yet!  It's really quite comfortable, clean, and relatively new, or it feels that way at least.The staff is very friendly and helpful. . .always!  My rooms have always been super clean, well appointed with frige AND microwave.  In addition, there is a pantry area where you can buy items if need be.Breakfast is included, but not really fit for my dietary needs.  There is a lot pre packaged items like biscuits, yogurt, packet oatmeal and grits and small cartons of milk.It is perfect for business travelers like me, and it really feels like home.  No brainer to choose to stay here!Great location just down the street from the expansive shopping and restaurants at St. John's center. Central to the city and local businesses nearby. Fairly new location with updated furniture, flat panels, desks and decor. Great breakfast service and staff were extremely nice and accommodating. Rates very reasonable. Only real complaint I would have is with the age and condition of the workout equipment (treadmill and bike). Other than that, great place to stay!Great visit.  This hotel was very clean and their continental breakfast offered tons of choices.  Rooms are nice and comfortable.  We enjoyed our stay.Clean and a nice staff. The bed is not impressive. Also a big pet peeve of mine- no easily accessible outletsArrived late at night, got great rate and wonderful service. I love me some MarriottI originally gave this hotel a poor rating because of the poor night sleep I had. I felt the need to change the rating because the people here are amazing. They went out of their way to fix my problems and made the rest of my stay quite nice. People do make a difference!We usually stay in other locations when in this area but decided to branch out.  The Senior discount was best but they also give a Mayo discount for those going to the Clinic.  Finding the place even in daylight was a chore since you follow a street sign down what appears to be a side road and THEN you see the big motel sign.  Upon check in we asked Eric, the night clerk, for a quiet room.  Started to unpack when next door the family we all dread arrived.  You know the type, no idea of common courtesy, yelling down the hallways to the rest of the clan, kids banging the walls, etc.  Assumed they would fall into a quiet stupor after a big supper out but did not want to take the chance.  Informed Eric who quickly gave us a new room with no nonsense about "I am sure they will quiet down, etc".   Luckily they have big brass carts for moving luggage smoothly.  We had an extremely quiet night.  So we saw 2 rooms, both well appointed, frig, microwave, with nice touches like an attractive valance over the window curtains, very clean, no odor.  Sadly this motel and probably the chain has gone cheap on the flat screen TVs and the ports do function to allow plug and play which we enjoyed just recently at a La Quinta.  We prefer streaming video versus the commercial ridden regular TV so we missed being able to run our picture through the flat screen.  Another common feature missing is 110 power outlets on the desk lamps.  We carry a 110 ext cord but it is a pain to get under the desk to plug it in.  However, the internet connection was excellent!  Breakfast was OK with lots of microwave stuff like sausage and biscuits which are actually fresher than some of the prepared items I have had in the past.  This is a keeper.super clean hotel in a great location just off 202 in Jax,,,friendly staff +great breakfast (free)...can't wait to return

hotel_name: Comfort Suites Baymeadows Near Butler Blvd
review_content: Comfort Suites on Baymeadows in Jacksonville Fl is excellently located right off of I95. Lots of shopping and restaurants to chose from. Staff friendly, room comfortable, beds very nice plenty of fluffy towels, pillows , iron, mini fridge, microwave. The air conditioner was blowing cold air but it had a moldy mildew smell to it- made room stink- they need to disinfect it or change filter or something. Also outside of hotel right by front door were groups of men together - like from a truckers convention- all smoking- the cigarette smoke was getting into the hotel and made lobby reek- my shirt smelled of cigarette smoke just getting into lobby. They need to move smoking area to side of building instead of right by front door. Also only one working elevator- took forever to get to third floor- got tired of waiting and took stairs. Overall worth the price$79 with AAA discount. Also one final nice touch was the clerk noticing my diamond elite status and gave me a free bottle of water at check in- little things like that go a long way.In Jacksonville the night of June 30th, I arrived at 12:25 a.m. on the 1st of July, 2015. Having obtained this booking through Priceline, I was given a room with a king size bed and sleeper sofa. Male clerk was nice and polite. My room through a negotiated price was $52.00 - $37.00 less that the hotel itself. Great deal. Hotel is aged, but not dirty in the sense of trashy. Room was bigger than what I'm used to and had a divider between the large king size bed and sleeper sofa. A refrigerator, microwave and mini-coffee maker were available for my use. I used the fridge and microwave - they worked.Bathroom was clean, but aged. Water in shower could have been hotter, but it was sufficient. Plenty of towels, and a single set of shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Neither the bathroom or room waste basket had a plastic bag in them.Free breakfast with all the basics found in a Comfort Suites. Coffee was good and hot - I had the Bold. Well stocked and a busy area first thing in the morning. They were out of butter for my English Muffin so I enjoyed a generic strawberry jelly.Convenient to I-95 off Baymeadows in South East Jacksonville. Lots of area convenience stores, restaurants, fast food joints, and gas stations close to the hotel./s/ William E. Lewis Jr. , Fort Lauderdale, FloridaMy family needed a room quickly and this hotel had what we needed. We had a king room with a pull-out couch, so we were able to get four people to sleep comfortable. The pull-out couch mattress was kind of gross. The bathroom left a bit much to be desired - we couldn't properly turn the bath faucet off. This hotel includes breakfast, but you're better off grabbing something in the go unless you're all about bread. Overall, we got a place to sleep for a night that didn't break the bank.It's decent. Considering I'm I am here for free with a friend who's on a business trip maybe my vision is a little clouded by the rose colored glasses of the fact it's FREE but I still think if I had paid 60 or 70 bucks a night I would be happy with it it's clean it's in a decent location very close to lots of food and shopping have a good free breakfast with actual real food (and excellent coffee) they are friendly they have a little mini market in the lobby t..he wifi is free the rooms are kinda half-a$$ suites (they may have real suites too...I don't know) with a little half wall but still it's much bigger than a normal hotel room and it has a microwave and a mini fridge it seems clean the bed is comfortable there are enough blankets and pillows.. the air conditioner works really I don't have any complaints its a good mid level hotel. Nothing fancy...but not a thing wrong.The beds are really comfortable BUT the hotel need to do a lot of cleaning up! Hallways are really stuffy due to the floors being completely carpeted. The pillows had stains on them, hair from last customer was still in the shower, sink was clogged, and nasty ROACHES on the room. This made me feel as if I was in a Motel.I stayed here during the summer. The room was clean the bed was fluffy and the breakfast wasn't to bad.Awesome breakfast area, lots of food, waffles, sausage and awesome service, staff was very friendly and rooms were nice and clean. Also call the hotel direct for the best rates, skip the hassle of hotels.com and expedia, this is def a great place to stay with a buffalo wild wings down the street!Stayed here while in Jacksonville, Fl (J-ville) for a medical conference. My company had me on a budget, which was not much. When I walked into the hotel it looked very new. While checking the GM was very helpful and lowered the rate to fit my budget, no questions asked! Through out my 3 days stay all the staff was nice and helpful. Room was cleaned everyday and the free breakfast was GREAT! I will def. stay there again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Jacksonville - Mayport / Beach
review_content: My 4-star rating takes into account that this is a Holiday Inn Express - assume nothing remarkable, but expect a clean, reasonable well-appointed room and a decent continental breakfast. This hotel meets expectations, and after a few stays here I'll give it another star for the helpful staff I've dealt with. (I know that's not in keeping with everyone's experience, but I'm starting to feel it's more the norm than the exception here.)I'll echo someone else's comments about the thin walls (not uncommon among the more budget-oriented chains), but I've not found noise to be an issue during my stays (luck with neighbors, I guess). The hotel is on a moderately busy road, but I'm normally on the side away from the street and have heard no neighborhood noise at all.I landed four hours later than anticipated last night coming in from vegas. Almost midnight and I was beat. First of all thank you for having an actual front desk number and not some call center in India as I experienced with some competitor hotels on here. Gary answered the phone when I was calling from the airport and was incredibly friendly and welcoming. He explained the UF vs Georgia game Gator Bowl is this weekend hence the rowdy atmosphere in town and there were only two rooms left. Gary assured me he'd reserve one for me and I advised I was on my way. Friendly easy check in. My room was spotless with clean crisp sheets and comfy bed. The gym was decent enough for a morning work out before the complimentary breakfast that included eggs and turkey sausage. Great stay I would recommend and stay here again. Thanks Gary!!BEWARE OF THE OTHER HOLIDAY INN DOWN THE ROAD.Knowing that our friends had already checked in and were in the room, when we arrived we headed straight up to our room. We knocked on the door and called out for our friends. Several moments passed and finally the door opened up to an elderly man. Needless to say, we were not spring breaking with the geriatrics. Whoops-- i take back that check in on Yelp.Moral of the story: if you are staying here, make sure you have the address for the right hotel.The hotel itself is nice. It's very clean and the front desk was quick to help us out with extra towels and what not. There is an outdoor pool (that may be turned into a memorial for the raccoon that died there our first night) and a fitness center.The location isn't horrible, especially for the price. It's about 20-30 minuted from the beach and nice shopping/eating centers. Also, there's lots of free parking in the area.Very nice hotel! Came from Virginia visiting with my family at Thanksgiving. The room was super clean and neat. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby. Clerks were friendly and willing to help. I'd recommend staying here for sure.Hotel was very clean. Front desk clerk was very polite...Had to give a $50 deposit when we checked in for incidentals...Front desk clerk checked our room when we checked out then returned deposit..We stayed in a queen suite...it was very spacious & the tv was a good size...pool was small & no hot tub...ice machine was on the 2nd floor on the other side of the hotel...I would think they would have one downstairs but they didnt..breakfast was good considering it is a hot breakfast I'm just not a fan of powdered eggs...but the pancakes & coffee were good. Hotel is about 5 mins away from Atlantic Bch..we left a pillow and called about 4 hrs later to see if they had it they did it was waiting at the front desk for us. I will def stay again when visiting Atlantic Bch.@HolidayInn I'm writing this review from my room at the HolidayInn Express-Mayport. After an overbooking at another hotel in Jacksonville, I bid on priceline.com and was given the HI-Mayport. This was fine by me, as the location and reviews were good for this property and my past experience with HI Express normally left me pretty happy. Unfortunately, I now have a very sour taste due to this particular hotel and am ruing having even stayed here. Knowing how Priceline assigns rooms and that my wife and son would need need to check in without me, I called the hotel yesterday evening and requested an early check in for them and stated I needed a room that would accommodate three people. The person answering the phone was quite helpful and stated there would be a room available anytime after 1pm for them.Today, My wife called and said they didn't want to let her in early and all that was available was 1 king bed w/ no additional pull out. They also wanted $10 dollars for a roll-away. I told her not to worry and I'd deal with it when I arrived, that I was sure they would accommodate us as promised.I immediately when to the front desk when I got to the property and brought up my concerns. An understatement would be that this fell upon unhelpful ears. The clerk dug in on her position and it was at that point that I realized the greed and ego of the hotel management must supersede the need for proper customer care and following through on what was promised the evening before.Will I stay at HI Express again? Of course. Will I stay for more than one evening here or ever again. No way.As a final aside, we purchased to go food from the Greek diner down the street and when we brought it back to the hotel and ate in the dining area, no one turned on any lights for us or showed us where the switches were, so we were basically left eating in the dark. See above regarding Greed.The room was spacious, and nice. I got excited when I saw the jacuzzi in the room. (Until my partner noticed that it was not so clean.) we didn't use it. Bummer. The worst part of the stay was that we could hear our neighbors next door talking, and then snoring. The walls are paper thin. The free breakfast is the typical unhealthy sugary stuff. It was no where near the beach, so for $75 per night, I wish I had stayed at a Marriott in downtown Jacksonville. Live and learn.It's a holiday inn express not a Ritz Carlton people. Great Hotel, great price. The hotel is clean, the suites are new and large and clean. The Breakfast buffet is suprisingly full of many options, hot and cold. Overall this is a great hotel and the service was fantastic as well. I am taking off a star because I booked 2 suites and we were not even on the same floor... I mean, come on!We stayed at this wonderful hotel over Memorial Day weekend for my nieces wedding! I can't say enough about the staff and accommodations ! Everyone was so helpful and friendly! Breakfast was great every morning and there was coffee available all day. The extra help and attention from Heather at the front desk was greatly appreciate! We had a great experience and would definitely stay there again!I am very unsatisfied with the service that we received here, especially one woman who works at the front desk.When we checked in, we were given a handicapped room. First of all, the front desk lady did not mention that this was going to be a handicapped room. Then when we saw the room and asked whether there was anything else available, she said that there was nothing else available that night. I understood that part of it and did not expect to get a different room the first night. However, when we asked whether we would be able to change our room the next day, she immediately said that it was not possible.She told us that since we just booked a "standard room," we did not have an option to select the room type that we wanted. So, we were only allowed to stay in "whatever was available." So if other people were checking in the next day, they would basically get a regular room (non-handicap room), but we would have to stick with what we got the first night because we had no option to select or change rooms if something opened up later.I then asked if I could pay the higher rate for the second night to get the room type that we wanted - anything other than a handicapped room. Then she said that we could not switch rooms because what we got the first night is what we got.....and that was the situation when we checked in, so therefore, we could not make a change. She said that she had spent the entire morning trying to arrange rooms for that day, so it was asking too much to change around the rooms at that point. She even said that if we were not happy with that, we can just go to a different hotel!! We would have gone to a different hotel, but we had friends that were joining us from the 2nd night, so we pretty much had to stay at this hotel. Otherwise, we would have gone to a different hotel after a front desk staff says something as RUDE as this!I have stayed at various other hotels (Marriott, Hilton, Westin) and have never dealt with anyone so rude and unaccommodating! At other hotels, when we asked if we could change rooms if anything opened up at a later time, they would respond with, "Sure, please check back with us the next day, and we will see what we can do." This lady's response was basically, "No, you cannot switch....you got what you got, and that is it." According to her, it was because we got a "standard room," and we did not select a room type....plus, we got it at the lowest fare. But if that were the case, I think we would have been able to change if we were willing to pay the extra fee to get a room of our preference from the 2nd night. It was obvious that rooms were opening up from the 2nd night because we checked online on holidayinexpress.com to see room availability, and we saw that it was indeed booked up for the 1st night, but there were rooms available from the 2nd night. Because of the experience we had, I will never stay at a Holiday Inn Express again, especially this location. The handicapped room was okay, although we had to deal with water splattering all over the bathroom floors because of the barrier free showers. That is something we could live with. In the end, our experience was TERRIBLE at this Holiday Inn Express because of one VERY RUDE front-desk personnel.On our recent trip to Florida, we started in the Jacksonville suburb of Mayport, which I guess is considered somewhat ghetto by the locals who clearly have never been to a real ghetto before. This place was a no-brainer for us to stay at because it was brand new and it stands not 200 feet from where my wife's mother lives. We got to visit the family and BONUS: we can also escape them!This place is beautiful. The rooms are gorgeously decorated, the bed is fluffy and comfortable beyond words and the price was right. For our $79 nightly we were rewarded with not only a nice bed to sleep on and a great shower to shower in, but a free breakfast that while certainly not a gourmet tour-de-force, was definitely on par with fast food and oh, did I mention? Free?The people that run the place were unobtrusive and friendly and being brand new of course, it was immaculate. Five stars. Here, after everything is over, I find myself wishing our hotel in the Keys was this nice at three times the price.To be honest I've hated every Holiday Inn I've spent the night in. So I was really pleased with the Mayport branch. The location is conveniently located near the base and exchanges with shopping centers a short drive away. The hotel looks new so the rooms were very clean with a great cable line up. The hot breakfast bar was top notch. Pancakes, eggs, bacon, and plenty of cold cereals and pastries. Can't complain for 86 dollars a night. Highly recommended.This place is great! Mr. Patel took good care of me.

After reading previous trip reviews, I knew not to expect a five star property.  The hotel is currently undergoing renovations, we received an updated room.  The room was nice, but we had two complaints:1.  The air conditioner is extremely loud.2.  The ceiling above our bathtub leaked, bad.  We let the management know about the leaking ceiling in our bathroom and he assured us he would credit our hotel stay back to my husbands accounts (we used points for the room).  Standard continental breakfast but the hot items switch from day to day (western omeletts & bacon one day, scrambled eggs and yummy potatoes the next).  You can make your own waffles, customize your oatmeal, eat some fresh fruit or try some danish.  Pool is located out back  - did not use  because of the amount of crepe myrtle flower buds floating in the pool.Location is ok.  If you don't have a car, you're out of luck.  The only thing within walking distance are other hotels (the two next door  have restaurants) and there's a Dave & Busters.  You can drive to St. John's Town Center or downtown within minutes.I checked out after 1 night. .was planning on staying up to 8 nights. Hampton inns usually very nice.  This place is an old hotel not renovated.  Lobby is small and dank.   Rooms were musty and humid.  Wall paper in bathroom peeling w rust showing.    Vending machine broken.  No water in cooler in the small dark gym. List goes on.Transfered to a courtyard inn for remainder of stay and I feel like I'm living in luxury. What a dump!I just got here and really wish I would have researched this place a little first.  It is in a terrible location with pretty much no restaraunts nearby.  It is pretty old and smells very musty.  The staff at the front desk were not friendly at all and pretty unprofessional.  The room smells terrible!!!  Verrrrry musty and mildewed.....the bed is as hard as a rock.  I can tell this is not going to be a good experience but I'm only hear a night so I guess I'll tough it outI did not give star... One of the worst Hamptons I have ever stayed at. . I do not recommend it. .dirty dirty... we got to our first room and there was construction all around us. Both rooms on either side construction. . And ac was not working. . Moved to another room.  Trash in hallways and by elevator.  Room ac was noisy. . Had to get a plunger for the toilet. . Have to use plunger every time we flush.. and got woken early this morning maid opened door and we were still sleeping. Do not disturb on door. . Do not stay here..What I like about staying at Hampton is that the chain is so consistent. I never really have to do any guess work as far what to expect. Now, this one is located in Jacksonville, and it's rather old. There needs to be some updating here. The hall ceilings are low and I feel somewhat crowded in it. The room is clean and adequate, but not anything extraordinary by any means. It's just OK.Pretty decent. Continental breakfast in the morning.Firm beds, not a big fan.Thin walls, so you can hear everything in the hallways if you are a light sleeper.Other than that, it was clean and service was friendly.I thought the King Room for $59.00 was great value. I was road weary and and it was very convenient from I-95. The lobby had been remodeled recently. By the looks they went to Ikea. Actually its a nice layout. They had a bar that served light fare like salads and sandwiches. The room was clean but not as up to date as the lobby. Some of the wallpaper was peeling of the wall.  The bed was comfortable, It had a plasma TV and free high speed internet connection.

This was the best hotel we stayed in our 11 day road trip. We almost switched hotels everyday.  The rooms were very clean, staff was very welcoming and helpful. The hotel had a decent gym and the breakfast was very hearty. They provide vouchers for in house bistro which had a decent selection for make to order items. This was a decent change for us from all the continental breakfast buffet that we had where a lot of items served seem frozen. I wish Marriott did this for all their hotels.OUTSTANDING...staff, customer service...room was nicely furnished, clean and smelled fresh.I arrived on Christmas afternoon - upon my arrival I was greeted by Annie (front desk associate) and Lindsay (front desk supervisor) both ladies were friendly, efficient, and very helpful. Checkin was very fast and was provided with the layout of the hotel...gym, business center, etc.   The lobby area appears to be newly renovated...guessing within the last year or so...everything is very clean and well designed. There is a Bistro and Starbucks in the lobby. There are quite a few TV's in the lobby and breakfast area, always displaying the weather and traffic conditions nearby. There is a pool behind the hotel, nicely fenced and very well kept.My room was located on the 5th floor on the West side...very nice layout...the bed was very comfortable, it was not too hard and not too soft. The design of the room is perfect as well which reduced the noise heard from the hallway. The room was nicely furnished, clean and smelled fresh. It came with a one cup coffee maker, but no microwave. The bathroom was also clean and very nice. The free wireless Internet access worked fine. I was impressed by how little noise I heard from other rooms. As for food there is a Cracker Barrel shares the parking lot space so you can walk to Cracker Barrel, Applebee's, or The Waffle House. . I would recommend staying here if you want a nice clean convenient hotel. As a business traveler I get the opportunity to stay in various hotels. I have to say this has to be one of the best I've stayed at in awhile. The thing I liked most about this hotel is the convenience factor of the location...right off I95 and JTB so easy on and off the highway. If you are traveling with family or needed snacks that are not in the Market store in the hotel...there is a   Publix store for groceries a few blocks away from the hotel (not walking distance) Overall I had a wonderful experience at this hotel.No room service????? 3.5 star rating. Did I wakeup in a different country? I must say everything including the $2.50 small bottle of water was good but you loose points for no room service, come on man. ...I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel! Top notch customer service! They really make you feel like you are a GUEST, and not just a customer. Always clean, always friendly - the perfect stay, if you are in Jacksonville! There are plenty of hotels in this area and this is a little hidden gem! Kudos to this hotel!From California. Stayed for a week for USATF Junior Olympics.  Staff was awesome considering we had our entire track club here! Pacific Coast Shockwaves! Over 85 kids and family! They handled it perfectly! Always polite, and courteous even with all those kids running around.  Hats off to the staff! Thanks for making our stay awesome!This is apparently the new design of Courtyards, and it's fantastic. Modern and stylish. Nice lobby and reception area. Bar and Starbucks. Free super-fast wifi.Stayed at JW Marriot flagship in Chicago last week (which was terrific) and I was snobbishly disappointed to see "Courtyard" on this week's itinerary. But I must say this place has completely exceeded all expectations (I've only been here 20 minutes so there may be some surprises, good or bad, to come...)I plan to promptly join Marriot's loyalty program.Late Christmas Eve arrival, had a wonderful greeting front desk attendant.  He was friendly and courteous. Will definitely stay here again.I love the hotel staff and they are very accommodating.  Daniel at the front desk is one of the nicest concierges I've ever worked with.  The rooms are nice and spacious.  The cleaning staff is very efficient.  I've always had great stays here.  Sometimes the wi-fi is a little slow, but at least it's included with the price of your room.The staff at the hotel have been great to work with.  We have stayed here at least 10 times since November. Each time the staff was accommodating and the facility very clean. Love that this is on the beach.This was a pretty nice Courtyard.  The lobby area has been updated to the modern look and feel; however, the rooms still have the older 90s look to them.I stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks in a row (minus the weekend). The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful with whatever I needed. Housekeeping however, was not that great. I was usually up and out very early every morning, but on 2 occasions, I had late morning appointments so I was able to get up post-dawn, where unfortunately, my slumber was disturbed by the housekeeping staff being pretty loud in the hallway. Also, they were not always good about taking the garbage and the beds looked like Goldilocks may have slept in them while I was gone!The room was pretty standard (I requested to stay in the same room for both weeks). I forgot to request a refrigerator, but they had already placed it in my room when I arrived (yeah, front desk staff!). The TV is a good size, and the bathroom is a pretty good size as well.This is the first Courtyard which I have encountered in a long time, which does not offer (complimentary) continental breakfast. I am not a big breakfast connoisseur, but the occasional bagel, yogurt, hot chocolate would be nice. They do offer however, offer a breakfast buffet and other selections, starting at $7.95. I did not have breakfast, so I cannot comment on this.The lobby is nice. There is a computer/printer available. I did some work on my laptop out by the pool one night, it looked nice, nothing extravagant, but still nice. They also offer a small bar of liquor, which can be billed to your room (again, did not partake, but noticed each night in the lobby). Complimentary copies of the USA Today and the Wall St. Journal were also available on the table, once off the elevator. They also have snacks and a cooler of soda/water available (to purchase) in the lobby.The pros for this location, is that 95 N/S are right up the street, St. Johns Town Center is only 15 minutes away, and the Jacksonville Beach is about 20-25 minutes away.There are many stores/restaurants in the area, so it is very business-traveler friendly...if only they could fix the housekeeping issue, and they may earn a 4th star next time around..Well i realize this first reason is not fully the fault of the hotel, but my experience at the hotel was rather 1-2star, and this is why. When I arrived at the hotel, it appeared there was a convention of tween cheerleaders. My only problem is that they were running up and down the halls, banging on doors and screaming pretty late into the night. I had worked a 14 hour day, and going to a business traveller hotel, that did not fit my expectations. 2nd reason: the internet did not work. the employees kept asking me if i had wireless, yes, i said, and i pulled the card out of my computer. after an hour i gave up and went to bed to clear the mind. in the morning- it was still not working, and the employees made me feel as if it were my fault. they gave me a new room, still both my PC and my Mac were not able to connect to the internet, not in my original room, not in my second room. After over 3 hours of working on getting it to work, i asked if i could just check out and go to a different hotel. i cannot afford to not be productive in the few hours i have in the hotels. so i left. when i left, i believe they still thought it was my fault the internet was not working on my computers. when i checked into the Marriott Sawgrass resort later this evening, my PC worked just fine as i plugged it into the ethernet- so i don't think it was my computers, i think it was the hotel. anyhow- a very unsatisfactory and very uncharacteristic Marriott night's stay! ( I am a Gold Elite member of Marriott, and have been in a few Marriott hotels to say the least, with no problems connecting to the internet whatsoever- across brands)

Was traveling down 95 for Christmas and could tell with traffic it would be late before we could stop. Read the reviews and all sounded pretty good, so called to make a reservation. The 800 number was confusing so hung up and tried the local #.  A lot more efficient!!  When we finally arrived exhausted , they had everything ready, sitting on the counter waiting for us.  I have never been checked in any hotel so quickly.The beds extremely comfortable and large rooms. Breakfast was very nice the next morning before finishing our trip.  Could tell by all the employees that they were on top of things!!!  Highly recommend!!!!I've stayed here several times each of them being pleasant. complementary breakfast and a one time $40 pet fee (theres also a doggie poop spot with complimentary doggie poop bags). The rooms are clean, the noise level from adjacent rooms is minimal and the staff is friendly The only negatives are that its kinda in "the cut" situated off of a main road.... In the boonies, and the ice and vending machines on the second floor were non existent. Other than that I'm a fan. And this is my go to hotel for quick family visits. Also there is a waffle house one block away (before the A1A overpass that is AMAZING!)When I am visiting family, I often decide to stay here and every visit is great. There are many pros to staying here:  It is located right next to I295, it is tucked away so the sound of the interstate is muffled and there is no other buildings or hotels where it is located. The hot breakfast includes sausage, turkey sausage, eggs, biscuits, gravy, and there may be a variance in how the eggs are prepared. There is cereal, bagels, muffins, fruit, juice station, coffee station, yogurt and more. The dining area if off the check in counter and it is very spacious with tables and a "living room" style set up with couches and a tv on one side. I always get the single room with king size bed. This room has a small sectioned off area with a love seat, recliner, coffee table, microwave and mini refrigerator. Very spacious room. The hotel staff are always friendly and accommodating. The property is well maintained. There is ample parking and grass around to take dogs for a walk or to potty. I have not gone to the pool or used any other amenities to provide a review on those aspects of the hotel. The free wifi is very fast and what I liked which was not in effect the last time I was here is that the net doors of the hotel require key access to enter after a certain time at night. If no key then there is an option to ring the doorbell. So, here is why this is a 4 star review. The shower head for this particular room was mediocre, the water is hard (just Jacksonville area in general), the toilet flushed but I had to press the lever all the way down then manually lift it to the upright position if not it would run all night. The location is good but hard to find because it sits right between a Mitsubishi car dealership and the interstate. It's easy to miss but there is a light shortly nearby and a U turn can be made with ease. There is repaving of the roads so the street is more difficult to see right now. Also, there is no sign near the street with a sign die ring you to the hotel but there is a large billboard with the word "addicted"  above the street sign that can be used as a clear landmark. There is a one time pet fee of $40 but many places have one. This is my hotel of choice in Jacksonville.This was one of the nicer Holiday Inn Expresses that I have been to. The room was huge, clean, great pillows, and you can never go wrong with a whirlpool tub in your room.  The breakfast was good, considering what it is.  The cinnamon rolls are so good!Clean room and great contential breakfast. Elevators are a little slow. Staff is friendly. Plenty of parking.We were planning a trip to Jacksonville and I have a special discount link so I tend to stay at the Holiday Inn chains. This particular room, because I booked early, was booked at a great rate. I was booking for 5 people so we had two double beds and a pull out couch. The couch area was separated by a short half wall so the room was a good size! It had a microwave and fridge which was handy as we were in town for a long weekend (4 days, 3 nights). A huge pet peeve of mine is a crappy exhaust fan in the bathroom. After a steamy shower, it's annoying as all get out if you can't use the mirror in the bathroom because of being steamed over but this exhaust fan was PHENOMENAL! I even tested it and didn't run the fan until after my shower. By the time I put my face cream on and brushed my teeth, the exhaust fan had cleared the mirror up completely. This particular location also served a free hot breakfast with several options such as bacon/sausage, eggs, biscuits, sausage gravy, yogurt, cereals, muffins & bagels, fruit, coffee, juices and a pancake maker that pops out two small pancakes. No issues with the room or the staff, very pleasant stay, and the beds were so comfy that it was easy to rest well during my stay. Also even though right behind the hotel is a poor area, that didn't take away from the great location because we were 10 to 15 miles from everything we were going to (downtown Jacksonville, beach, etc). Not a whole lot in that area as far as nice places to eat or bars/clubs, but we just drove into the downtown area for all of that. Two thumbs up!!Friendly staff, nice breakfast, good hotel, but The housekeeper didn't come to our room :$

Breakfast is not free but other than that, we love our stay . It's very clean . The people that works there are very nice . I would definitely come back .Big lobby.  Breakfast isn't free.  kids who are 11 and younger are free.  Swimming was small but nice.  Jacuzzi was warm but did not work.  It was located in the cuts, but there was a Cracker Barrel within walking distance.  Overall, it was nice.Rating:Clean:  4Price:  2  (it was expensive)Service:  4Overall:  4Would come back and stay here.Great staff, nice hotel. Reasonable. Pool is ok..has hot tub too. Pancakes at breakfast are tasty. Breakfast is not included 9.95 per person extra. Would go back. Rooms are clean and bed was comfortableClean rooms, good size bathrooms. Very comfortable bed. But what I was most impressed with was the staff. From the people at the front desk, to the wait staff at breakfast, they just couldn't be more friendly. Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable.The hotel appears to be recently remodeled and is very clean. From my experience, the staff is very helpful and does whatever to make your stay happy. For instance, the front desk unlocked the pool for my boys an hour early on a Sunday morning. Room was spacious and it's nice having the afternoon snacks downstairs. Side note, there is a lot of construction around the hotel at the moment, but the hotel itself is in great shape.Don't eat their breakfast.  I had a bowl of the box cereal and was charged 10.65. You might as well go next door to Cracker Barrel, and eat for 9 dollarsgreat stay.We had wonderful service and rooms were very clean will stay again if we pass throughWe stayed here for two nights.  From the moment we walked in we were treated like royalty.  Everyone that worked there was very friendly and very accommodating. My daughter was sick one night and they offered ginger ale and crackers and asked if there was anything they could do.  The staff was always smiling and ready to help in any way. They even called me after I had left because I left a card behind with a check in it. They found it when cleaning the room.  Now that is service.  Honesty is a virtue  that you do not always see.  They went above and beyond to get that check back to me.  Clean, comfortable and good food.  What more do you need.  We highly recommend you check it out.Very nice Hilton! Very clean and well maintained.  The staff was great.  Able to answer questions about places to go near by and with just general things you may need while in a hotel.   The room was very spacious and the bathroom was roomy.   I liked the fact that you could open the room windows.  It would have been nice if it had a restaurant or bar attached like most seem to.   Breakfast was available for 9.95 but didn't explore that option.  Hot Tub outside kept at 104 and was very clean.   The only thing I didn't like was the air conditioning unit vents in the hallway were on full blast and it was only 65 degrees outside. The hallways were freezing!I coordinated a stay here for the parents of an ill service member who had been flown in due to their child's condition.  The staff was very compassionate and accommodating and really went out of their way to help us out.  The lobby was very classy looking.One of the good Hilton's that I have stayed in the Jacksonville/Orange Park area.  The hotel is pretty clean, the staff is very friend, rooms are cleaned on a daily basis.  There are no bugs to fight like I have experienced with other hotels in the area.  The only con to this place would be the gym, they say it opens at 6 but you can get in before 6 as well.  They only have treadmill and one elliptical machine which makes it hard for a person like me (not motivated at all) to wait around if it is already taken.  Apart from that this is a pretty good hotel to staty at in the area.I like this hotel - I would recommend it and I'd stay here again.  Here's why.  The hotel is very clean; my room was comfortable; the staff was very nice to me - and - the hotel food is actually very good and not over-the-top price wise. (obviously, it's still "hotel" prices)I spent a couple of nights here and basically have no complaints.  There were not many guests, it seems, this particular weekend and it was nice and quiet during the night.  In my room, the bed was comfortable and the room had the usual amenities: coffee, frig, satellite TV with HBO, iron, etc., etc.They have a breakfast and dinner option in their dinning room which is located in their main lobby.  I did not notice a "free" breakfast option.  As I enjoy a quiet setting for both, I decided to sit there and have dinner one night.  On this night - I was the only person there. I can't imagine this is the norm. There were two LCD TV's and they were very willing to give me the remote control to change the channel how ever I saw fit.  The dinner staff was very friendly and I enjoyed a relaxing evening watching TV.  That's the type of stuff that makes staying away from home - in a hotel - enjoyable: Warm and friendly; laid back; no stress.  I enjoyed my stay.If you stay here, I hope you enjoy it as well.My husband and I had our wedding at nearby venue, the Winterbourne Inn.  My husband contacted several hotels in the area to set-up a block of rooms for us and our guests.  The Hilton Garden won out easily, due in no small part to the amazing customer service provided by their Head of Sales, Becky Schaeffer.  Becky was incredibly responsive throughout the whole process and gave us an unbeatable deal.Aside from the wonderful customer service, the hotel itself is very nice.  We had over twenty rooms in our block and I didn't hear one negative comment from any of our guests.  The rooms were clean and furnished nicely.  The lobby turned out to be a great spot for our guests to mingle before and after events.The breakfast in the lobby was a great value.  All the guests received $5 vouchers, which cut the costs virtually in half (originally $10.65).  Even at full price the breakfast would be at least on par in terms of both cost and quality.Good hotel & staff.I stayed here a year ago for a conference and I would rate them a 2-3 on the staff experience I had, but after I notified the manager and the way he handeled the situation I would have to rate them no lower than a 4 star. The hotel is newly built and very clean (the surrounding area is a little sketchy...but it's mainly military). My first night I was hanging up my clothing and there were about 5 hangers in the closet, I needed about 4-5 more, I called the front desk and asked if it would be possible to have more hangers, they said I needed to come to the front desk to pick them up (it was 8:30 pm), I went down and picked up the hangers. The next night I couldn't find a remote in my room, it was maybe 10 pm, I called the front desk and explained the situation...they said I would need to come down to the front desk to pick up the remote...I said no way...I was in my pajamas and I was not about to go down there at that hour, I would just manually change the channel (they brought up the remote in 3 minutes). The very last night I was SO thirsty and did not have cash, I called room service and said I wanted to order a bottle of water and 2 sodas (I would gladly pay the room service fee also), they explained that room service could not deliver drinks, only food, and if I wanted the drinks I would need to AGAIN go to the front desk...I declined and drank tap water. The next week I wrote to the manager of the hotel and explained the type of service I had, but I thought the hotel was very nice. He was very apologetic and explained this would never happen again. He even offered me a free night on my next Hilton stay, I said that was not necessary and I just wanted to bring it to his attention. All in all, I WOULD reccomend this hotel to someone who needs to stay in this area. The manager was VERY helpful and seemed very customer friendly.Not a place you want to go if you want to watch TV. we told the front desk our TV didnt work and they gave us another room and that TV didnt work. and there was nobody on the property that could fix it. spoke to Manager and request a new room to no avail. I wont be back

This hotel wasn't bad for the price. You get what you pay for. When we checked in we were able to get our room fairly quickly. We noticed that previous reviews are still current in regards to the slow draining shower. The continental breakfast was decent nothing fancy but better than pastries. Not a bad place and pretty close to restaurants and beach.Never ever would I return! I booked this hotel for 5 nights and already had my first bad experience with the check-in. 40 minutes later i got my keys, went to the room and saw how dirty it was. Napkins and straws were laying on the floor and the painting was not on the wall, it is (even after 5 nights) just sitting on the floor. One evening (6.30) I came back and the room was not made! The reason:They were fully booked! Is this a joke? This is a hotel, if you need more help then hire more people! The shower was terrible, as the water does not go down you are basically taking a bath! As they have a sign for not changing sheets daily, unless you request and put the note back on the bed. I did so the 4th night as i scratched myself and had a little blood mark on the sheet. I came back in the evening and the sheets have not been changed although requested! Never ever again!!! Spend your money somewhere elseThis is a great place if you are an insomniac or a vampire. Rooms are not soundproof- mine is practically in the elevator. Bathroom so small you fall into toilet getting out of shower. Free breakfast awful. Do yourself a favor, sleep in your car.We stayed here in March 2015 when going to the march madness basketball tournament. We wanted a cheap place to stay because we weren't in town long. Unfortunately it didn't even meet up to those standards. I've stayed at best western's before and this is below par for their quality. The bed wasn't very comfy and the hallways and room had a funky smell. It kind of smelled damp. Blech! Glad we only stayed here 1 night. One plus is that it was in a fairly convenient location to get to from the highway. They do offer free breakfast but its not worth it.Price ok.  Pet friendly.Stay away if you wish to shower.  There was standing water in the tub when I thought about taking a shower.  Skipped shower.I dont normally run the shower for 20 mins before getting in, but when I do I hope the water gets hit by then..... Nope, not happening. Stay away if you like to shower.Out dated hotel. Towels are like sandpaper. And can hear everything thru the walls. Seriously hammering woke us up....renovationg they need to close while this work is being done.     I'm only here one nite!Time to check outThe hotel was clean. The bed was comfortable. The tv system was new. Staff members were nice and went the extra mile to make certain our questions were answered. I would recommend this location.The service was very nice and timely, I believe the person  that helped me was Barbara and she may have been the Supervisor.The sheets where not new.. Found hair on the pillow. The water in the shower was actually slimy.. Soap could not remove the slippery feeling on your skin. I've never experienced this before. wow. "Do not disturb" door hanger apparently means: please disturbed me with house keeping. It did no good to say do not disturb.. Management take note and get this place into gear.. I would not stay here again.Take a trip back to the nineties! This hotel needs a definite makeover. What I will start out with saying though is that the staff is very nice and professional. It was the first time I received a phone call to my room asking me if everything was acceptable; however, service can only do so much for an outdated and old-minded establishment. The other reviews here are correct in stating that this hotel still has smoking vs. non-smoking rooms. I opted for non-smoking and we didn't have any of the cigarette smelling issues the other posters had. Yet, that's about all I can say for the rooms. From the stained dingy green carpets to the nineties headboards and 'mod-contemporary' art for that time period, these rooms do not generate any sighs of relief after a long days drive (check out the images I've attached). Your bathroom will have the bare amenities, along with your antiquated chipped nineties tub. Everything is thin, from your towels, to your carpet, to your sheets. And though you won't find any (because the dated flourescent lights probably keep them away), you'll be wondering where the buggies are hiding. I was surprised that this hotel had a three star rating, though, after checking the hotel rating system, I see that they barely scrounged by. They advertise a workout room that has your basic weight machine and cardio equipment, but one look at the sweat covered machines, dusty carpet, and bare walls may scare you away. All in all, you get what you pay for. If you need a cheap place to stay for one night and don't care about the room, feel free to stay at this place. D&B's down the road for some mild entertainment. Don't think you're getting a steal though for a three-star hotel. This place barely cuts it.
