If you do happen to find yourself at this time machine back to the nineties and are in need of some grub, check out Thai Spice Kitchen. It's 8 minutes away and some of the best Thai food you'll ever get for cheap. Two can easily eat under $25.Yuck. My nonsmoking room, even though surrounded by nonsmoking rooms as well still reeked of smoke in the bathroom in the mornings and evenings. It was so strong that it gave me headaches. I recommend that nonsmokers DO NOT book here. The front desk lady is a sweetheart and the hotel itself is quite nice. The hotel should really take a page out of other chains books and switch to an entirely nonsmoking hotel. This is the only reason for the lower rating.Stayed there this weekend. Rooms might have been updated since some of the previous posts, but the room we stayed in was clean and comfortable, and I am a little snobby when it comes to hotel rooms, lol.Breakfast was rather blah, however. The "scrambled eggs" that the front desk told us about were not scrambled really, but just an egg "patty" that looked like it had been around a while. No bacon (horrors!), just sausage, gray gravy to accompany, dry biscuits, some yogurt and fresh fruit to round it out. I went to Waffle House after that. Each night when we would return, we parked in the back lot. Many times there were multiple smokers crowding the rear entrance, so you had to weave your way through a bunch of second hand smoke, yuck. Not sure why they don't put up signs saying not to smoke so close, but oh well. On a side street, but there is a Dave and Buster's just down the way. If D&B is not your style, then you do have to jump in the car to find something more entertaining.I stayed here this past weekend, let me tell you, what a disappointment. The room was clean but when I went to make coffee in the morning, the coffee maker was still dirty from the previous guest. I decided to get some coffee downstairs and wasn't good for the first cup, second cup apparently the machine didn't have anymore coffee. Breakfast is included with the stay and the hours of operation was from 7am-9:30. My boyfriend and I arrived at 9am one morning and 8:40 the other morning and there was nothing. Only thing left was grits and bread, I'm surprised there wasn't an employee to constantly be checking the breakfast room. I ended up spending money on breakfast anyway. I specifically chose this hotel for the free breakfast to try to save some money. Moving on from food, one of the key cards that was given to me wasn't programmed correctly, when I tried to enter the hotel past 1am I couldn't get in. I had to wait for an employee to open the door for me. Overall, it was a very unpleasant stay. I won't be staying in a Best Western again, nor will I recommend it to anyone.Modern building with clean rooms in good condition.  AT check-in I was not asked if I wanted a room with two beds.  I forgot to ask.  Got to room, it was a bit small with only one bed.  I was told they didn't have any more rooms with 2 beds.WiFi signal was very fast.  Desk Had multiple power outlets.  Clearly good things for business traveler.Room had no "Do not disturb" sign.Got to breakfast toward the end.  OJ was watery.  Coffee was weak.  No cream.  No whole milk.  No bagels.  No English muffins.  Not sure what they had at the start.In an isolated area with only other hotels nearby.  Nothing you can walk to.  No restaurant in building.The Bellboy needs to learn / train to be courteous. We were waiting for the elevator for a few minutes when the bellboy showed up with this cart and a customer just as the elevator opened. He practically pushed his way into the elevator, with his cart and a customer and filled up the elevator with total disregard of those that we were there before him.  A guy like this shouldn't be working in the service sector if he has NO manner. He reflects badly on the business. Other than, it was an OK quality as far as the cleanliness of the room goes.I stayed here during their construction time and had a good overall experience, clean rooms, classy setting and smiling staff. It was a little noisy but that's something you cannot control during construction. I look forward to revisiting the newly renovated Best Western.Clean room, but what I enjoyed most about this hotel is the staff. The staff here is so nice, I wish I remember some of their names to list them here. Their friendly and attentive, I had left some stuff in the room and they let me in the following day to pick it up. If I am ever back in the area will definitely be staying here again.I was supposed to stay here for 3 nights during memorial day weekend but left after the 2nd night. I really tried to keep an open mind here but this hotel was gross. First they gave us a room that was supposedly non-smoking but it smelled like a fresh cigarette. We asked for a new room which they gave us right away, explaining that the floor we were on was sandwiched between smoking floors. Well the new room they gave us didn't smell smokey but it certainly had its own funky smell. We decided it was no big deal and didn't feel like complaining again.Eventually I noticed how yucky the new room was though, the bathroom was rusty looking and my husband felt it was pretty unsanitary. The carpet was so gross and muggy, in one spot it was noticeably wet! Like a puddle. After stepping in that I didn't want to take off my shoes at all. We noticed the funky smell started to change, it kept getting worse and by the 3rd night it smelled completely rancid. Which is what prompted us to leave so abruptly. My husband and my 6 month old son were coughing and so congested they couldn't breathe properly, non of us were getting sleep! We did try switching rooms again but they were all booked. At the least they did refund our money for that last night.The full breakfast was disappointing. Food was pretty unappetizing and there wasn't much selection. The coffee sucked. Also I don't know what was wrong with there elevator. It was not only slow but disobedient. This computer had a mind of its own, I swear. It would just open up wherever it wanted to and not on command. I think I sat watching it go up and down past my floor like 3-4 times before I couldn't take it anymore and took the stairs! Plus it came pretty close to closing on me at one point.Nice and clean on the outside and in the lobby.  Not so much on the room.  AC didn't work very well.  Pillows were terrible.  I would not recommend.
review_content_20: If you like the incessant noise of jackhammers,then this is the place for you. Plenty of other hotels in the vicinity.Go somewhere else. We have stayed at this place three times on our way to vacation. This place is showing it's age and is in disrepair with no work being done to improve it year over year. Last time we went to check in the servers were down and had to wait over a half hour with no compensation offered. Every time we come here there is not enough luggage carts and you have to wait a long time to get one.The rooms need a big overhaul. The carpets are stained, floor tiles are cracked, doors hinges are rusted and noisy, poor selection of TV channels, poor lighting, beds and linen suck.The breakfast area is a disaster. It is very small and poorly set up.I am done with this place and will not return. We were suppose to stay on our way back home but cancelled and stayed in a much better place.For the price it was hard to beat. Thank God for Hotwire. Front desk was GREAT. (Go Noles). I can't remember his name but I noticed the Seminole pin on his shirt and said "it's great to know I'm not the only one in the city" and he said he would give me the Seminole hook up! On top of that there were signs posted saying they were 95% non smoking. Got off the elevator and onto our floor and I smelled ?!? I just assumed it was old smoke? But was extremely thankful that we had a non-smoking room. SO I still have no idea what the smell was but after a few days I forgot all about it. (Even if you are a smoker - NO ONE wants a smoking room.)The rooms were a good size with a pool view (not much of a pool) but there was a fridge but no microwave. Then there was the old school big box TV which would have been just fine if the picture quality wasn't so bad. It looked like I was watching a movie from the 80's. Then there was the curtain that was broken BUT the bed was great. The bed was like a bubble bath with nice dark chocolate and champagne. I slept in a way that felt sinful in that bed. I refused to guess how many people have left in it before me I just hope they had as good of an experience as I did. Bathrooms a little awkwardly placed?So the hotel says they have a "continental breakfast." Nastiest thing in the world. Eggs that tasted like Styrofoam. (SO SERIOUS). Cereal, mini muffins, dry waffles, juice, and coffee. I think that was about it. They could have saved the food and just lowered the cost of the rooms by $1. So we headed to Waffle House the 2nd morning. But it all not a bad hotel.Pretty average. Decent price. Small pool. Breakfast was here to be eaten but not so much enjoyed. The food was cleared away promptly at 9:30. It's isolated if you don't have a car. I good place if you are just using the room to sleep in.I stayed here for one reason and one reason only: it was cheap.  The old phrase "you pay for what you get" holds true.  It was in a decent location for me because it was close to where I was doing some work, but when I go back I'm staying somewhere else.  Check-in was painless and the front desk guy was nice and knowledgeable about the area.  The room on the other hand was pretty crappy.  I got a smoke-free room.  I was a little shocked that the entire hotel wasn't smoke-free.  The decor was outdated and the bed was uncomfortable.  I don't know why all the hotels are using these little pillows now.  Instead of having two normal sized pillows on each bed, they have four small pillows per bed.  I don't like that.The TV reception was poor.  It had about 20 channels to choose from, but they were all slightly fuzzy and the TV was old.  The AC worked well and so did the iron.  I didn't hear any noise from the other rooms, so the sound proofing was decent.The continental breakfast was pretty lame.  It is held in a tiny dining room with about 10 tables.  The food is cooked and set out in serving trays.  It is not placed in warming trays, so it will sit there and get cold.  There is a microwave in there, so I believe the guests are expected to reheat the food after dishing it up.  This is a pain because the microwave is right next to a table and it blocks traffic.This hotel is completely and totally... Fine. It's pretty unremarkable in every way - which is both good and bad. It's clean enough, the beds are fine and the staff was very predictable and normal. It's a bit out of the way and the breakfast was barely edible - even for a 2 star hotel breakfast. That's my only real complaint. There is nothing special here but nothing to rally my rage against either. It's mad cheap though, so go through Priceline and save some Ching-Ching...Rooms smell like disinfectant and rooms are barren. You can feel the springs in the bed and the rates aren't worth it. The only redeeming quality is the helpful nature of the service- excellent front desk workers who are knowledgeable and really try to get you the best rate.

review_content: I loved this stay, I checked in on the way back from our trip, we were extremely tired and this is exactly what I needed. I highly recommend this hotel! Amazing bed and the breakfast is delicious.Came in at midnight. Front desk person was friendly. Room exactly what I expected.  Neat, clean, and bed was heaven. Today I woke up refreshed and in a great mood. Breakfast was great and the entire staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Only passing through but great spot thanks to the concistancy that the Hilton brands are known for.Hampton Suites JacksonvilleVery good location.  About 7 minutes driving away from the airport, ample parking spaces, and across from the parking lotare the restaurants Ruby Tuesday and Longhorn Steakhouse.  Publix supermarket and more restaurants is about 10 minutesaway by car.Room was spacious, quiet, and clean, what I have come to expect from Hampton hotels.Front desk was courteous, and the morning breakfast had hot food: eggs, sausage, and hashbrowns.There are enough hotels in the area so I'd suggest passing on this one. The same B.O. smell that another reviewer noted 7 months ago was very strong in the lobby.   Room had an older floor heater/ac unit that didn't easily regulate. The airport shuttle also stops at 2 other hotels so when they are busy it takes more time than you might expect. I will say that staff were very pleasant and that is appreciated.Room was very clean.  As was the lobby and the fitness center.  I used the stairs mostly and there was a strange B.O. Type smell on that end of the first floor... But the place is well appointed and had recently been renovated.  I would stay here again when visiting Jacksonville.TV very dim without adjustmentBeds little lumpy but still comfortable Pillows very soft and need all 3 for one personBreakfast spread is actually pretty good as they have lots of options.Eggs though have this weird cheese inside- no buenoYou can make your own fresh waffles a+ there I guessNice, clean and 3 minutes from the airport. Very friendly staff.Hotel is clean and comfortable.  Front staff was welcoming, even when checking in at 11pm.  Would stay here again.  Breakfast was actually pretty goo:  make your own waffles, eggs, etc.Nothing wrong at all here.  Clean.  Comfy. Convenient to airport.  Quiet.  Will definitely stay here again if business calls.Wanted something close to Airport. This was perfect. Hospitable, friendly and a quick and easy check in.  Room was comfortable and very clean. Morning breakfast looked nice, but an early morning flight left me taking a very nice "Breakfast on the Go" to the airport. Great place to stay if you need to be close to the Airport.Quick and easy same-day reservations by phone.  They have a big parking lot right out front.  Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly woman at the desk and given our room keys and some cookies!  Room was clean and smelled good.  Towels were really soft and shower has good water pressure.  Bed is soft and a bit bouncy with lots of pillows.  Breakfast is free and served from 6-10, but I left at 5:30 so they gave me a bagged breakfast (brown bag filled with an apple, cereal bar, bottled water and blueberry muffin).  Free airport shuttle is 24 hours and the ride to JAX is only 5 minutes.  Definitely a great place to stay!Hotel is nice - seems like recently remodeled.  Rooms are clean and bathroom is spacious.  Checked in in the middle of the night and the person at the front desk seemed annoyed but other than that all has been great.

I just completed a 5 night stay at this hotel (booking through hotels.com, my rate was less than $100 per night), and I will absolutely be staying here again the next time we are in Jacksonville. Why? 1. Location- It's within walking distance to a Starbucks, Panera, Harbor Freight, and several shopping plazas filled with useful stores.2. Amenities- This hotel gives you everything you need to feel at home- without charging for any of it! Wifi, huge continential breakfast each morning (this morning was scrambled eggs, potatoes and bacon, plus a waffle maker, 3 kinds of juice, yogurt, oatmeal, grits, tea and coffee, plus one of those fancy coffee makers like they have at wawa that makes french vanilla lattes, cereal, cinnamon rolls, biscuits, english muffins and toast and bagels, and all the fixins for everything... oh yes and fresh fruit), bottled water in the rooms, a refrigerator in the room, cookies and fruit in the lobby at all times, extra toiletries like makeup removers provided daily... truly, I can't think of one thing we needed that we didn't have available in the hotel.3. Comfort- Our room was spacious and comfortable. It was close to the lobby but quiet, the bathroom was older but very clean and well-kept, and the beds were comfortable. I'd also be remiss if I didn't point out that the staff was uniformly great. The front desk sent around a note giving guests the option to forgo room cleaning on Thanksgiving, so housekeeping staff could leave early for the holiday. We thought that was super nice, and did opt to forgo service. Our room attendent was Kelly, and she was great- asked us if we needed more toiletries, left our daughters bed all laid out and ready for her each evening... just very welcoming and friendly service... and my daughter loved the lady doing breakfast each morning- she stopped and chatted with us, and was super helpful and kind in the mornings. Everyone who helped us was great, and made our stay memorable.The bed and pillows were super comfy. The room smelled of mold and carpet was damp. There were some black moldy spots on the ceiling. The staff was super friendly. Starbucks, Panera, amd Applebee's are steps away. Ice machine and vending available. Breakfast and cookies available.Very inexpensive...clean, neat, great breakfast. ..staff is unbelievably friendly!!!!! We were there 7 nights and we will be there again next week for another 7... Fridge and microwave in room..As other reviewers stated, walking distance, literally across the street and next to several restaurants, Starbucks.. and right off the highway...LOVE these folks.... we are going back!!!I have stayed here on many business trips. The rooms are quite nice and the service is friendly and prompt.After experiencing my worst nightmare down the street from this hotel, I was pleasantly surprised at the kind, caring customer service representative who greeted me. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. What a joy to stay in such a welcoming place!After coming in from a really horrible hotel experience, I was warmly greeted and informed that there was food (including wine) on the house. I was upgraded to a beautiful room with a big tub for free. Beds were super comfortable, everything felt clean... Down feather pillows... Thank you for this!!!!Wow. To be greeted by hotel staff and also have them say, "Oh, there's wings, beer, and, chili in the dining area. On the house, too," was enough to make me a fan of this place. The rooms were cozy, the price was fair, and all was as expected. Nothing to complain about at all. The only thing I'd offer as a change is the bar soap they have in the bathrooms. My goodness. Please change it. It's the kind of slimy soap that doesn't wash off of your hands....or at least feels like it doesn't....ever.All in all a cozy stay!Comfy king bed - clean room - books to borrow-take at the front desk- we couldn't find a room from above savannah till we got here and I was afraid of what we were gonna find but was very pleasantly surprised- great place!!Courteous, friendly staff. Weird temperature differentials in the room - a bit humid. Small pool area. Nice amenities. Walking distance to Starbucks, Ted's, Applebee's and more.Great hotel. Cheap, bars and restaurants are in walking distance, its clean, friendly staff, good shampoo and conditioner, pillows and mattresses are wayyy nicer than any ramada and complimentary alcohol and food on wednesdays from 5-7 only reason its not 5 stars is because its not some fancy hotel...Staff was great. Rooms were nice though very humid. I had two rooms for our party and both had the smell of men's cologne. I didn't use pool or business center, but breakfast was pretty good. Wifi with my iPad was not very strong, but good with computer.Clean and courteous. Relatively affordable too!

It is unlike me to write a short review, but it feels like whenever I write a Holiday Inn Express review (and I've written a few), they all seem to say just about the same thing. Why? Because Holiday Inn has thoroughly taken their 'Express' brand of hotels and made them all so similar and consistent that you absolutely know what you are going to get. Sure they all look different inside, but the room sizes (especially the suites), the modern decor, amenities and that fabulous hot breakfast are something you can count on every time you book a stay at an Express.It baffles me that the Express brand is actually nicer most times than a regular Holiday Inn. Since it's conception in 1952, this hotel chain has been designed to make family travel more pleasant and affordable. Legend has it that Kemmons Wilson was unhappy with the choices in hotels after a family vacation in 1951 and wanted to create a place that didn't surcharge him for his children and offered a pool for entertaining them. So he created Holiday Inn.Since 2007, Holiday Inn Expresses across the country have been under renovation to improve the look and image of the brand. It became our go-to hotel for family road trips until about 2012 when the cost of all those renovations began to creep its way into the room rates. Prior to that year, I could get a room for around $79 per night, then it jumped to $89, then $99, then $109 until I found myself paying $189 at one of their premier locations. It was then we decided to part ways with HIE and switched our loyalties to the other Choice Hotel brands such as Quality Inn and Comfort Inn. Everything Holiday Inn stands for is important to me, but so is the price. We have to be savvy as a family when budgeting so that we can get the max out of our vacations. We are not the go to the beach all day every day sort of family. We are explorers and want to see everything a new destination has to offer. The only way we can do that is choosing a hotel that keeps our nightly rates affordable, allowing us to splurge elsewhere in the budget on adventures. For us, HIE has lost its affordability factor, but we still love the brand and will occasionally book rooms when our budget is a little healthier.FINAL THOUGHTSThe Double Queen Suite os the only way to go for a family of four (+ a baby)! Two Queen beds and a pull-out sofa give plenty of sleeping space. Breakfast at this particular location was exceptional (considering it is complimentary):Scrambled EggsBoiled EggsMake your own pancakesHamSausageSausage gravyBiscuitsPLUS a variety of cereals, yogurts, fruits, juices, and coffees as well as those famous Holiday Inn Express hot cinnamon buns. Okay, so maybe this wasn't a short review. I had more to say than I thought I did... LOL! In summary, I'd just like to say we are always pleased with our stay at Holiday Inn Express, even if we aren't always pleased with the price.2016/49Staff was very friendly when we checked in. Accepts pets. They don't have a designated spot for dogs to do there business, bring your own bags. There do have grassy areas. Clean rooms after we removed to a different room. The first room we went into smelled like cigarette smoke. The lady said that the whole hotel was non smoking. So that was weird but once we got to the room it smelled clean. The outdoor pool was really nice, perfect to fight off summertime Florida weather. It's really clean. I didn't use the gym. I saw it though, just cardio machines. The free breakfast hit the spot. I would stay here againstI checked in 6am and Jamie ( the staff member) let me stay until the next day. It was very honest and kind, most hotels would me do the check out at noon and would have to pay one more night . The breakfast was good, small with couple of options. The room was reasonable , clean and organized. Would stay here again.Fancy? Hell no. Clean, quiet with nice staff? Hell yes!No bells or whistles (unless you count complimentary mouth wash, which is really nice in this age of plastic baggies on plans for your liquids) this is a clean, calm, humid site to do whatever you have to do in Jacksonville.Pretty basic room, clean, with fridge & microwave: 2.5 stars.Again, I found the front desk staff amazingly awesome.  A colleague and I arrived from our respective red-eye flights from SF at 10 am and the front desk upgraded us to mini-suites to make up for not having rooms available when we tried to check in at 11 (their check out is late--12 pm!) and the woman was gracious and incredibly polite despite our very early arrival. A+ + 1 star.This ain't a plush hotel, but unlike you a plush hotel, you get free wireless. +1. But it sucks. -1. Still, I've paid nearly $20/day for horrible internet, so final score: +0.5Tucked away in a business park, this isn't, um, happening Jacksonville (if such a place exists) but it gets the job done at a very reasonable rate. Unsolicited & slightly random review: if you find yourself in the Jax area, check out 96.9 The Eagle. The most awesome, cheesy-ass 70's-80's power-rock station I've ever heard. Our entire crew was rocking out to it until we lost it on our way to Daytona Beach. I cried a little Foreigner-Bon Jovi-REO Speedwagon-Journey-Queen tear. The awesomeness overwhelmed me. I need to find out if they have an Internet feed.Never again.It has a funny smell that's not really funny.  It's kinda old.  The air system is loud in the rooms, and well, my cable quit working during the visit.I mean, it's not God awful.  It is clean.  It does serve its purpose.  Nothing more.  If you just need a place to crash for sleep, then ok.  Pets are allowed, so if you hear barking during your visit, know that it is real and you're not crazy.If you want a little bit more, keep on moving.Stay was OK. I think this is the older styling of HI expresses. Check in was a bit difficult. Pet friendly but pretty much NO PLACE to walk a dog. At all. Staff didn't seem overly friendly. Housekeeping started banging around really early in the morning which made for a rough start. Overall, I wouldn't return for a second visit. There's a ton of hotels in that area and I wasn't given a good reason to want to return again.This hotel made me a believer- in Holiday Inns that is. My last few hotel experiences have not gone well, so I was pleasantly surprised with the price, beds, rooms, staff, and everything. We booked online, so we got a better deal, however, Holiday inns are now my go-to hotels!!!Just another hotel, nothing special. My upgrade was to the handicap suite.

Staff was exceptional and accommodating after a bad experience with the Radisson next door (where I was supposed to be staying). I was able to walk up and get a room and sympathy for my situation (with my 2 children).Hotel was clean and comfortable. They even provided umbrellas at the door for guests because of the rain. I would only expect it from a higher end hotel so this was definitely a plus.The worst Marriott ever.  Very outdated and over priced.  Old televisions and bad odor in some rooms.  Very unpleasant experience. I wouldn't let my pet stay there.   Someone needs to report this hotel to the better business bureau!!!This is a ghetto Marriott! Sad since the place looks nice and they have an indoor and outdoor pool. Who does construction at 6:45 AM on a Saturday!!!! This is unacceptable. I didn't pay money to stay here so I could hear power drills and tape being pulled and ripped every 5 seconds. Called the front desk and they didn't do a damn thing but say we will tell the manager to contact you. When will that happen? The damn manager isn't even here yet. Went downstairs and they said sorry they aren't suppose to start construction until 12. Then how come you haven't told them to stop yet?! I will be calling corporate.LOVELY! I walked in and was immediately impressed by the interior design. They have their bar right in front as you walk in the main entrance, along with free citrus water and mint cucumber water right as you walk in. The staff is very courteous and their customer service is top notch. I came here for a business meeting and was impressed by the cleanliness of the hallways, bathroom and the conference room. The outdoor pool is absolutely GORGEOUS! I wanted to jump right in for a night swim after my meeting, but that might have been a bit unprofessional... but that is how inviting the pool looked. Overall, I haven't stay in any of the rooms, but if you're looking for somewhere to have a business function, this is a great place to do it.Service in this hotel is outstanding! Staff truly cares about guest needs. Rooms are clean, spacious and up to date. Two pools indoor and outdoor. Fitness center has plenty of different equipment. If your in the area would certainly recommend this hotel.Super nice!!! Clean rooms!!! Nice beds super comfy. Front desk super nice. I'm here for work and was super tired and they got me all set to go in my room. If I come back to Jacksonville I will stay here for sure!Had an event here and the staff was exceptional. Pricing was very fair and competitive for the space. If I had the choice I would use them again for any event as they made sure everything was covered and we were accommodated through out our time thereMan at front desk laughed at me when I told him I had a reservation because he said their rooms were full! Also said that since it was past midnight there was no way that the reservation line could make me a reservation for the night before; turns out my reservation was legit and that they turned me away with a one-year-old child at 2 AM and with no place to stay. Every place nearby was full and my family and I drove for hours before being able to check in someplace. The only person willing to help us find a place was a lady at the front desk of the Holiday Inn. Sad that we've been Marriott rewards customers for so long and not one Marriott worker tried to help us in anyway.Called and booked a reservation at 10:00 pm for (2) rooms, had to cancel the reservation, and called back at 11:30 pm the same night.  Was told they booked (3) rooms in my name and that all (3) rooms were subject to a late cancellation fine, as their policy stated such fines would occur after 6:00 pm.  This policy was not relayed over the phone, before the reservation was made.  Seems like important information to pass.After some debate with a customer service representative, who spoke to the manager; I was told that (2) rooms would not be charged a fine, but (1) would "have to be charged" as the manager "didn't want to get in trouble for canceling (3) without a fine," and that, "the policy's the policy."What?I've stayed here many times. It is a fine hotel, but age is taking its due on the property. I doubt it has ever been remodeled, my best estimate is that it was built in the late 70's-early 80's. The staff is polite and helpful. The gym has a great selection of equipment. As a platinum member I grade hard on the concierge room. This one is very low quality. No meats for breakfast, only eggs and oatmeal. This Marriott is no longer providing bottled water, one of the largest benefits to me personally. Does not offer Starbucks coffee where all most all other Marriott's do.We had a wonderful stay here. Pool was great, gym was complete, restaurant was good, and the service was excellent. My room blow dryer broke while using it and immediately they replaced it and even gave us complimentary gifts for our slight inconvenience. Truly a great experience.I was very impressed with this property. Check in was super speedy, staff extremely friendly and the room very tidy-all the furnishings looked and felt brand new but overall that bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on.  Way more comfortable than the Sheraton and the Crown.The bar staff is a friendly and very accommodating team. I was having a late night craving and didn't want have hot wings or a quesadilla or fries so when I asked for something off the menu, my bar tender was super eager to help. She ended up frapping me up a banana, pineapple, blueberry and 2% milk smoothie. It was exactly what I needed to settle my hunger pangs for the night.I will be checking in here again real soon.Posted our stay back in the summer.  The 5 stars go to the staff at this hotel!!!!  Awesome from the time i walked in to the time I left.  Everyone is happy to be there!!  If you have not been to this hotel, you need to.  The hotel itself needs work.  From July to now, I can see the changes.  Still more is needed.  But, Staff is just awesome!!!!!The place is riding the goodwill of its stellar employees.  Without them, the place would need to be shut down.  A complete ---and total---remodel is sorely needed at this location.  It is clear that the ownership has spent next to nothing on the place in years. Outdated as hell, hasn't had a good coat of paint even.  Only reason for two stars is the five star employees.  Come on owners...give this great team a facility to be proud of.Conference center staff were great and the overall staff were great as well. Not much to this hotel and those facilities were a bit outdated. However they had great rooms that were nice and up-to-date. For the offerings in the area, this hotel hit the mark. Once again - I will say it - Dear Marriott, you should not have to pay for wireless!!!!!I have never stayed at the room but have had meetings here.  Staff is very professional, prompt and quick.  Even though the hotel is huge, it's not hard to find the help you need when you need it.I never have any issues with set up or with anything being done well in a timely manner here.Like everyone stated, the staff here is awesome. My little girl had her birthday when we got there.  Once the staff found out, they showered her over and over with treats and gifts. Everyday was good morning Mr. Lee, how are you today, can we help you with anything. I am a Marriott person thru and thru. I gave bad reviews to some high end marriott hotel. This staff should be awarded by Marriott for beat service in the worth shape hotel in the marriott family. Management really need to update the place!Very nice.Used this hotel as it was the host hotel for a function we attended on a weekend. Check in was fast, room was spacious, bedding comfortable, bathroom adequate size, room was clean, no noise, staff friendly. The bartenders in the lobby were great. Ate breakfast & lunch in their bistro & service & food were top notch. Parking was ample too. There is a Dave & Busters within walking distance (2 blocks). We didn't venture out during our stay, but it seems close to most things--good location. Would use this hotel again.For the price I did not expect that this hotel was going to offer what it did. Room service, indoor pool and onsite restaurant.  Will continue to stay here in the future if I'm looking for a quick stop in jax.
review_content_20: I've attended several Special Events at this Hotel. Their main ballroom is very large and the food and service was very good. The parking lot is very large and it's easy to get to off of Salisbury Road. The rooms are clean.Hotel is OK, no problem. I'll come back again. I became a bit miffed at the concierge who steered us to a poor choice for dinner because of his incentive arrangement with the restaurant (I suspect.) This left me with an overall negative impression, though it certainly was not a bad recommendation, just not what we had in mind. Should have relied on Yelp instead, but sometimes its late and you get tired of having to look everything up. So, got what I deserved in this case!Stayed here a few times. Rooms are ok...they seem old. the restaurant did not have much for vegetarians (except salads). Salads are not a meal...they are eaten prior to a meal. I cant get my nutrition by eating leaves...especially lettuce.Anyways, the hotel is in a complex where there are a number of other hotels. you need a rental car or taxi to get here from the airport, which is quite far away.some restaurants in driving distance.Nice rooms, great staff, nice pool. Convenient quiet location. Food's good. Nice lounge for the Marriott rewards folks.If you've got business in the area or your just on holiday you should enjoy it here.

hotel_name: Hilton Garden Inn Jacksonville Downtown Southbank
review_content: Hotel staffing put this hotel in the 5 star category for me. Everyone was so eager to please and make sure my husband and I had everything we needed. The rooms were spacious, but the bathroom was a little on the small side. Both of us couldn't be in there at the same time without bumping each other. The lights were a little tricky in the bathroom too. Make sure you turn the light switch on while showering or else the sensor will think you're gone and turn the lights out. All in all, it was a great stay!This HGI is a comfortable and convenient spot to crash close to Downtown Jacksonville.  The rooms are standard HGI... Decent space, Kurigs and mini fridges in the rooms, comfortable beds.  There is a small bar in the lobby, and breakfast is good here.It's an additional charge to park in the garage next door.  There are a few parallel spots for free just outside the lobby if you feel like saving a few bucks.There are plenty of places a short drive away to eat and drink, but not within walking distance.  Check our Aardwolf Brewing a couple blocks away.  A local brewery within "stumbling" distance is a plus.The hotel is fine and the rooms are standard Garden inn. They have a nice bar in the lobby area that serves food and drinks. I don't know the area well but you can tell it's close to downtown. The downside is parking, where you have to pay $10 bucks even if you park in the street that is considered part of the property - I asked the front desk about it and he said that the city owns the hotel and street so that's why they charge the same fee from the parking garage across the street... interesting huh? Overall is a descent choice if you want to stay right downtown.I stayed here recently while I was on a business trip and was satisfied with my experience. The location was convenient to downtown and a few other areas with restaurants as well as the museums.Pros: standard rooms, Keurig coffee machines, coin laundry, well stocked breakfast and large breakfast areaCons: $10 parking in a secured garage where your key working was spotty at best, uneven service from the front deskPro tip: as noted in other reviews, this HGI is on the same property as a Homewood Suites and you can totally crash their evening happy hour.I hope my experience was a unique one off and does not happen to other travelers. I came to Jacksonville for a business trip and checked into Hilton Garden Inn. To my surprise my hotel key opened a room that was occupied by another guest. Luckily the guest was not in his room or that would have been an awkward story. This is alarming as they can easily give my room key access to another person. Probably would not stay here again if I had to come back.The location is perfectly fine. I had never been to Jacksonville, but found the area nice and easy to walk to a good selection of restaurants and shops. This was the only high point of my experience.I was given complimentary internet, which is always a treat, but this was a let down. Even though it was free, the internet was terribly. Terribly internet is way more hassle than no internet. So at no cost to me, I got a lot of hassle and frustration added to my trip.The mattresses were awful. I have not in recent memory slept on a mattress of poorer quality. The temperature controls did not appear to do anything.The food was decidedly sub par, the cost made it a joke. The service was not very good at all. At breakfast, there were maybe 5 tables seated, with only two people at each one. There were two servers. I am not sure what they were doing, but it took forever to get their attention or get any sort of service.The rooms are fine, but basically identical to a much cheaper hotel. They have Keurigs in the room, but free coffee downstairs anyway. This was like a crappy motel in the middle of nowhere with different branding and worse mattresses.Quite frankly, I am shocked that the Hilton brand would associate with such a poor quality hotel. I'm certain that you can do better in Jacksonville.This hotel was actually very nice for the price. I paid $700 for a five night stay in a double room and was blown away at the overall quality of the hotel/rooms. The rooms weren't crazy big, but they were a good size for being a double, the bathroom was nice and very updated. Our room included a mini-fridge/microwave along with a Keurig machine. The AC unit actually worked too, it wan'ts the strongest by any means, but it worked well and kept the room cool during mid day. There were a few things I didn't like, though. For one, the pool closes at 10:00 P.M, which I find pretty odd since it advertises no life guard/swim at your own risk, and which is gated and requires a key card to enter. Either way, it wasn't a big deal.The next was the hotel bar, it also closed at 10:00. Which to a degree is understandable, but still pretty early for a bar. I'd normally expect something like 11-11:30 to be normal. The laundry room for some reason also closed at 11:00, Which made doing laundry semi difficult because if you didn't get your load done at least an hour early you would be locked out until morning. One thing to note, is that there is no free parking. The hotel owns all of it and the parking garage adjacent to the hotel, this means you get to pay $9.99 per day for parking. Which seems like a complete rip-off considering it's almost entirely empty 24/7. The very last thing to note is the Wi-Fi...holy crap it was terrible. First off, they do offer free internet..but they cap you to around 100Kbps which is incredibly slow(imagine ultra slow DSL). They do however, offer a paid internet service for $4.95 per day which increases your speed....to 300Kbps...The internet situation here is a joke and a complete rip-off. I ended up using my AT&T phone to tether to the laptop which was giving me a much better connection. Which is actually kind of funny because the hotel is using AT&T hotspot service as their internet. Overall, this hotel was pretty decent for the price and I would definitely stay here again.So we are staying here as a stop over to an early morning California flight. They offer regular rooms & suites. I used my military I.D. to get a reasonable rate on a two-queen bed room. The room has a fridge, microwave & keurig. There is free wifi using your room # and last name. They have pricey breakfast & dinner. We ate dinner there, burgers are $10 each. The waitress has to deliver to the restaurant patrons AND room service! She was overwhelmed at times. Poor thing! Think the cook was having a hard time which was pushing more pressure on her. Food was decent. Had daily soup & mac/cheese. It was a bit greasy but ok. The sweet ice tea was delish! Great cookies in the lobby. The front desk staff were delightful & helpful. I would stay here again. Restaurant prices are steep but room price decent. Its a 4* hotel.Great hotel. Secure parking. Located within walking distance to local eateries and shops. Our room was nice and the balcony had a nice view of the city, especially at night. And I have to say I thoroughly enjoyed the pool table area downstairs! Great service at the front desk as well!Pros:  Clean hotel, good breakfast. Cons:  -HORRIBLE service at the restaurant in the evening. Worst I've ever seen. -Expensive pantry. It's Jacksonville not Manhattan.The location is not bad. It's in San Marco just across the bridge from downtown/Jacksonville Landing. The bar closes really early (at 10:00p sharp). Most hotel bars are open until after midnight, but at least there's one directly across the street called Local's Bar that's open until 2:00a seven days a week. Here's another hint about the bar service at the Hilton Garden Inn - It's in the same building as the Homewood Suites and both are owned & operated by the same people. The Homewood has free happy hour 5:30 - 7:30 Monday thru Thursday. Hilton guests are welcome to partake in free drinks if they walk over to the Homewood bar. The only beer available is Bud Heavy and Mich Ultra, but it's free and it's all you can drink for two hours each weekday.The rooms are nice. They are typical for Hilton Garden Inns. I like the chairs and the beds are comfy. The wireless Internet is of decent speed. Everything is very clean and it still has the feel of a new hotel.The exercise room is shared between the two hotels and is very nice. I love the PreCor equipment. It can get crowded, so go early (or really late).The pool is also shared and is small and usually in the shade, due to being in a corner between two buildings and the front breezeway.Parking is $10/day. It's an open lot with no gate, so you make the call on whether to tell them you have a car or not.There are a few places in walking distance. Of course Local's Bar is right across the street. It's a smokey dive bar, but prices are dirt cheap and it's very convenient. There are two nice restaurants about four blocks to the right (North). One is BB's, which is in the top 10 best lists on anything you look at for Jacksonville restaurants (Yelp, TripAdvisor, etc.). They have excellent food and wine. The sushi place across the street from BB's is even better in my opinion. It's called Basil Thai & Sushi. The staff there is awesome. The food is even better. As far as Jacksonville hotels go, this one is pretty good. I stay here or at the Homewood whenever I have to travel to Jacksonville. It's much nicer and better located than the rundown Embassy Suites in Baymeadows.Comfortable hotel rooms but the air conditioning units are noisy. Cookies and infused water make it pleasant to arrive at the lobby.Stayed one night, May 26th and that was enough for me. The good:-Clean room-Modern/relatively new hotelThe bad-Parking $10 per day-The hotel adjoins another so my view was right into another room at the Homewood Suites-Television didn't work, took an hour plus to fix, still not working properly-Tiny pool considering it serves two hotels-Was booked into a double asked to change to a king, was told it was $40 extra per night-Inconvenient location for me-Bed was horrible, not a big fan on Sleep-number bedsOverall a poor value for the $169 I spent. I felt the hotel was nickel and diming me with parking charges and upgrade fees.I will not return and will only use HGI as a last resort. This morning I feel terrible because of these beds.Feeling ripped off.We decided to stay at this hotel for a recent girls weekend that we were having in the Jacksonville area.  Wanting a place that was close to the San Marco and Riverside areas, Hilton Garden Inn was an obvious choice.  I was a bit nervous after reading some of the Yelp reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised!All employees from the moment we checked in until we went home were extremely nice and accommodating.  I have to give a special shout out to Rose and William at the front desk who both went above and beyond for us the entire two days we were there.  Our room was also very large and clean.  We spent some time at the pool and hot tub and much enjoyed both.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay near the San Marco and Riverside area.This hotel's in the middle of nowhere, really, even though it says downtown. There is nothing walkable within the hotel's distance; at least, I wouldn't be caught walking in this deserted area at night alone. There is a Homewood Suites RIGHT next door to this hotel, which I find interesting. You have to pay for parking, and hotel guests are only supposed to park on the first floor. The first time I stayed at the Homewood Suites next door, I didn't know that (ramp wasn't sectioned off), but this time I noticed the ramp was closed to hotel guests.There's nothing that special about this hotel other than it's close to where I have to be for work. The total for one night was $185.84 including taxes, surcharges, and parking. It's your typical hotel, although they did let me have free breakfast and still earn points, which is always nice!Very clean hotel with free internet.. Now the charging for the parking I don't understand why charge the guest for self parking....I wanted to go relax in the pool but it closes at 10pm...like Almost everything in Jacksonville..... Ugggg well I will swim tomorrow.. MI always stay at Hilton Garden Inn Downtown when I'm in Jacksonville for business.  While it's nothing fancy, I keep returning because it's always clean.  Further, the Hilton staff are friendly and always accommodate my needs.Nice hotel. Nice location. Nice cleaning crew. Nice waitstaff at the bar/restaurant. Mostly nice crew at the desk. Some good beers and good food at the restaurant and many more choices for good beer and food within walking distance. Little concerned that my bill "should" have been under my door on the last morning but was not and all I got out of the desk clerk was that she "just came on." Hello?! Identity theft!All good things.  I'd give it five stars but no free weights in the fitness room.  Close enough to walk to a couple great restaurants, and within a mile of a killer running path that goes up and over a bridge.  Friendly folks.Find another place to stay if you can, don't be persuaded by the "downtown name".  This place is in a weird area on the edge of town with nothing around except street walkers and homeless.  Arrival was smooth and it's a nice place, looks new.  I am a diamond member that travels every week so I have kind of high standards but this place came across as just "ok".  I did get upgraded to a big room due to my status but only after I asked and the guy acted like it was a favor.Room was nice, bathroom had dirty Kleenex in the trash and hair on the toilet. Beds are terrible, absolutely terrible!  Pillows are to airy and falls flat immediately.  Ordered room service, took almost 2 hours after placing an order over voicemail because they were to busy to answer the phone, can't imagine why, to get my food.  Steak was swimming in water along with the cold Mac and cheese,  was very well done instead of medium well as requested and was mostly comprised of grissle....all in all this hotel was nothing special at all, I am here as a single guy but I can't imagine bringing a family here especially due to the area it's in.  It is a nice place for sure but terrible service
review_content_20: Booked a girls weekend here & had a blast! We stayed in a suite with two queen beds & a pull out couch. The room was comfortable & spacious. The staff was very friendly, and did not mind bringing us extra towels, tp, etc. They even assisted us in calling cabs to go out at night. The hotel is in a somewhat strange part of town. The walkability isn't great but it is a short ($10) cab ride to Riverside/downtown & even less to San Marco attractions. I was surprised to find out that they dont offer continental breakfast, and that is one down fall of this place. Also, the pool was beautiful but shady later than 3:00 p.m. Tip: Dont pay for parking. No one knows if you park in the garage for free!!Very clean, friendly service, and nice amenities. They offer a great military discount as well. Our room included a balcony and a great view of downtown Jacksonville. The only downside about this place is the location. It's not in the best area, but it's close enough to drive to the downtown area. No free complimentary breakfast included, but you can buy breakfast for about $12. Overall, it's a great stay!The hotel itself is relatively new / rooms are big and clean.  Few issues though:1) The beds are horrible.  It has been a long time since I've had a bad hotel bed, but this one is rock hard (even with the adjustment set to softest setting possible).2) Train tracks nearby / quite noisy.3) Not the safest area, especially after dark.

review_content: We needed a hotel in a hurry and we were so glad that we found this one. It was not expensive and we received great service. The only minor complaint I have is how rough the pillowcases are. Customer service is excellent, the hotel is very clean and well kept.This hotel is old, tired and has a bad smell. You can try to make a silk purse from a sow's ear, but it is still a sow's ear. No wonder Wyndham left the building. No TV service when it rains. Rained all night. The water did not drain from the bathroom sink and I had to keep turning off the water so it would not overflow. I tried to take a shower, but same thing. I cannot stand taking a shower with water half up my calf. Then I set the alarm for a good night's sleep. Unfortunately, they did not bother to set their room clocks back, so I was up more than an hour before I wanted to be. When I went down to complain and get coffee, the girl behind the desk was very busy - playing on her cell phone. She could have cared less my room clock was not set back.  When I said a swear word and said perhaps she should work instead of play on her phone, she  told me to leave the hotel since I said a swear word. Locked me out, called police. You can bet I will NEVER stay at another Hampton Inn again - EVER. And the coffee in the morning tasted like rain water. Not a good choice. Pick the Holiday Inn Express.A typical Hampton Inn.  The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly.  This location could probably use some updating/refreshing.The breakfast buffets is typical, which means pretty good but nothing to rave about.  I always make a fresh waffle--which I love.The location is great if you need to be downtown on this side of the river.  I come on business and it is convenient.My husband and I got married across the street at Treaty Oak Park and rented out a room to get changed in after we were done decorating (and yes, we spent the night...after a drunken post-reception party with some close friends). Everyone who worked there was SUPER friendly and completely helpful in every aspect (Sigourney, Key, Winston - sorry I really tried to remember the names I hope I'm at least close!) Even after all my worried phone calls during the previous two weeks before we stayed there, they were all professional and courteous.The hotel is very nice, clean, and spacey. Had nice TVs and a fridge in the room. Also had an iron with ironing board, hair dryers, coffee pot, etc. If you forgot a toothbrush, toothpaste, or really any of the basic necessities, you could just call the front desk and get it. Coffee was almost always available in the lobby and breakfast is served everyday between 6am-11am. Great location and by some cool spots in San Marco :)The staff could not be any friendlier. We met a lady named Tina who works there. She provided us great direction to downtown and what restaurants were near us. Even gave us a free drink voucher to River City Brewery. Hotel is clean and a nice view.Friendly staff and good location. The hotel is what you would expect at a Hampton. Property is clean and well kept. You will find the normal cookies at the front desk and optional popcornThis place was nicely located right next to I95. Although they tried to get me far from the highway, the fact is -- I was still next to the highway and heard the traffic through out the night. Service was friendly.The hotel looks like it went through recent renovations. The lobby looks up to date and great. The carpets in the hallway are nice and clean. The rooms and bathroom were all decent. They have these new mass printed notes that say your sheets are clean for your arrival. I don't know how that changes my outlook but I still am aware what goes on at a hotel.Breakfast is available as with all Hampton Inns. Each floor had a great ice machine great for refilling for travelers. The direct TV was a little unreliable but of course a bad storm hit while I stayed there.Very Very pleased with this hotel ! Samantha and Yolanda at the front desk were so polite and accommodating! They provided a free wine opener and gave us tips and hints on where to go and what to do. Was there the weekend of Dec 13-Dec 16th. The breakfast was delish -- love the make your own waffles! So fun! Whatever you do, DO NOT GO TO THE WINE CELLAR restaurant across the street. We got 2 cocktails and a bill for 41.00!  I asked how 2 cocktails (jack and coke and gin and tonic could be $41, and I was told "this is a 5 star restaurant sir". Steer clear!).Hotel was very clean and smelled fresh. The bathroom and toiletries were Nuetragena. The bed was so soft and comfy. The pool was cute and the grounds (entrance, plants, etc) were very clean and well kept. The BP gas station across the street was a little shady, but the prices were fair.The river walk and river taxi 2 blocks behind hotel were great! so easy to access! Also - we ate at the SAKE HOUSE 2 blocks behind Hampton and it was absolutely delish! HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!  Best hotel for the buck. You will be pleased!To be honest, I have had a most difficult time finding a suitable hotel for me in JAX.  I have stayed at the Omni, it's nice, however they nickel and dime you, and it's a hassle to get in and out because of its size.  Fairfield is clean and nice, but I needed someplace more centrally locatedSo, I try Hampton because the Wyndham Riverwalk seems like a disaster from the reviews.I made the right choice.  This hotel has easy access--fairly easy to get in and out of, if there is no traffic blocking the entrance.  So, JAX people, it's nice to leave an opening at a business entrance in traffic instead of blocking me.  Just be nice.Everyone is super friendly here and helpful.  Someone went out of their way to find deodorant for me as I left mine at home, and someone else got me hot water to make hot chocolate.  They serve cookies and popcorn for snacks in the evening, and I got to choose my snack based on status with Hilton.  Very nice.Rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast is nice, and they allow me to check out late.I am surprised that so many people like this hotel. The hotel could use a major update. I checked in on a Saturday and stayed two nights. The first day someone was having a baby shower in a private room on the first floor. I was hanging out in the lobby waiting for a family member. They were so LOUD and obnoxious. The room I stayed in was clean, but the carpet was worn in spots. The bed was comfy. I went to bed early the first night. I could hear someone outside my door with a dog barking. Also heard people talking loud and slamming their doors. The second night I could again hear doors slamming. That morning people could be heard early talking loud and again slamming the door. Next time I think I will go to the Hilton. This property is not for me.Ok, I'm somewhat puzzled.  This Hampton Inn seems to get some great, if not almost RAVE reviews.  Is it possible that there is another Hampton Inn nearby?  Or maybe I've finally succumbed to a nasty bout of Hilton Itis?I'm really comparing this to other Hampton Inns, and it still comes up 2 stars in my book.  The rooms have that odd smell of humidity and sweat.  The heating/cooling system featured a fan that turned at the blistering speed of one revolution per minute.  The place was remarkable in its utter unremarkable.  Maybe the location is convenient for downtown visitors, but to me it is worth throwing in the convenience for other offerings near some nightlife and restaurants.  The most convenient option here is the BP across the street (they sell a killer pre packages Italian sub....expiration date is a year from next tuesday).When I return to Jacksonville, I think I'll pass on this property and check out the Hilton Garden Inn just a stop up the road further.Clean rooms , no foam pillows. Hot Breakfast sucks... Cold turkey links and egg chunks. Not up to the standard Hilton family experience. If not for building up my points bank, I would not come back.Just stayed here this weekend (July, 2012) and couldn't have been happier.  Great price, clean rooms, the decor is updated and the place just looks/feels new.THe room was very clean, comfy bed, big flat screen tv and WiFi worked great.  Fridge in room was a nice plus.Late afternoon snack (cookies) were nice touch and typical Continental plus warm foods breakfast provides more than enough choice.I stopped two doors down at the Wyndham and my in-laws and it was a DUMP - made the Hampton shine that much more.Great job!Usually like to stay at Hampton and this one did not disappointed. Its very well located in downtown Jacksonville. The room was real clean and the room was cheap for a Saturday. The staff was all real nice and helpful. Free Wifi is in the hotel and thats a great perk since some hotels still try to charge or it. Definitely stay here if you're in the Jacksonville area, I will again for sure.I had a hard time giving this a 4.  I really was thinking 3.5 stars.  The hotel seems to have been recently renovated with new carpets, sheets, and 40" LCD TV's..Not to bad.  The service was also very good.  But I just don't love the location.  While it's close to downtown, it's not close enough to walk, and the skyway is not open on the weekends..real bummer.  The wi-fi speed was decent, ad the pool was just OK and outdoors.  Not a bad location for the price.Very nice mid-level hotel that caters to business people.  Great breakfast buffet in the morning.  Awesome customer service.  Good location near hospital.  Very clean.Friendly and helpful staff. Convenient location. Great value. Comfortable accommodations.Another great stay at a Hampton Inn. It was clean and not worn out, the breakfast was great, and service was friendly. Free parking is nice. Not a lot of restaurant options in walking distance, but there is the lovely Treaty Oak park next door. The waterfront is about a 10 to 15 minute walk.If I'm in Jacksonville again I'll definitely stay here.Omg  maybe I was a little to geeked to be in Jacksonville for the first time but this was really the best hotel ever. We were there for three days and even though i didn't the maid to come clean our room she always checked to see if we were ok or needed any new towels. The wifi is fast and I was geeked because I was watching Netflix movies allll Night Long. the breakfast is served from 6am until 10am. Waffles are soo good i wanted to take they waffle maker which makes perfect waffles everytime!! The staff was nice and the price was nice. it was about 366 for 3nights and four days!!!! Right in the center of it all and not far from public transportation.We drove into the parking lot only minutes after the start of a torrential rain shower.  So it was a welcome sight.  I generally love Hamptons...clean facilities, free breakfast, & reasonable prices.  This location was perfect for the weekend activities we had planned...visit the Cummer Museum, the Riverside Arts/Farmers Market, the Landing, San Marco Square, & Cuba Libre dance club.The staff was friendly, helpful, & attentive.  The room was modern, clean, & comfortable.  We had a newer flat screen TV...40" I think.  There was a small pool.  For breakfast we generally had oatmeal, raisin bran, fresh fruit, coffee with milk, waffles, yogurt, with an occasional pastry.  They also had eggs, sausages, bacon, pastries, & pancakes which we did not try.We had a great time in JAX while staying here, & heartily recommend this Hampton.
review_content_20: Nice place.  Close to shopping and food.This was a great hotel! I made my first visit to Jacksonville and made my original reservations in downtown Jacksonville by the North Riverwalk. I arrived to find my only parking options were Valet (an additional $20 for overnight) or the Parking Garage (additional $10-$15 for overnight). I was unaware the hotel charged this so we cancelled our reservations. After driving to 3 other hotels who charged for parking, we drove less than 2 minutes across the bridge to the Hampton Inn. We were greeted by an exceptionally nice concierge and got a room. He did inform us of the thefts that had been going on around downtown and to ensure all valuables were brought in or removed from view. The hotel also offered a complimentary breakfast, cookies and popcorn. The next morning we received our check out receipt under the door so we didn't have to go to the desk. We did go for breakfast and were greeted by two more exceptionally friendly employees. This hotel was great, especially for the price. I'm currently in the military and with the discount the rate was $80 (and the free parking) which definitely was a steal since less than 2 miles away the rates were at least $100 a night plus the additional $10 per night for parking.I'm not sure why, but this place fills up.  Totally.  During the week, they say it's the business people, and on the weekends, it's the conventions.  All I'm saying is, book it a few weeks in advance, or end up staying by yourself in a smoking room across town while your four colleagues relax in their non-smoking rooms right by where you need to be anyway.Free wi-fi!  Great for those people with their own laptops and a wireless card, but otherwise, there is only one lonely desktop for everyone's use in the lobby.  Make sure you sign out, because for some reason it keeps you in the system whether or not you checked the "yes this is my computer" box.  Tsk tsk, lady-whose-ebay-account-I-was-in!  The facilities are ok, nothing amazing or new but decent.  The breakfast is the basic coffee, cereal, biscuits, with a rotating hot tray of sausage, egg pucks (these can NOT be real eggs), egg hash mix (don't do it) and it seems on Thursdays, sausage gravy (not great but not bad).  There is no exercise room, but there is a pool, and all in all, it's pretty quiet.  The staff is very friendly, and here are a few more perks: a popcorn machine in the lobby; fresh baked chocolate chip cookies in the lobby in the evenings; fresh lemon water and cucumber water in the lobby in the late afternoons.Watch out for old televisions!  Some of the sets have that I'm-about-to-give-up-the-ghost whine of old electronics that is sure to give you a monster headache.  My last visit didn't have that problem, but the plumbing screamed so loudly, I was afraid the faucet was going to explode and take out one of my legs.  Try and explain that to your co-workers when they have to come find you.

review_content: I think this hotel is actually pretty decent. Nice layout. Good room design. Loud A/C, but not unusual for the type of unit. Lacking convenient plugs/electrical outlets around desk, but I was able to get creative with other jacks around the room. :-) Nothing to complain about. Friendly / helpful staff. Seems clean, which is my top priority when traveling. It's a Sheraton. It's not a W or Westin or Le Meridian. And, honestly? It's a damn fine Sheridan, at that. In fact, it's renewing my confidence in the Sheridan brand.UPDATE: I'm going to still keep as 4 stars, for this brand only - but not within the context of all hotels. In other words, it's a 4-star Sheraton, but it's not a 4-star hotel.There are two things that were not ideal:1) Thin walls - While I was lucky in not having as noisy of neighbors as my boss, she mentioned that in two rooms she tried (she switched after it was too loud in one), she heard a person's entire TV show, as well as a father reading a bed-time story to his child (sweet - but she heard it word-for-word) over a phone call. I sent this feedback to the GM, though I'm unsure if it's possible to insulate the walls at this point in time.2) Shower Stall - Uneven / not-level floor, and felt structurally unsound. Creaked a lot, and I was worried I might fall through! Since #1 didn't directly affect me (as a data point), and #2 was a fortunately unrealized fear, I see no reason to adjust my review at this time. Not to mention the fact that - across the board, in nearly all facets of society - building standards are just generally decreasing in terms of quality of craftsmanship, as well as raw materials. Again, if you want better quality, target a different brand within the Starwood family. But this is still a decent Sheraton, when compared to others around the country.* I should also mention that I was only here for one night.Back to the positives - what really sold me was the clean and simple bed covering. Everything looked washable, and as a frequent hotel guest and business traveler, this is super important to me. I don't want to see any kind of decorative elements on the bed that are not washed after each & every guest stay.This hotel is an embarrassment to the Sheraton franchise. To be honest, if it didn't say Sheraton on the building, you could easily think you are at a Super 8.... except that they have a lobby.The AC made noise like an old school window unit and the air in the building was stale. I know Jacksonville isn't a world class city, but honestly, I've stayed in better rooms in the middle of nowhere.  This place desperately needs a renovation!This was an ok hotel. nothing fancy. I would give 3.5 just because it's really not bad. Check in was quick and easy. The room was clean as I was looking for all the issues that other reviewers mentioned. It was ok not horrible but ok if ur just needing a place to stay for a night or two.This hotel is below the standard of other Sheraton hotels I've stayed in. The staff was friendly, but the hotel itself seemed cheap and dated.My biggest complaint was the incredibly thin walls. I could hear conversations my neighbors were having as if they were in my room. The guy next to me wasn't being obnoxious, just chatting on the phone and I could hear it all. I heard my neighbors take a wiz, sneeze, cough up a lung, and just chitchat... I did have to ask him to keep it down around 12:30 and he obliged... my neighbor on the other side of me, however, left his television on all night - sounded like it was right in my room. I wouldn't stay here again for the noise factor.Sheratons are usually known for their comfy beds... not this place. It was one of the worst mattresses I've slept (or attempted to sleep) on. Wirey, squeaky, and cheap sheets... The room itself was clean, but this isn't a comfortable hotel at all and I recommend you find an alternative.While my husband and I are gold for life we have stayed in array of hotels within our travels. From seedy Motel 6's off I-95 to category 7 W's. This hotel was a serious let down. While Westin's Heavenly Beds will always be my favorite Sheraton Sweet Sleepers are a great alternative. I can only speak for my room but I am almost certain that this bed was not a a SSS. Upon laying down the foot of the bed came about 6 inches off the base. It was like sleeping in a hospital bed with our feet raised up. I woke up in the middle of the night to pins and needles in both my feet and legs.  If this mattress is a SSS it should have been retired years ago, it has craters of dead spots where the springs are clearly shot. The creaking bed frame was distracting as well.The chair in my room was not an ergonomic desk chair, it was a retired catering chair from the dining room. The desk also did not have any outlets close enough for my laptop charger so I resorted to working from my creaky uncomfortable bed. Because that was the only place I could plug it in. The wall paper is peeling, there are stains on the carpet and the entire floor had an overal stench of B.O. The stains, and what I assume are bleach marks in an attempt to clean, in the hallway was completely off putting.As much as we like earning our points we will not be staying here during our next trip to Jacksonville.I have been traveling for 30 years and stayed in many Sheraton's. I have never walked out because it was so bad. We checked into a suite. The room looked as if it was something out of a motel 6. Walls dented, carpet stains, furniture was dirty. We called and they moved us to another room. It was exactly the same. I left my details and asked to speak with a manager. Next day nobody called. I called again and left 2 more messages. No call backs. While the outside of the hotel looks inviting... Don't judge a book by a cover. In this case... The inside is dreadful.  And if you are looking for customer service, this is the wrong place. Shame on Sheraton for misleading it's loyal customersAccommodating and good service, the hotel simply needs a major overhaul to their A/C systems... First room was unbearable, loud and noisy unit and seemed to be leaking as the floor was damp and room smelled like mildew. Asked to switch rooms, which they allowed with no problem or questions asked... Next room was a tad better but the carpet was still damp all around, and under, the desk where the AC unit is... Mildew/musty smell were consistent. A serious renovation needed - would not stay here, much better options for comparable rate (or less) in Jax.This was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. Here's why: Upon arrival I find out my room is on the Club Level 6th floor. This includes a private breakfast and complimentary appetizers in the afternoon. The man who serviced the afternoon was wonderful. I get up to my room and discover what appears to be stray fecal matter splattered on our wall next to/behind the toilet. No biggie right? I just won't touch the wall... But what else hasn't been cleaned??? I'm standing in my room and hear a song, plain as day. I check my phone and look at the tv. Nothing. Then I hear someone call Wells Fargo on speakerphone and can hear so clearly through the wall that I know their balance is $1099.64. I pray that they are quiet at night. During the night I find out that they are not and this goes on for two nights- listening to Kayne West and two guys having the time of their lives. Finally we call the front desk. It stops for 5 minutes and picks back up. We also visited the restaurant/bar. At 8pm 3 of us put an order in for salads and there is one other group who we know sitting next to us- no one else to serve. An HOUR LATER I ask the bartender to check on our food. It took 2 hours for us to receive a glass of wine, salad, and dessert. She told me she was busy and didn't offer to take care of anything for us. A transient girl was sitting outside the hotel on her duffle bag asking what city she was in... Clearly on drugs. They let her in the lobby for two hours and eventually she goes up to a room... After she has scared everyone in the hotel off. I was with a group and another room told me that their shower/tub wasn't draining at all. A maintenance man came up to look at it and plunge it. Nothing. So he told them to take the drain stopper out every time by unscrewing it, allowing it to drain, and then replace the stopper. Obviously that's disgusting and wouldn't want to do it at my own house, let alone a public shower.The service has been bad and good. We don't want to move rooms but are praying the people next to us leave. We will be buying earplugs today.This hotel is odd. We visited on business, and after reading the yelp reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. When you first walk into the lobby, it was well appointed and welcoming but as soon as we went to check in, I saw what people were talking about. We were told "We ain't got your reservation." It was like textbook exactly how to not treat people checking into your hotel, she was negative, made it seem like we had a problem, then said her shift was over and left, while someone else helped us. The hotel is nicely appointed, but it feels like the employees are all motel 6 level. The corners are dirty, there were used robes on the floor in our closet. Things were broken. The maid entered our room without knocking.I had lunch in the restaurant, and did some work while waiting for my boyfriend to return from his meetings in the afternoon, I spent well over $30 on lunch, but when the evening crew came in after 3, I felt very unwelcome, I felt as if they wanted me to leave. It was very unpleasant, and I would not choose this hotel again.Being a Starwood platinum and having my fair share of stays at a wide range of spg properties all over the country, I say stay away from this one.I get it. Jacksonville does not offer many nice hotel options. Co-workers who stayed at the other chain hotels reported disappointing experiences. I defaulted to this Sheraton based on my trust in the spg brand (and the fact there is no better spg than this one closeby), but this hotel was just nothing but a let down.Overall this is BELOW your average Sheraton.Rooms: so I've stayed in standard room and suite. Both are really worn and need serious renovation. Like the other review pointed out, the hotel has a mix of pet-friendly and pet-free rooms, but BE AWARE - even what they claimed to be pet-free rooms smell like pets. Walls not sound-proof.Service: decent, nothing special. Although it's worth pointing out the 1st time I stayed here, I had to re-book my reservation with my company travel agency ON THE SPOT because this hotel had a system glitch and as a result can't find my reservation. Front desk gentleman claimed it's a spg problem. Hmmm, it's my 1st time over 100+ spg nights. Concierge Lounge: the saddest one out of all that I've seen. No fresh coffee, have tea bags out but no hot water...am I suppose to boil my own water?! Breakfast options very lacking.spg, please renovate this hotel or put a Westin in town. I meant, something needs to be done to save the day, right?I had one of the worst experiences staying here recently!!!!  I booked and went there the room was clean however the "Air Conditioning" was not working, I checked in mid afternoon and changed the thermostat to cool the room down, I left and came back hours later to find the room had only gotten hotter now "about 80 degrees" I called the front desk to see if they could come fix it, they sent someone up and the guy reset it and said it should work now. I was told to wait a while to make sure.IT DID NOT WORK. now at "82+ DEGREES" I called back about 1AM to see if they could move me to a different room, THEY JUST SAID NO!!!! I wasn't being unreasonable just asked!!!  They sent the "CHIEF ENGINEER" to come fix it!!!  He said is seemed to have cool air BUT, he said THE FAN WAS NOT BLOWING THE COOL AIR...  I called the front desk and the company I booked through and I was told I CAN LEAVE THE HOTEL IF I WANT TO GET A "COLDER" ROOM!!!  HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!! ALL the meanwhile it was about "@) DEGREES COLDER IN THE HALLWAY OUT MY DOOR!!!!!!!"  I WOULD HAVE RATHER SLEPT OUT THERE!!  At this point it is 3:30 AM when the "Chief Engineer" left the room and neither me or my wife get hardly any sleep because of this, THIS WAS SUPPOSED TO BE MY ANNIVERSARY GET AWAY!!! At least my wife said "Its a night we wont forget, they were very unreasonable."  I just simple could not believe when the MANAGER stated I CAN GO SOMEWHERE ELSE and that THEY WERE NOT GOING TO OFFER ME ANY COMPENSATION!!!!!This hotel is below standard. The room smells the walls are filthy. The desk personal was nice and welcoming but if you are accustom to staying in a place where you can lay back and relax and not see a bunch of unexplainable stains and smells everywhere DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!I would recommend this to others, great hotel overall, but some small problems.Great design, very grand and I would consider it a higher end hotel.  The room is very nice, and I feel like I'm definitely upper class when I'm in the room.  This theme follows throughout the entire hotel.  However, it's just a little more dim than I would like.  The dim look definitely goes with the theme of the hotel, it's just kinda' spooky.Ice machines - there are only ice machines on about 4 of the floors.  I'm on the 3rd floor, so every night I have to go to a different floor for the ice machines.Elevator - you have to use your room key to access the floors, which is a little annoying.  I understand it's for safety though.Service - staff is not bad.  When I checked in I had to wait a little while because there was no one at the front desk.
