It was a little odd, because like I said, it was spooky, then there was no one around, and there was no phone/bell to ring.  Fridge - There is none.Microwave - There is none.TV - small, I think it's a 32".  And it's a little annoying, it's on the hotel's system.  So you can't change the channel to a different input (to connect your own computer/movies).  Also, it changes itself to the hotel channel every 30 min or something.  Weird.Weird sounds - I don't even know what that's about.  There's weird knocking sounds from one of my walls.  Doesn't sound like neighbors.  Creepy.For the price I paid ($54 from Hotline)  I would recommend it.  But I wouldn't pay over $110 a night for it.This is your typical, standard Sheraton. There's free parking, bottled water, and if you're a SPG gold member (or higher), wifi. It should be noted unlike other Sheratons where I have stayed, complimentary club access is not available for gold members. However, when I made the comment, "Oh, this location is different then," the front desk immediately offered free club lounge access without hesitation. I like how you needed to use a key in the elevator (like Marriott hotels) to access the lounge, and as SOON as the elevator doors open, you arrive RIGHT in the lounge. I do dock a star though for not allowing gold members free access in the first place (inconsistent with other locations).Starwood Preferred Guest is probably my second favorite hotel chain after Hilton. You can double dip between your SPG and Delta accounts. It's cheap to book a room with points. If you don't have status, you earn one point for each $1 spent. It takes 2,000 points (to give an example) to book a free room at the Four Points by Sheraton Kansas City airport location. So, you don't need THAT many points in the overall scheme of things compared to Marriott. I also like SPG hotel beds and pillows. They're the most comfortable compared to Hilton and Marriott, in my opinion.This hotel is easy to get to off of the freeway. I should forewarn that if your company requires the last four digits of the credit card number to be on the receipt, double check your receipt. The digits weren't on there, so I had to request another receipt via email from the SPG website. I do recommend staying here though, and I would stay here again!Warning - this is a PET Friendly hotel.In fact, of the 6 floors of the hotel, ONLY FLOOR 3 is a no-pet floor.Unfortunately, it was too late for me as when I checked in, I thought the rooms smelled funny and later identified it as excessive deodorizer spray as this was a room for people with pets. I did not want to know what was on the carpet, but I would imagine that it was well broken in, if you know what I mean.I was able to change rooms the next day and Floor 3 was much better.The restaurant on the first floor is a 3 star and decent, but there are better options a mile or two away.Because I have allergies to some pets, I would not stay here again and wish they were more transparent about notifying their guests that only one floor out of 6 is a no pet zone.I am sure if you take your cute little dog or cat or bird or pig or whatever, you would think this place was a 4 or 5 star, but I do not own a pet and would rather stay at a people friendly hotel.Seriously, I remember the days of requesting a non-smoking room and now I have to worry about getting a non-pet room.I travel often and I go out of my way to stay SPG and I am a Platinum member. I have never done a bad review but my stay yesterday warranted that I do. I arrived later than I had hoped, 9pm, needing to get some work done. The employee at the front desk let me know that the WiFi was out but I could bring my laptop down as it was working in the lobby, which was false. I understand technical difficulties so I just went to sleep. The next morning I needed to iron a shirt and the ironing board had no cover and the iron was leaking. I requested a new one for both and they brought me an ironing board with an old cover on it four times too big and an iron. I plugged up the iron and added water and the iron had rust in the holes and ruined my shirt. The front desk asked if they could bring me another iron... How about another shirt?? They weren't sympathetic in any way. Stay clear if this place!!!!!!!!!!Bedding: modern and comfortableBathroom: updatedWi-Fi: Free & Fast/ReliableParking: Free & AmpleNightstand outlets: NoFridge: YesMicrowave: YesCoffee Bar: YesHotel Bar: YesMake a Green Choice: YesOther Comments: housekeeping is overly loud and annoying during the dayWould Return?: YesRoom: The air conditioning situation was ridiculous - I am super thankful I was not there on a hot Florida day. I'm convinced the thermostat is just for looks. The air unit is an older model that is EXTREMELY loud and didn't really cool the room at all. It was so annoying I unplugged it from the wall which was the only way to turn it off. Everything seemed relatively clean. No refrigerator which was a bummer. Good shower pressure with nice amenities. Location: Not very walkable at all. My first night I grabbed dinner at the closest restaurant which was about .5 miles away on the other side of the freeway. Hotel Shuttle: our morning driver was awesome; our evening drivers were always late and didn't speak at all, not even a "hello" - it was odd. Fitness Center: Very small but good equipment. I got in great workouts during my time here but went during off-peak hours to try to have the place to myself. Pool: Is super small and I immediately wrote it off but later found out it is a "swim-spa" with adjustable jets so you can swim against a current. Again, small and with that in mind is set up more like a single person pool. Bar/Restaurant: I grabbed a simple breakfast one morning and found my carton of milk to be partially frozen and the coffee to be watery. I'm on a booze break right now and the bartender seemed annoyed by my club soda orders each night but never charged me so I guess that made up for the unfriendly service. Overall not awesome but not horrific either. DFTBA ~ chaseI've been staying at this property every week (Monday - Thursday) for work since April 2013 and my experience with the hotel and staff has been nothing short of excellent. Would recommend for any business traveler! Service: EXCELLENT! The staff at the hotel does an excellent job of making your experience as pleasant and enjoyable as possible. The restaurant staff, front desk staff, maintenance group, cleaning staff, hotel management are FANTASTIC!! The quality of service is the main reason I've chosen this hotel for my trips to Jacksonville. Starwood Points Perks: This hotel participates in the "Green Choice" option which gives you 500 points for every night you refuse cleaning services during your stay (not valid on the day you check-out). This is NOT standard at every SPG property. Rooms: Comfortable beds and pillows. I've never had a problem with the cleanliness of my room. Rooms come with the basic standard amenities (coffee maker, bottled water, towels, shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, glasses, iron / ironing board etc). Food: There's a decent breakfast buffet in the restaurant  that's about $14 (not 100% sure). There's always oatmeal, grits, bacon, fresh fruit medley, yogurt and boiled eggs included in the buffet. In addition to those items, there's always some variance of a carb (potatoes, french toast, etc. ) and scrambled eggs of some sort. And it's actually pretty good! You also have your selection of coffee, orange juice and cranberry juice. There's also a lunch buffet (which I've only eaten from twice due to my schedule) which was also surprisingly good. From what I remember there were TONS of options for whatever your dietary restrictions may be. There's also the restaurant menu that you can order from which is a pretty standard Sheraton menu. I enjoy the beef kabobs (I order them at least once / week) and the fish tacos. I love that the staff lets me substitute the high carb items for vegetable at no extra charge. Amenities: Dry Cleaning / Laundry Service, Free Parking, Free Wifi, Club Lounge for Platinum guests, Shuttle Service (within a 5 mile radius of the hotel), Gym, Indoor poolOkay, this is has gotten long enough, but LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel!I had a confirmed room but they aparently gave it to someone else.  At 10:30 PM they were calling around to near by hotels to have me stay there.  Unacceptable.
review_content_20: I've never stayed here wrote the wrong review it was meant for the Hampton but can't erase it. Please disregard my rating. I'm sure is good though, cause Sheratons always are.Their site shows to be some grand location, but in fact it's not. The restaurant looks great. ( use to be a Shula's steakhouse) buy the food does not match the decor. They are overpriced many items and the food is nothing special.  Also stay far away from the breakfast. Take the time to find a local breakfast place. The gym is ok. The equipment is limited, but has tv and other features on them. The front desk service great. The room was not. There was a big stain on the carpet, the doorknobs to the bathroom came off easily, and the tub was dirty.  Also the tv was glitchy. I purchased in room premium movie and it kept going in and out throughout. Also the tv is small! The beds were comfy and sheets clean. I would have given them 2 stars but after the breakfast , I just couldn't. It's not worth  $132 a night for sure.Not great. Neither of the beds in my room had fresh linens, there was trash in the can from the previous occupants, and no continental breakfast. The breakfast thing would be fine, except that the breakfast served in the hotel restaurant wasn't of a high elder quality than most and cost $16. Additionally, the service crew didn't think I would like more than one day's supply if sugar for my coffee, since they didn't bother to replace what I used (they left the wrappers from the morning, but did take the time to refill the coffee and cup I used). The walls of the room were dirty with some kind of film. The hotel staff seem more focused on how the lobby of the hotel looks than the rooms apparently, because that was the only impressive part of the stay. This seems to be a backward  view on how to run a hotel, but what do I know. I know this much: I won't be giving any more of my company's money to this hotel.I struggled to make reservations on their website because it kept opening different windows.  I was so lost.  Come to find out, my reservations were wrong.  I needed my stay to be 2 nights not 1 night.  When I checked in, I was told I reserved 1 night and that my second night would be $40 more.   Or I could get back in the internet and add another night via the website.  So that's what I did.  Why are the front desk clerks not allowed to override a price for the convenience of the guests?  Crazy.I stayed at this hotel for a conference two weeks ago and left behind an expensive item. I called the hotel numerous times to have the item mailed to me and the housekeeping service failed to return my call or even acknowledge my concern. Other than this issue, the rooms were comfortable and the stay was enjoyable.SPG Platinum, former Starwood corporate employee. Hotel didn't provide proper Platinum benefits when the hotel was very slow. Breakfast in the club lounge very poorly presented-  15 minutes left in the session with multiple guests present but no attempt to replenish the food.  Attendant was aware of this but either decided (or was instructed) to not replenish. Guest room was acceptable but musty.  Spoke with manager at front desk when checking out and he stated that observed policy of not refreshing the breakfast wasn't proper and offered SPG points as compensation.Checked into my room to find the toilet clogged. It's been 25 minutes now..Upper management at this hotel is great.. Whenever I had a problem they immediately addressed and resolved the issue. This is the primary reason I am giving this four stars instead of three.Most of the front desk staff is great. A few forget to do things but are still fun to talk to and remember your name when you walk in. Carolynn at the front desk is one of my favorite. She really enjoys holding a genuine conversation. If you're into humor, talk to her.The restaurant in the hotel is moderate. Depending on your server and who is working that night, your experience will vary. One night I had exceptional service and great food. The next I had horrible service but still great food.Rooms are a decent size, what you would expect in any standard hotel room. I didn't get a chance to stay in a suite but I heard they are about 1.5 the size of a regular room. The club lounge (for those lucky enough to stay at it) is great. Although they charge for drinks (sad face) the food and breakfast is tasty.Very slow services. Waitresses there are unprofessional.  Three breakfast orders with juice and they couldn't get them all right.  We have to remind them three times to get all our food on the table in an hour.The food is terrible too.  I will go to a starbucks next time.Oh yeah, another first for the pig!This place looks very new. Maybe it's because it was fairly new. The girl at the front desk was very nice. She drove us around for dinner in a mini van, and we brought her nice ice cream for dessert. The restaurant on site serves pretty nice sandwiches as well. I think it was Don Shula's grill. We could always count on the bartender to point us at the right direction for some food and fun after work.The rooms are very nicely set up. The bathroom isn't the greatest, but the bed was awesome. I wish I can take one of those beds home.So this is funny. I didn't complete the review. 2 days later, Matty S beat me to the punch:-D He certainly deserves it. Since he knows the area, you can probably get more information from that review. For me, it's all about the people and the mini van;)A quick update to say that that my second stay was just as wonderful as my first.  I love this property and think it's a great place to stay.  Clean, quiet, comfortable, and not bad rates.A few weeks ago, a stay in the Jacksonville area became necessary, and I decided to try the Sheraton due to it's close proximity to the event I was attending, and I have to say was pretty impressed, and left satisfied. The first thing I noticed was the close proximity to the freeway, it was right off the exit, but not close enough where you could still hear the traffic. It is also about 1/2 mile away from the St. Johns Town Center, so you are very close to lots of shopping and good restaurants.There is TONS of parking available, so you won't have a problem finding a place to get in and out. The lobby was very clean, very modern, and the staff at the front desk was very polite and knowledgeable. I was checked in in under 3 minutes and on my way. The elevator to go up to the rooms can only be activated by room key, so you have a nice security element there. I noticed the entire hotel on the way to the room was very clean, and had a nice, professional look to it. There's even a Shula's steakhouse in the hotel itself, a very nice looking restaurant with a nice bar, although I believe they close at 11.The room itself was everything it should've been. Flat-screen TV on the wall, HUGE desk with comfortable chair, nice table with coffee maker and menus. The bed was huge, incredibly comfortable, and very clean sheets. The bathroom was pretty good sized, but very clean, plenty of room to move about. The only weird thing I noticed was that there was no fan to turn on, so since I like HOT showers, it took a while for the steam to leave the room. Other than that, I had absolutely no complaints.Overall, I had a great stay here. Everything was clean and crisp, service was great, and I like the proximity to not only the Town Center, but there are LOTS of great restaurants and bars in the area on Southside Blvd. The only downside was that the hotel itself is kind of all by itself, the only thing within walking distance was a Shell gas station with a convenience store attached. I left feeling refreshed and relaxed, and if I'm in the area again, I would DEFINITELY stay here.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn Jacksonville Orange Park
review_content: I have finally found a wonderful hotel for my parents when they come to town to visit that isn't too far from where I live.  I've booked them at a couple of other hotels that really sucked and then I finally found this La Quinta.  They have a chihuahua they always travel with and often it's difficult to find a really good hotel that allows dogs at all.  Most of the really nice hotels in Orange Park do not allow dogs... period.  Trust me, I've called nearly every one of them and asked. Not only does this La Quinta allows dogs, but they don't even charge a deposit for them.  They allow dogs to stay for free.  You just have to sign a form saying that if your dog tears anything up then you are liable for it.  No problem.  Especially considering my mom's chihuahua is a tiny, little 4 pound thing. Check in was a breeze.  The lobby was nice and clean.  The employees were so friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The room was really nice.  Not only did it look clean, but it smelled clean.  That's always a good thing.  The bathroom was larger than I expected.  Plenty of room for two people to move around in at the same time.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the sheets and pillows had a nice, fresh smell to them.  I stayed with them one the nights they were here and I slept very, very well.  Flatscreens are in the room and they are a nice, decent size with a good picture. There are also small refrigerators and microwaves in all of the rooms.  Free Wifi is included.  I used it with my iPad and it runs at a nice, smooth speed.A continental breakfast is provided at no charge.  They have the usual like fruit, pastries, oatmeal, toast, bagels, various juices, and coffee. The price per night is also very affordable.  They paid around $55 per night.This La Quinta is located just off of 295 at the Orange Park/Blanding exit.  It can be a bit difficult to get to if you aren't familiar with the area, but it is located directly behind the Denny's.  So, just look for Denny's as soon as you get off 295 and you'll find it with no problems. There are plenty of fast food restaurants and chain restaurants like Olive Garden, Longhorn, Carrabbas, etc. in the area.  The Orange Park Mall is also located less than a mile from this hotel.  In the future, when my parents visit, this will definitely be the hotel where I make them reservations.Very depressing. Old un-renovated rooms. TV didn't work properly. Terrible breakfast. At least there was hot water.The room was not cleaned properly. There was an unpleasant smell. The bathroom floor and frig were filthy. I doubt anyone even looked in the frig, because the was a sandwich that someone forgot to take with them. We skipped the free breakfast! On a positive note the AC was cold.We stayed in this La Quinta in January 2015 to attend a funeral. I will never stay there  again. We were locked out. When we got back to our room Sunday at 12:25 am we were locked out in the cold temperatures in 40s and was windy couldn't go inside the lobby still locked out rang the bell to let the clerk what happened she was too busy to come to the door and let us in after 7 minutes she finally did was very rude and unprofessional. The room was supposed to be nonsmoking but we could smell smoke the carpet was filthy and smelled bad. As I said I will not stay there again.Really run down motel. The room was not cleaned when we got in it. There was an empty beer can next to the bed and my daughters bed had a yellow substance smeared down the side of the bed frame and mattress. Disgusting! They were understaffed. All through the night there was noise such as banging and stomping. If I tried to call the front desk it was at no succcess since no one answered. At 2:30am I was not about to walk to the front desk. It was just a really bad experience overall. There are other hotels/motels out there much better for the same price. I would not recommend this one.We have trouble traveling because of our very large dog. This la quinta was nice, clean and our dog had plenty of room to move around. The king size bed was so nice and comfy! The reason why im not giving it 5 stars is the location is tricky! Blanding is a very busy street and the traffic was terrible. Plus the hotel is behind businesses and two other motels so at first we drove past it. Perhaps there should be a sign or something...Usually stay here several nights every year since we get a discount rate for a large group. Always have an okay experience but nothing I would rave about. Rooms don't have fridge, microwave, etc. all of that is located in the front office so you have to go up there if you need it. Stayed next to pool last time and several were out there drinking so I refused to allow my kids to go swimming while there. The room I was in had a spacious bathroom but only two small full size beds.DISGUSTINGLY DIRTY!!!Now that I have gotten your attention let me expand on that. We have traveled all over the East coast and we stay at La Quinta because of their dog friendly hotels, cleanliness, free breakfast, and quality for the price.  We've stayed at over a dozen and this one was by far the worst of them all. The place wasn't in the best of neighborhoods and doors were directly outside with no indoor hallways.  We felt a little unsafe here but we were tired and didn't want to cancel out reservation to find another place last minute. We get in and not only does it reek of smoke, but they didn't give us enough toilet paper. After a long drive I needed to go to the bathroom and headed their first and there was poop on the toilet seat!!!!! Not bowel, but seat. Desperate to use the restroom I cleaned it up and uses antibacterial wipes all over that seat. While in there I noticed some mysterious hot pink stain on the towels. It could have been lipstick or gloss but what it was was evidence that the cleaning lady did not do her job well! Went to front desk to ask for clean towels and the poor night guy apologizes profusely as of this happens a lot. We settled in to find a mysterious brown spot/stain on the duvet! I have no idea if it was a bodily fluid or chocolate or some other brown fluid but again aren't these supposed to be hanged between guests along with towels?!!! Not happy about this at all. At about 3am to 4am the trash dump truck scared the living daylight a out of us by dropping the dumpster loudly on the ground. In a shady neighborhood this was quite terrifying. Can't comment much on the food quality as we skipped it. Didn't trust how well prepared and up to health code it would be with all the "cleanliness" of the hotel room. Didn't want to risk it. After this stay we got an email from la Quinta asking us to rate our stay and give feedback about it. We found this a little odd as we have never received this email from any of the other 12 or so that we have stayed at. We're guessing that corporate has gotten some complaints lately and/or is evaluating that place for a reason. All in all, avoid this location at all costs.The signs to find this place did suck as the other reviewer mentioned. The room is clean though with new carpet because it smells newly refurbished.  Room is close to the city being only 10 miles out and room is also close to several places to eat right around it. It is kind of silly how they put a Laquinta, Super 8 and Country Inn and Suites in the same parking lot though.Still a decent hotel. They get an extra star because they actually acknowledged my LQ "Elite" status. Manager kind of made a deal about it when I checked in, but in retrospect, I do appreciate it because I stay in a ton of LQ inns, many cost a lot more, and rarely do they thank me for my repeated patronage. So extra gold star for you for making me feel just a little special!Dirty. We checked in and there were pubic hairs in the bath tub and on the floor. The top bed spread sheet had some crusty brown stuff on it. We decided to just take it off. We put it with our dirty towels to be collected but the maid just put it back on the bed! So we called the front for a new one, it took them 2 hours to bring another one that had a bunch of little black hairs all over it. Our third day they just didn't come clean our room. Called the front and they said they had no idea why they didn't come. Didn't offer to send anyone just told us we could come get new towels. I just felt so dirty staying in this place. The front desk guy that helped us was apologetic and tried to be helpful but I highly recommend anywhere else.

Room was clean. Bed was good. No bugs in sight. Got what I payed for. Reasonably priced.Tried checking into our preferred La Quintas, but they were booked and after 12 hours on the road we just went across the parking lot to Red Roof Inn. I checked the reviews AFTER we were checked in and in our room, and was a bit alarmed, but we had a fine night. Room was clean, comfortable. Smelled a little musty when we first entered but we flipped on the air and it was soon fine. Quiet, comfortable place to spend a night on the road. Deducted a star because no breakfast and wifi was terrible. These are two things I expect at a place like this, even if a seldom partake of the breakfast. We saw NO sign of bugs whatsoever.-stars!  We travel ALOT with our dogs and have stayed at many Red Roofs but this one told us we could only have one of our two dogs with us.   So we cancelled that shit and went to La Quinta.  Very sad Jacksonville Red Roof, that you have different rules than all the others.It's a good bang for the buck.  The bed was comfortable and the shower had great water pressure.  Only had two issues, one the vinyl flooring didn't look clean enough where I felt comfortable enough walking around w/o my shoes on and the other is I saw a roach in the bathroom w/ me.  I was on the toilet when I noticed a roach crawling on the wall next to me.  I attempted to kill it, but it got away and crawled under the base of the wall.  The roach issue makes me wonder whether I would stay here again.  If they fumigated and got rid of those guys, I would definitely stay here again.I'm very disappointed in this stay, due to the fact, I'm writing this review at 1:15am, because we had to switch rooms, where a bug was crawling on me while I was trying to sleep. I turned the light on and there it was in bed with me. I tried to kill it but no success, I started looking for it and more, but to my surprise I find mold growing on the bedspread!!!I hit the roof, now I'm sleeping and breathing in mold by my face, WTH!!! Not cool at all.  I called the front desk and told the lady named Kelly and she switched our room immediately and even assisted us with our luggage, which was nice.  Overall I thought this hotel was up on its game since it's lodged between three top chain hotels but I guess they still have some work to do.  But to be honest, before the incident, I had reservations about staying here and had a second thought, to give this place a chance.Well, to be fair I will think more about staying here again after I calm down and get some sleep, but I don't know.Looks like it's been recently renovated. Great budget option for single night stays. Vinyl plank flooring in the rooms is ingenious for this place as it accepts pets - much easier to keep rooms looking and smelling clean and sanitary.  Superior King room was spacious and clean, fridge, micro, and coffeemaker all worked fine. Nice new Panasonic Flat Panel TVs with HD cable (incl HBO). Would definitely stay here again. No frills, but clean, quiet, safe, and inexpensive!  I paid $57 for a night.I've stayed at this Red Roof Inn several times.  I take my dog, Molly, with me when I travel. It's nice to stay at a place that doesn't charge extra for pets.  (I'm not sure if they charge extra if you have more than one pet.)  It is located close to I 95.  The room was nice.  Nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable.  They have free parking and a pool.  Most of the Red Roof Inns I've stayed at have a continental breakfast.  Even though it's not a lot of food, I enjoy it.  This one has coffee in the lobby, but no breakfast.  There are several fast food type restaurants a short drive away.  Every time I stay, they put a charge on my bill for the room safe, which I don't use.  I have to ask them to take the charge off, which they do.  I think they should ask you if you used the safe before charging.  If I didn't check my bill, I would have been paying extra for something I didn't use.  The first time I stayed there I didn't notice the safe charge until I was back on the road.  I had to call the hotel to have the charge  removed from my credit card.  They were nice enough to email me a new receipt.The price is very reasonable, especially if you book through their web site.  They give a senior discount.Terrible place, drug transactions and panhandling while we were at the pool. The doors were left propped open all night so anyone could come and go as they please, and they did all night. Another guest was complaining at the front desk that she was robbed during her stay. Dim lit parking lot that doesn't feel safe after dark. All in all a very bad choice.It was horrible. No fridge, no microwave, and no good channel on cable TV. I was pissedCannot beat this price for nice hotel room with the minimum.It doesn't get any better than than this for $58 (price includes taxes.) Bare essentials and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Jacksonville East Regency Square
review_content: Not the newest or cleanest Hampton Inn, but meets my expectation for this chain. Some Hampton properties are newer and better than others. Some are older and worse. This was right in the middle for me, for a one night stay for less than 12 hours. Solo front desk staff person could have been friendlier at check in by putting his cell phone down, but overall experience served my purpose. Nice location off 295 near mall, movie theater, and nice chain restaurants.I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business because it was close to my meeting location and Orbitz for Business (my company's travel service) recommended it. Staying there was a mistake. This place is a dive. My room on the 4th floor smelled musty. The carpet and furniture were damp. The room smelled so bad that it was difficult to tolerate.  The furniture was beat up.  The iron had white flaky debris that soiled my shirt. No moldings around walls. Just a gross place.My colleague complained of the same issues on the 2nd floor.I called the front desk to inquire about a fan or some other solution to the stink. They had nothing to offer. Service did not meet expectations.2 stars because the gentleman that checked me in was very friendly and polite. I would avoid this hotel.A fine business hotel.  There is not much here, and it is not a place I would bring my family--but great for work if you need to be in JAX.Note, there is a well-stocked gas station in easy walking distance, as well as a few close restaurants.The staff are very friendly, and the rooms were clean.  Some of the furniture was a bit banged up and showing its age.  A cosmetic refresh on this hotel is probably due, but wouldn't stop me from coming back.I was worried when I read the reviews. Really worried. This place was great. Always fresh fruit flavored water and cookies Great breakfast. Clean rooms and really fast service! I was impressed.This may be the worst Hampton Inn they have, I hope the rest are better.  It is not so new, not so nice, and not so clean.  They have no problem charging too much for it though.  Here is what my room was like:  Plaster-cracked walls with amateurish repairs and too many coats of paint, that funny smell...like a basement, and a bathroom that looks like something from 1960.  Forget about this one, it is a loser all around.My 1-star rating is based on the room we just left, after 1 night of a planned 6-night stay.  This hotel has some kind of WATER PROBLEM - at least in our section of it (on the 5th floor).  It was very, very damp - including the carpet - enough to require drying out all our clothes after we moved to another hotel.  When I explained why we were leaving early, no acknowledgement of a problem from the front desk.On the plus side, guest service at the hotel exceeds the service I typically get from Hilton Honors reps when I call.  In this case, no comps, no incentives to move to another local Hilton property, no "sorry for the inconvenience" - just the impression that it's only about having me spend more money.  (Side note: don't even think about joining Hilton Grand Vacations club!)If not for the water problem, I'd have probably given this Hampton 3 stars - at first glance it seems OK.  Not a great location, no good restaurants nearby - it's best attribute for me was the very nice woman who was doing the breakfast buffet.AVOID THIS HOTEL!  The dressers smell!  Discovered that they are wiped down with a dirty moldy towel.  The carpet was also extremely filthy in my room.  Before I discovered how dirty the carpet was I ended up destroying a pair of socks.  The floors were sooooo dirty, I had to wash my feet before I went to sleep otherwise I would track debris and dirt into bird.  Also, hot water was non existent in the morning.Even with a Diamond status, I was not able to secure a room with either a mini fridge or microwave.Man, I hate giving bad reviews without really giving it a chance. But, I'll tell everyone this. This place smells so bad omg! Like old undried laundry. It's pretty affordable considering how close we were to Bestbet. For us DG's it's 5star I guess. Pump that ac low and get your nose ready to adjust to the smell. After a while it be awesome. Just to catch some zzzzzz at least. Better then my fourth of July trip here. Slept in the mofo car for 3hrs. Woke up in that heat. No effn Hotel at all. Check at least 30 hotels. FmlAlthough this Hampton Inn is located on Hospitality Lane, do not be fooled. They are NOT hospitable. The staff was rude and it just didn't seem like they had control of the place. The water in Jacksonville is horrible so after the vending machine ate my dollar they gave me what they said was a "complimentary water" at the front desk. When I asked for another one the next morning, still not being refunded my money, I was rudely answered with "What is your name?" "Oh.. those are only for our Gold and Platinum members."Their breakfast was also really poorly maintained and kept running out of juice, there was no ice for the yogurt, AND even their juice tasted like the nasty J-ville water. Sorry, Hampton. You suck.Nice, new clean. Walmart Supercenter and a mall nearby.  Ruby Tuesdays next door. Great place to be for a few days of work.Perfectly ok. Very friendly staff. Near mayport but think I will stay a few miles south next to the st johns town center next trip. Have stayed at well over 50 Hamptons and nothing bad to say about this one. Solidly in the average.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn & Suites Jacksonville South - Bartram Park
review_content: What a great place to rest your traveling head and recharge your batteries. It was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on while traveling. The breakfast was free and offered fresh made hot waffles, bacon and eggs. This will become my new Jax home while traveling to the area.We are diamond members and have stayed here and at many Hampton inns all over the country. The room was very nice and the maid service excellent. Clean and quiet with many places to shop and eat nearby. However I must rate the breakfast a 1 star.  Totally unsatisfactory.  The food was awful and the selection terrible for diabetics gluten issues and lactose issues.  When my 34 year old daughter asked if she could get a plain omelet because of her lactose issues she was told to scrape off the cheese from the omelette! Seriously the lack of consideration was appalling and the management did nothing so we ate breakfast out at a delicious Panera each morning!  There were no hard boiled eggs and by 8:30 they ran out of fresh fruit refusing to cut up more. I know this was not billed as a full restaurant menu but NO other Hampton suites have this issue.  Sorry to say we will not be back on our next trip to Jacksonville Florida.  You've lost us!This is the first time we stayed at a Hamption inn. The room was clean only found 2 mold spots that were the size of a small dot ( pencil point ) . The breakfast was good for free. The bed was  really comfortable. The staff at the front desk and the ladies that were managing  the breakfast were always friendly. The location was great only a short car ride to St. Augustine.  We will be back and I would recommend this place to anyone who is  looking for a clean place to stay  and Close to St.Augustine .I stayed here with some friends while in Jacksonville last month, and our stay was decent. This Hampton Inn is pretty typical with their freshly laundered sheets, free wi-fi and complimentary hot breakfast. The decor was updated and modern and definitely offers a comfortable stay. My only complaint was the woman who worked the breakfast in the morning was very rude and off-putting. The morning after our first night's stay, my two girlfriends and I walked down to the breakfast, and after uncomfortably staring at us for a minute or two, the woman came over and asked if we were guests at the hotel. Really? I have stayed at dozens of hotels and never had someone come up to me at breakfast and question if I was even a guest. And it doesn't seem as if this hotel is in a location that attracts homeless people wandering in for a free meal. From what I noticed, we were the only ones she did that to....odd. We also overheard her make a snide comment to a child at the waffle maker. So yeah...we jokingly named her Elmira (or maybe that is her name, I don't remember) so beware of her wrath!Overall, decent hotel if you're staying in the Jax area.Stayed here on a recent trip as I was passing through town.  Conveniently located right off I-95 and seems to be very new.  The lobby are was very nice with a TV mounted behind a running wall of water.  I was pleasantly surprised as was not expecting this at a Hampton Inn.  The room was run of the mill with two double beds and the typical bathroom.  The bathroom was quite spacious for a hotel room.  There is a continental breakfast provided every morning, but the offerings can vary from day to day.Very clean and in a business park.  Friendly staff with free breakfast in the morning.  Not too many hot things and I've seen other Hampton's do it better but still nice.  Clean room with plenty of towels etc.  Quiet.  Would stay again.What a terrific hotel!  The price was more than fair, given our AARP discount and included free WiFi.  The entire facility was exceptionally clean, including the pool.  The staff was friendly and effective, especially Jesse, at the front desk.  The bedding was comfortable and the room was spacious.  The complementary breakfast was lovely.This Hampton Inn is conveniently located and, despite its proximity to Interstate 95 and a busy 4-land street, we noticed no road noise whatsoever.I'd left my iPad behind, and with one quick phone call, Jesse arranged to send it to me.  It arrived today.  Thank you, Jesse, and thank you, Hampton Inn.We will definitely return.Hampton Inn, Bartram ParkConveniently located right off 95 and about 20 minute south of the city. The hotel is less than two years old and immaculate. Hotel Summary:Large Parking AreaChic lobbySuper friendly and efficient staffWell appointed rooms/suitesComplimentary breakfastFree wirelessSmall on-site convenient storePool with fitness roomComplimentary BreakfastLarge breakfast area with several different seating arraignments including 24hr coffee, tea and hot chocolate  serviceBreakfast is serviced between 6am to 10am, includes make your own waffles, assorted hot and cold cereals, assorted fruits, yogurts, assorted breads and muffins, premade bacon, cheese and egg omelet on bagel, juices, milk and waterSuite/RoomsSuite are nicely decorated and spacious with granite countertops, 2 queen bed with plush benches, sofa with coffee table, chair with ottoman, 32in flat screen, toilet and shower are separate from the large sink/makeup area. There is prep area with refrigerator, microwave, coffee machine, under counter storage and small bar sink.Other AmenitiesBeautiful hardscaped outdoor pool (not heated) Small but adequate fitness room with newer equipment(Dumbbells, medicine and exercise balls, treadmill and elliptical w/TV screens).35mi paved walking or running track Local shopping in walking distance (supermarket, restaurants, fuel/ convenient store and liquor store)Added DetailsFairly priced ($120)Comcast FriendlyHappy Trails!Recently stayed here. My only complaint was the air conditioner was very noisy. The A/C unit was so lould it would wake me up in the middle of the night. Saff were nice and exceptionally friendly. When I presented my complaint  to the front desk they stated you have a 50% chance of getting a lould A/C. They are going to be replacing the units soon I was told.We stayed here as a stop over half way home from Miami to SC.  We stopped in Jacksonville to sleep.  We arrived there around midnight.  I had used yelp to find this location and call ahead to reserve a room.  They said they had plenty of rooms, and we didn't need a reservation.  They quoted us a price of $125 for a double queen room.When we arrived about 10 minutes later, there had been a shift change.  The new manager, Steve, was great.  He was friendly, and offered to upgrade the room for the same price.  He put us in a queen suite, which had two queen beds and pull out sofa, so my son wouldn't have to sleep on the floor again.  That was a welcome upgrade!!The room was huge!  Free internet for which they provided the password without having to ask.  We were told there was a free breakfast in the morning.  Beds were comfortable, room clean, and an excellent experience.The Belgian waffles the next morning were a big hit with the teenagers.  The buffet was all you care to eat, and it was nicely stocked.  Staff was keeping the  area clean while were there and restocking as items were depleted.Great experience.  I am keeping the information and will stay at this hotel again when in the area.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Jacksonville Downtown-Southbank
review_content: What a change from one night to the next!!!! After the horrible service last night I told Mercida, the front desk person today, about what we had endured. She couldn't have been more friendly and said let me see what I can do. Right before she sent us up to our room with our key she said, "sorry for the low floor, but this is the best I can do!"When we arrived in our room we were astounded! She had given us the corner two bedroom suite. This room is easily 1500 square feet with three tv's, two bathrooms and a fantastic view of the street.Again, with any large hotel chain, some experiences are good and some bad. As long as the good outweigh the bad we're in good shape.Thanks again, Mercida for the incredible customer service!!!I had to come here for business, so I decided to bring the kids along for small vacation. We stayed here a week and then went to Orlando and then came back here for a week. The staff was friendly and great to deal with. They accommodated me with a double queen suite and when I returned I got a double queen with the separate suite for the same price. Some of the Jacksonville Jaguars were staying here for practice so we even ran into players. The breakfast was great, but the second week I really missed the waffle maker (one of my perks for this place). They are only 30 minutes away from several beaches and at Mickler Brach you can find great sea shells and shark teeth (if you search real hard). They are really close to the free train that takes you further downtown, loved everything about our stay.After staying in a Homewood Suites in Atlanta, when my amazing sister in law told us she was coming down to Jax with the kiddos, I suggested this place to her. I knew it was a fairly new building and had a few former bosses stay at the Hilton next door. Which, with that said, they are right together, just make sure you go in the correct door. :) Full disclaimer, I did not stay here, but we did hang out quite a bit in the room and dining area. Tip: If you are visiting guests, drive on around to the left of the parking garage to the back of the hotel. There aren't a ton of parking spots, but they are free. The room was nice and cozy. I like rooms with the suite set-up, especially if you have been on a long road trip and like to bring your own snacks. The kids loved the pool too.The buffet breakfast was of your average buffet variety, nothing fancy but not bad. And one last tip.... beer drinkers! If you are traveling into Jax, Aaradwolf brewery is within walking distance.If you really enjoy hearing a screaming loud train whistle/horn blow at midnight, 2 am, 4 am, 6 am, etc....then this is the perfect hotel for you!Well it's got pros & cons. Here goes:Cons: TRAINS! Holy crap they are loud and they blow by all day and all night. I live downtown back home, so I'm used to sirens and train whistles, but this is a little different because the train tracks are two blocks away. You cannot avoid them. They are loud as hell. My advice is get some wine.Rude front desk. Check in was awful. I'm a HH Diamond member. I don't expect to be treated any differently than anyone else, but damn. They acted like I was a pain in their ass just for being there.No Lodgenet (pay per view movies and games).The bar closes really early (10:00p).PROS:Great view of downtown Jacksonville, especially from the eighth floor balcony.Comfy clean, new rooms with lots of space.Very friendly bell staff.More than one premium channel (HBO, HBO2, HBO Signature, etc.)It's close to several nice restaurants like BB's.It's 5 minutes to downtown Jacksonville (proper). Straight shot over I-95 North.They have a pool table in the breakfast area.Free beer and appetizers Monday - Thursday 5:30 - 7:30p.There is a local dive bar directly across the street that's open until 2:00a. When the hotel bar closes at 10:00, everyone just walks over there and continues the night.Great stay! They even upgraded our room at no cost. Breakfast and atmosphere were incredible. Very warm staff!Of the Homewood Suites I've stayed in, the rooms here seem to be the smallest. Instead of having a door to separate the bedroom, the bed is in another portion of the room. Furniture seems slightly crowded, as the kitchenette table is RIGHT next to the kitchen. There is still a couch and desk, but it just seems a bit crowded when you first walk into the room.Nonetheless, the bed is comfortable, and the room is clean. There is a shower stall as opposed to a bathtub. Like other Homewood Suites, you have a kitchenette (stocked with cooking utensils, dishes, etc.), including a couple of electric coils for cooking.The free food is pretty decent. In the evening, I had a deli sandwich (choices of various meats, cheeses, and breads), chips (several Mrs Vickie's brand chip bags to choose from), and condiments (including pickles). There was also a salad bar and wine set in ice buckets for self-pouring. I would definitely stay here again!This looks to be a new Homewood Suites built adjacent to a Hilton Garden Inn. I love this setup because you have the option of staying in the homey feel and large rooms associated with the Suites, as well as the free dinner (and I understand beer as well) and breakfast, while maintaining the option of going to the Garden Inn section for their bar/restaurant. The rooms are modern, large and well appointed complete with a 42" flat screen LCD TV with HD resolution. The beds are very comfy with tons of pillows. The room came with a kitchen, so you have the option of making your own food as well. The room was spotless. If you don't want to be stuck in the room, they have a nice gym, pool as well as a pool table. Pretty cool. Also a large 55" HDTV is in the main room, where they serve dinner and breakfast and is perfect to watch a NFL game or what have you. Service here is very responsive and polite. The only drawback is the parking fee of $9. However, at least your car is in a gated garage that is only accessible to hotel guests. Would definitely stay here again!3/4/13. Trains Trains and more trains!! It is 12:07am on Mon night and hopefully this is the LAST train for the night!!! The train noise / whistle is loud and you WILL notice it, especially if you are a light sleeper. The hotel itself is nice, big and comfortable clean room and gets 4 stars. 1 star for the train noise at midnight!!I love Homewood Suites. When you have a party of more than four, you need the extra space and amenities; Homewood delivers on all fronts! Not only are there sufficient space, but having breakfast included in the mornings makes this place of great value. You don't go here for luxury, that's what the standard Hiltons are for; rather, you come here for comfort, convenience, and value! This particular hotel was clean and very reasonable. There are numerous special that run, but you have to go to Hilton.com in order to get them. Don't rely on what is published on Orbitz or the like. This hotel also has a nice lounge complete with a pool table and fire place (when it's colder). Unlike most Homewoods, you have to pay for parking here, but not a deal breaker. Will stay here again when in Jacksonville!Weird....Homewood Suites by Hilton Jacksonville? It's called the Hilton Garden Inn I thought??? Anyway it's average to me. Location is good for walking to the river. Look out for the bar across the street "Endo Exo"!!!! It's swingers night on Saturday. Real shady stuff. The reel deal. The place is real Loud so if you have a room facing the bar across the street....sorry for you. Also there are a lot of swingers staying at the hotel that night so expect a lot of banging on the walls if ya know what i mean.

I stayed for one night. I do love Residence Inns as a matter of course. This was fine. Not the best. But good. The room was large. The rub was nice but had a small rusty spot and there was a hair in the sink. The rest of the room was clean and perfect. I walked in to find a card and a snack. The card said I was the "Guest of the Day" which made my long day better and made me feel so special. I didn't know they did that but it was a really nice touch. The property is nice. Great location. Kind staff. I opted for a Marriott deal and snagged a $25 gas gift card to Daily's, one of the greatest gas station chains and a Jax locals' favorite, which was great. The hotel is pet friendly which I loved. I didn't bring my dog but next time I will. Breakfast was yummy. A waffle maker, eggs, Danish, yogurt, French toast, cereals, coffee, flavored creamer, juice, bagels, muffins, etc. They added a nice touch by adding things to add to your waffle (ex: walnuts, chocolate chips, strawberries, etc). My room was near the back stairs so it was a short walk across the courtyard to get food and then I ate in my room. The main lobby had a fire going, which was beautiful and perfect considering it was in the 50's. My room was good. Quiet location. But the bed was hard! Like a little softer than the floor, but not substantial. I couldn't sleep! The pillows were super lumpy. The bed was right under the AC vent so when the heat was on I felt like it was a little annoying to breathe the hot air and when the AC was on I was freezing. Normally Marriott beds are amazing. I have stayed at many Marriotts, from the Residence to the Curio Collections. The bed is like a part of their signature. This bed was pretty awful. By any hotel standards.  Which was the only real disappointing part of my stay. I would have given 4-5 stars if not for the bed.Dec 2-3 2015 Stay: Brandon the office manager planned a renovation to re-enamel the bath tubs on all floors. Needless to say HE did not display the renovation work on the Marriott website or on the front desk... like all other Marriott hotels are required to do. Keep in mind I  am a Platinum Marriott member so I spend alot of times in Marriott hotels. They are supposed to notify patrons on renovations. Brandon told me point blank, it was he who set up the renovation and planned it. So he chose to let the vendors open the doors to the rooms getting renovated and vent them into the hall. Keep in mind the vendor who applied the enamel BY LAW was required to put a sticker on the door warning people to NOT ENTER. This should tell you that this stuff is harmful if inhaled. It is in fact a carcinogen. (See label Vendor left on each door in the photos section) Why Brandon would choose to do the entire hotel, rather than sectioning off a floor is beyond me. I guess he was trying to save $$$$$ at your and my health's expense.I met another patron in the parking lot and they told me they were having respiratory issues. The Brandon option was they can leave or move to another floor with "less" work being done.It is clear that Brandon the office manager has no issue whatsoever putting patrons in harms way to save him money.Okay, let me start by saying, we stayed here for free, for one night, using our Marriott rewards points, so it's safe to say, we've stayed in a few of their properties.Secondly, it was close to the Thanksgiving day events going on at the nearby shopping center.The good..... This property looks great on the outside. The center courtyard has a pool, a grilling area and a court area than can be used for basketball, volleyball or maybe tennis. It really "feels" more like an apartment complex. The staff that we had interactions with were very friendly.Our suite was pretty clean, didn't smell. The kitchenette is nice to have.The bad..... We went through 5 room keys before we got one that would let us in to the suite on a consistent basis.There was a spot on the sidewalk that was uneven by almost 2 inches...a real trip hazard.The carpet in the suite, hallway and stairs have stains. Really needs to be cleaned.The ugly.... The bathroom is too dark. The shower curtain rod was about to fall down. The shower fixtures are loose in the wall and worst of all, the side panel is bowed out from the wall (see pic). It really looked like some "weekend warrior" installed it.This property started out looking like a 4 or 5 star, but the negatives really brought it down for us and we're glad we stayed for free.Nice hotel in a good area. Felt safe. Friendly front desk - Paige. Only complaint: the tub collected water in the shower because the drain did not clear quick enough. They need to buy some draino.I visited the Residence Inn in Jacksonville, Florida on last night October 23, 2015.Unfortunately, it is one of the worst Marriott properties I have ever visited.I don't know where to start,We were in room 317 and from the time we stepped foot on the elevator, we knew this was going to be a long night.The hall, elevator and room was terrible.They all had a stench that you couldn't get past. It smelt as if something was molding or just unclean. When we entered the room, there were dirty foot prints in the carpet.Okay at this point let's just try to make the night. Next issue the bathrooms were not fresh along with the bed coverings having an odor.We made the night, but I,  really couldn't sleep.After taking a shower my wife and both daughters said that they really didn't feel clean due to the place being so bad.Two other issues:Water noise at the air conditioner all night and the shower curtain falling down.I wanted to ensure that Marriott knew how terrible this place is due to it being the right place for a family to stay but not if it's this nasty!!!!This place is a little outdated, but other than that great AC, great shower, comfy bed, microwave, full size fridge, dishwasher pretty sweet set up. Breakfast is amazing at this place. Nice towels which is a plus! Little workout room? Has 3 treadmills, a bike and elliptical, a few Dumbbells, also a nice big pool with hot tub.My husband and two children stayed here in a suite for three days in mid July/2015.  The kids had so much fun having their own room and bathroom while my husband and I had our own room, bathroom, and desk.  There were three TV's in the suite, a full kitchen, pool, hot tub, and complimentary breakfast plus a gym on premises.  There are also themed evening activities to hang out with other guests.  There is also room service.  Especially with a huge mall nearby, you won't want to leave.  The price is also extremely reasonable.  I would definitely recommend this place.  The only negative is the construction and traffic, but that is not the fault of the hotel.  I do recommend getting an early start.  Another plus is the hotel will give you two hours extra without charge when asked in advance.I definitely think this hotel is worth the price and around the corner from a lot of shopping you can't go wrong.  I had a studio which was a nice size room.  The bed was comfortable.  The bathtub had a little rust on the bottom of it but that didn't stop me from becoming clean. The pool was a nice size along with a hot tub. The free breakfast was a plus!  The room is clean and nice, I would go back.Great stay. Comfy beds. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Great free food & free drinks 3 days a week! Dog friendly!Room was yucky and in dire need of new carpet and other fixtures. Stains and burn marks in carpet. I should have asked for a different room.  Missing cabinets. So unlike the other Residence Inns I've stayed at. Beds were clean tho!Don't stay here. Horrible management, bugs in room definitely not Marriott standard. So many other better hotel options in the area.I thought this place was closer to the Town Center than it was.  All in all it was an ok hotel.  The rooms were not bad and fairly clean.  The second day I was there I guess they just decided not to clean the room?  Not sure why, it wasn't the end of the world though.  I would stay here again if I was in the area.Stayed here during Easter break on a last minute getaway with a very limited budget. So I wanted a place that served breakfast, could give a room that would accommodate 2 adults and 2 kids using my Marriott Rewards member points. Most locations by the beach were in such high demand that I couldn't use points or rooms were too small so I opted for this location. We checked in late at night and the check in process was so so. I was expecting the worst so was pleasantly surprised rooms were decent. I asked for a roll away bed and it was delivered while we were out to dinner. On Tuesday house keeping came only made the bed and didn't make the roll away bed. On Wednesday house keeping came but did nothing except leave towels and throw a dish and a glass in the dishwasher. On Thursday again only the bed was made no clean towels were left and bathroom was not cleaned so whatever sand the kids brought in from the beach was there when we came back from dinner I was do pissed because I had tipped the cleaning lady knowing the state of the room. On Friday I had enough I complained to the manager who promptly had someone go in clean our room, drop off fresh towels and vacuum all the sand. When I ran into the housekeeping lady she was apologizing profusely in Spanish and from what I could understand basically said she was rushed by management to quickly clean the rooms and didn't have enough time to clean all the rooms. So because of my housekeeping experience this place gets 2 stars but overall it was ok and most of the staff was super friendly so I gave it a 3 star. There's a few guests that are long term guests and they were also very friendly. The property only has two grills and one grill was down so had to share the grill with the regulars. I would suggest they make a schedule for cleaning the gym because as much as our room was barely cleaned the cleaning guy came into the gym  at least 3 times within my hour work out. Its a small room so it was kinda creepy and awkward having him in there while myself and another lady were working out.Good price, nothing to really set it apart from other suite hotels. Friendly maid. No room service other than an expensive 3rd party catering service with limited hours.Not nearly as nice as the sheraton next door. Frankly, it's more expensive most of the time as well.They do provide decent snacks, for free, like all other residence inns.However, the rooms are not nearly as big or clean. I found all kinds of hair on the bed when I first arrived. It's down right disgusting!'nuff saidBe aware that public areas and guest rooms on the first floor are under renovation.  You have to walk through construction areas to get to the dining room and to the parking lot.  It smells like paint and adhesive.  We had problems with plumbing and fireplace not working in the room (333).

Excellent hotel. This was the first time I ever stayed at a Townplace Suites but if they are all like this one then I may have found a new home away from home The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. My room very comfortable, clean and a pleasure to be in. From check in to check out this was one of the best stays I have had anywhere. If I need to come back to Jacksonville you can be sure I will stay here!I usually stay across the street at the H......on Inn but their prices were off the charts so TownPlace it was.Since my stay was several days I decided to hit the grocery store and cook dinner each night in my room, it was a perfect plan. The staff was friendly, the fitness center was very nice and the rooms were perfect. The only drawback was that besides waffles there wasn't much in the way of breakfast besides bread and cereal.Hotel was under remodeling. Started pounding on the ceiling of my room very early on a holiday. Management was terrifically rude and LIED about there being no work being done on my side of the hotel. Told me a story about the work on my end of the hotel being complete. Walked up the stairs and the entire hallway was filled with the kitchen units waiting to be put back in. Total joke. Made the dripping shower seem less irritating at least. Even make you pay for the washing machines. TV was a cheap piece of junk that took 30 seconds every time you changed the channel. Mediocre "high-speed" internet. Worthless for Netflix.Absolutely the most perfect hotel I have ever visited. I stayed there one night. I left, drove 21 hours to turn around and come back again to spend two nights in paradise. This property takes care of you like family. once you come here you won't stay any place else without comparing it to staying here trust me. I have never visited a hotel where I honestly met so many people on the staff that I like because they were so genuinely friendly. I think this is the perfect hotel for anyone looking to relax and unwind after a stressful incident. I came here after a death in my family and found solace. The housekeeping mgr cindy is absolutely one of the nicest ladies I have ever met. Bella and Regina are both so sweet that when you leave it's almost as though you feel like you need to rush back because you want to see them they are so warm and genuine. The management of this property takes a lot of care of the housekeeping and service aspects for the guests. They always allow enough time for you to pack and then they will help you put your luggage in your vehicle when you are checking out. As a Buddhist I crave peace and solace in accommodations, and room 414 will give you just that. Trust me, this hotel is like coming home. You are always welcomed here.I came across Towneplace suites while looking for a hotel room for my dad and I. Specifically, I wanted separate sleeping quarters. TownePlace offered a cozy and super clean 2-bedroom apartment (complete with kitchen and living area) for what other hotel chains charged for a standard double room. One bedroom had a king bed and the other a queen -- both super comfortable. The living area offered a sleeper sofa and the fully equipped kitchen featured a stove, microwave, dishwasher, and refrigerator. Inside the cabinets were plates, saucers, mugs, glasses, and silverware -- all the comforts of home. There were even a flat screen TV in every room.From the moment I called the staff was friendly and courteous. They reservations agent even offered a medical discount because I was bringing my dad to visit his sister who is in a rehab facility. On arrival, our paperwork was already processed and keys were waiting. It literally took less than 2 minutes to check in. The continental breakfast had all of the fixings to start the day off right and the check out process was seamless.Can't remember the gentleman's name that checked us in, but Bella (who made our reservation) and Lee (the front office manager) were both very kind. Lee made sure to invite us back again soon.Their apartment-like setting was an AMAZING alternative to the traditional hotel room. I was so impressed that I joined YELP just to write this review -- seriously! LOLIs it possible to ensure these people are recognized and Hotel facility is outstanding and great.Person who checked me in -Maurice or not sure if i mispronounce please forgive me i did not get his name fully -he is awesome here are detailshe wanted to ask me if he can come and drop the luggage- very nice of him -he offeredhe offered to ensure if i like the room, if not he is prepared to changethis is really awesome room similar to two bedroom suite- that was awesome.he also wanted to ensure i have iron in the room and i should be careful and very nice and thoughtful.he said anything else do not hesitate- very upbeat and nice so i thought whatever extra mile we need to tell - i was touched by this young gentleman last night around 11 :45 pm to 12 midnight appx -please check forgot the exact time..2. The Water -for the shower comes really hot - very quick, nice - normally we have to rotate more in more hotels-this is well maintained shower for hot water bath- i really like it ...it was quick, even though the bath tub is little small for squeezing-very convenient3. Air condition in the night shoots up very quickly well maintained even inf 65 or 66 if i keep it cools so quickly.4. Other two people to recognize areOutstanding front desk Manager lee hazley Ms.Lee Hazley She is highly positiveShe is prepared to smile -very hospitality industry gestureShe is quick to get things donemanage many things on the phone and help outShe went out of the way to get my Coat , Suite and Tie - done -without her help i am not sure how would i go for this particular interview or so.. very very kind gesture.she also said i can come back and change my dress -on my way home -very accommodative, helpful, nice and courteousAll these people last night, Lee Hazley should never be forgotten for the extra mile they did for meSame goes with Regina who is very nice person in the front deskPlease ensure all these people are recognized at this hotel to send to upper managementwould greatly appreciate, if you can ensure to send and follow-up pleaseThanks so much againsriAlways love staying at this location. Super nice, spacious rooms that smell lovely! Staff is friendly and accommodating. Definitely a must stay in Jacksonville.This is my first visit with the Marriott chain. We wanted to book a fair priced room that wasn't too far from the beach. The prices right on the beach were pretty ridiculous and considering the weather for this weekend, we didn't want to spend most of the time just watching the rain hit the sand. The reviews on tripadvisor.com were pretty good so we booked it. At $84 a night, it's worth the price. This location seems to be geared towards people on business trips or extended stays. Our studio came with a very nice kitchen equipped with a fridge, dishwasher, garbage disposal, microwave, and stove top. I was surprised to find pots and pans and dishes. There was a pantry in the kitchen and the other side of it was closet space that could be accessed through a door in the bathroom. My daughter had fun walking through the pantry and into the bathroom. The desk had a table underneath that could be pulled out ff you had guests or wanted a separate area to eat. We had a nice comfortable sofa bed for our daughter. We had a king size bed for ourselves. Very comfortable. Nice, clean, spacious bathroom. The hotel has a laundry room and fitness center that has three treadmills and some weights. The free breakfast was decent and filling. There was a waffle maker, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, and a few pastries. Fresh fruit would have been awesome. Pool area was nice and equipped with a BBQ grill.Overall, I enjoyed the experience. I'm not very picky and this hotel suited our needs for the weekend.Traditional town place suites but the customer service was phenomenal! Joshua made my stay. Breakfast leaves a bit to be desired but its quiet, clean, and super polite. Will definitely visit again.I wish I could right a good review for this new establishment, but as a road warrior.....I have an oath to fellow travelers to keep it real. The first week I stayed here was fine- I was upgraded from a one bedroom suite to a two bedroom suite. The rooms are VERY nice. Flat screens in every room, individual temperature control central air for every room, and a full kitchen (full size stainless steel fridge and freezer, microwave and flat top stove). The bathroom was my favorite becuase it has a permanent "dim sleep light" that stays on when you turn the regular light off. I love this becuase I hate having to squint in the morning when I wake up becuase the light is too bright. This light is very dim but you can see the whole bathroom. Week two I was downgraded from a one bedroom suite to a studio becuase they were sold out. I was having a friend over for dinner so this was an inconvienence. The girl at the front desk said she could give me $20 off, but I told her I don't pay the bill, my company does, and after a long day of traveling and living out of a suitecase 3 weeks out the month, something resembling an apartment aka space is what I appreciate. I asked for Marriott points and she said she would have to ask the manager int he morning. Big surprise, I got nothing. I even filled out a comment card about my experience and I did not hear anything back. I hope whoever got my one bedroom was at a higher marriott rewards level than I.Week three they were sold out again but I got my one bedroom suite. Unfortunatly it was on the first floor, right outside of the pool. And some guy decided he wanted to play his guitar by the pool all night.Since this is the nicest amenity hotel closest to where I need to be, I continually stay here but I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.Don't let the cheap remodel or the low room rate fool you. The service at this hotel is absolutely atrocious. By far the worst I've experienced at any Marriott location and I travel 300 days per year

I booked my hotel through Expedia at an average of $50/night (Wednesday night through Friday night). The staff was helpful and remembered me throughout the weekend. Each room has a decent sized mini-fridge (larger than most) and microwave, so I saved money by bringing some groceries rather than eating out. When I forgot utensils, the hotel gave me a set of their silverware to borrow, which was greatly appreciated!It's located very close to I-295 and I-95, and I was able to visit St. Augustine and Ponte Vedra without much hassle during my stay. There is also a shopping plaza with Whole Foods, restaurants, spas, etc. within walking distance. Two pet superstores are also nearby (and the hotel is pet-friendly). Three nice parks are west of San Jose Blvd, on the St. Johns River.Next time I'm in the area, this hotel is my first choice. I do recommend requesting a room on the first floor as there are no elevators.I've been here a few times not for a stay but for the Comedy Zone Club. The lobby is clean and we sat and had a few drinks at the Piano Room which is a bar attached to the lobby and a few feet away from the comedy club. The drinks are stronger at the bar than in the club. The bar maid was nice and the atmosphere nice & friendly.I've come to this location several times over the last few years for the comic conventions that are held here for Pop Retr-O-Rama and the other one who's name escapes me and every time the same thoughts pass through my head.1. The place could use a good upgrade as far as furnishings and decorating are concerned. It's not bad mind you, and it's not dirty but it's just feels a bit outdated.2. There is a pervasive smell that I notice every time when I come here. Especially in the causeway between the outdoor doors and the indoor doors at the front entrance like mold or mildew that kind of knocks you in your nose for a second, but thankfully the rest of the place isn't like that. 3. I can't say much for the staff as thankfully I never really have any issues that require their assistance. I will say that they always look friendly and are around, so no issues there. 4. This place has pretty good convention space though, and I'm always happy coming because at this point it's a known quantity and it's familiar. The verdict is that while this place is a bit on the old side, for my needs (conventions) they are A-OK.The room at Hartley Rd does not look what is on the pictures . This false advertisement ! We check in even we knew that there is no elevator . But we get to the room there is baby spider crawling in the bed and the air that comes from AC smells nasty ! I will not waste my hard earn money for this hotelHad a pretty bad experience there - our trip was for 4 days and we booked this hotel because it looked decent and had a reasonable price. Once we entered the hotel we knew we made a mistake! Everything from the food to service and ambience was very low grade and after about 10 minutes after stepping into our room we called and cancelled our reservation! We checked in at 2 am and we're told that we at least had to spend the night for them to cancel the rest of the reservation - so we had to. But I do give them credit for at least letting us cancel the rest of the reservation....Don't be fooled by their price either - at checkout, they added all sorts of stupid taxes including 'tourism tax' to Jack up the room rent...we found a way way better hote for about 10 bucks more the next day....my sincere advice would be to stay away from their nonsense....A very good budget hotel. Stayed there two nights and was satisfied with the place, location and service.This one is conveniently located right at the intersection of San Jose and 295. The place has a large spread out parking area and can't be missed while driving. Check-in was breeze, the Wi-Fi signal was good enough to stream live FIFA WWC games. The room was standard; queen bed, Samsung TV, Iron w/ board. I really liked their single dispenser coffee maker. The quality of coffee was not bad either. They do have both regular and decaf, and even tea.The bed was not the most comfortable as it felt a little old and somewhat sinking in the middle and there were some few stains on the carpet. Apart from that, it was alright. Doesn't have whole lot of choices in TV channels but you can get by it.The pool area seems to be alright as lot of people seem to enjoy it. This location has Comedy zone and apparently everyone from Jacksonville has been there once. They do have a nice cafe too which is also the place of complimentary breakfast.The breakfast is much better than any other budget hotel I've stayed. They have whole two large buffet table laid out with: scrambled egg, bacon, biscuits n gravy, grits, some bakery goods, OJ, cereals with milk, fruits and some more. The two ladies serving the area were friendly and energetic and even though it is complimentary breakfast expect to tip.There is a decent business area with connectivity if you need to use the internet and bar too although I didn't indulge in them.During my stay there wasn't any kind of troubling scene or loud noises, so it felt safe too. The area has some few restaurants like steak house, Italian and Whole food market all in walking distance.I have stayed in better hotel than this one but a nice gesture from the front-desk lady that have never happened to me will always make it memorable. While I was checking out and about to leave, the lady asked if I would like to have a bottle of water for the road. I was somewhat taken aback by this gesture but really thankful because even the nicest of staffs don't bother that much and the day was already getting hot.I enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend this place if you are on budget.In the midst of updating rooms which were not that bad to begin with. Great location. Breakfast is a full buffet in the main dining room, eggs...bacon...sausage gravy and much more. Look for special event deals packaging dinner, room and comedy. Here for four days and really enjoy the place. Low key bar, friendly staff. Ask for room not facing I295, just to make sure it's quite. Walking distance to Steak and Shark, Bib Evans and Whole Foods. Place is clean and staff is super friendly.Great price and great location! Paid 67 for a king room facing the pool.I really liked the quietness of the hotel.It would be a 4 but the young woman who was checking us in was much more interested in flirting with the young man who was in front of us. She didn't give us the wifi information and then proceeded to give me attitude when I asked for it.Id love to come to the comedy zone or the piano bar. Lots of parking and lots of restaurants near by!This is the Ramada Inn that houses the Comedy Zone. I've only stayed here once, for the "Suitehearts" package they offered for Valentine's Day. $199 for prime rib and crab leg buffet for two with champagne at the hotel's restaurant, Gigi's, admission to the comedy featuring Henry Cho, a room for the night with late checkout, and breakfast buffet for two at Gigi's. Great deal for what you get. They offer similar packages year-round. The receptionists are friendly, but they don't always give consistent information when calling about Comedy Zone info. Plus, when my boyfriend was trying to book the package, he was told on the phone that the only person who could take care of it had left for the day and he'd get a call back the next day. As that next day was coming to a close and no call had come, my boyfriend called again and was told the same thing. After try again he finally resorted to doing it online. The room was very clean, no complaints there. Just a standard chain hotel, nothing to write home about.Desk person very nice, room not so much. Def not a 3-Star hotel in comparison to other 3-Star properties I've stayed in. Toilet had dried urine on it & long hairs on toilet & sink countertop. Room also smells really musty. Not good. Priceline needs to reevaluate this as a 3-Star property. Disappointed...I've stayed at this hotel mutiple times on business trips and was treated with incredible kindness from the staff each time. The hotel has a private quietness to it that was really relaxing, but there is a bar/restaurant/comedy zone inside as well, so there is much to do while staying there. The first time I stayed here, my coworker and I were flying back from Bahrain and were incredibly jet-lagged.
