The man working behind the counter, Taye, was incredibly kind, helpful and understanding of our desire to check in early. He gave us water bottles and was one of the kindest hotel staff we have encountered.I was very disappointed..first room 202 smelled horrible,dead bugs and very dusty...we moved to room 159 which was not much better. Dusty, ripped drapes, filthy carpet.We got the package deal for comedy show and GiGi's...the comedy show and food was awesome. Customer service was great. This place needs a complete renovation! I will never stay here again..will attend shows.Hotel reviews trip me out. Or maybe they help set expectations lower. I dunno. But the reviews on this were off the mark. Beds were nice and clean. Room look updated and maybe even recently redone. For the price, I'm really happy with what we got.Wife and I stayed here last night.Got room on Priceline.Renovated room was just fine.I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.Whole Food,next door was nice for breakfast.Cockroaches crawling on the furniture.  Putrid smell in the shower. Carpets that I was afraid to walk barefoot on.  Some of the rooms were renovated...but I guess that wasn't mine.The only redeeming feature is the Whole Foods Market next door.

Spent the weekend at this hotel with the wife and kids during a visit to Jacksonville for a state piano competition.  The room was divided in 2 parts, and was more than generous for our needs.  The room was nicely decorated and clean, no bad odors! The little kitchen was very useful as we stayed in and ate dinner Friday night and watched movies.We were close to a nice little shopping area and 5 minutes away from University of North Florida where the competition was being held so it was a perfect location.  The manager was helpful and friendly at check in, staff was proficient. But the best part of the stay was actually what happened after our stay.  When I checked in, I made a big mistake.  I accidentally wrote in that we would stay for 4 days not 2.  When I found my card was charged double the amount I expected after we left the hotel I was upset.When I called to question the charge the staff was professional and responsive.  They looked into the matter and explained what happened.  It was my fault and they had me in a corner because of the contract I agreed to and signed.However, when I asked to speak to the manager, who I'm sure was very busy.  She spent a few minutes going over the details with me, remembered my kids from check in and gladly refunded the money to my card and made me a happy and loyal customer.Thank you Robin!So this place is not exactly a luxury establishment, but their staff are really delightful. I came here in an emergency and found the staff to be very warm and welcoming.I checked into my room and found it to smell like smoke. I called downstairs and Alexa immediately fixed the situation. As the elevator opened downstairs, she was there to give me my new room keys and apologiZe. Now THAT'S service!My room was extraordinarily clean and very quiet. Easy to walk to all shops and restaurantS at Town Center. I will definitely return to this hotel.This hotel is the standard Homewood Suites you will find almost anywhere on your travels, but the location in the Town Center is hard to beat.  You are walking distrance to more great restaurants/bars/shops than you will have time to visit.  I visit Jacksonville often for work, and this has become a favorite place to stay more for the location than the hotel itself.Words are not enough to express my gratitude to the front desk and kitchen staff for making my stay enjoyable. Having spent four months at this location recently for work I must say they are the friendliest and most caring employees I have come across in my many years of traveling for my job.   Their professionalism never wavered, even when some of the guests were difficult to deal with.  Each and everyone of them should be recognized for their hard work and dedication to customer service.  They treated us like family and took great care of us!I come to Jax regularly for work and always stay here. The location is great and they serve free beer and wine. It's a tad expensive, but free booze, dinner, breakfast and internet are all included and the area is great.This place is great! Professional courteous staff, clean, and you can walk around the St. Johns Town Center.Very cozy stay and perfect for a shopping trip to St. Johns Town Center.  You can walk right to all the shops and restaurants.  I was impressed with how large the room was and the bed was comfortable.  I was there on a cold evening (for Florida) and they had the heat cranked up, but not too much.  They also had put out extra blankets in my room in case I needed one which was nice.  It was so toasty in my room that I fell asleep early haha.  The free breakfast in the morning was decent but not too exciting.  It felt safe also because they said they locked the doors at 10pm.  I would stay here again if I was coming to this area and it was very reasonable for $80 (govt rate).  My only complaint would be that the internet signal was pretty weak.Great room and even better staff!This is my preferred place to stay when I'm in Jacsonville.Always like the Hilton's. Expect for Paris of course. Very clean rooms with kitchenettes. Love the breakfast and a very nice pool.I came all the way to Jacksonville for a business trip and stay at the Hilton. They rooms were very spacious, with a little kitchen, stove, fridge, tiny living room, and comfy beds. There was a full complementary breakfast with everything you could imagine. Staff was courteous and friendly and the hotel is centered all around amazing shops. Thank you!The hotel itself is built as an extended stay hotel as each of it's rooms have a mini kitchenette in them. The rooms all have a separate sitting area with a bedroom and bathroom.  I've stayed in a couple of their rooms and the corner rooms are a lot roomier than the others.  They do offer free meals (good meals) with the rooms during the week and if you have any dietary concerns the in house chefs is always willing to make changes for you.  The staff was extremely nice, always welcoming you in and asking you how your day has been.  I ended up staying there for over 3 months and by the time I was ready to leave, I was reluctant to go as the staff had become my second family.  This hotel is about 5min away from a new shopping center complete with great restaurants.  I highly recommend Maggiano's Italian Restaurant and if you're a fan of Spumoni ice cream, they have the best as its homemade.  Whenever I return to Jacksonville, I make it a point to stay here.  Can't recommend it enough.

Very Friendly StaffWe just checked out of Springhill Suites. We stayed for two nights and had a room on the second floor in room 214. We had three minor issues during our stay - the first night a child who was old enough to know better ran down the hall at 5am yelling (not the hotels fault, it's the parents fault) and the second problem was the plumbing in our bathroom sink was faulty and leaked. We're laid back, so we didn't complain - we just put a trashcan under the sink to collect any dripping water. Our AC sucked and wouldn't really cool down our room during the day.The hotel staff is very friendly - always saying hello and asking if there was anything that they could do for us. Chupa chup lollypops are available at the front desk along with fresh lime water.Breakfast is pretty standard but the meats change daily. Tuesday was bacon, Wednesday was potatoes and sausage.Fitness center has an elliptical, treadmill and stationary bike. There is a pool and a hot tub located out back.Very good location wise - very close to St. John's Town Center and lots of food options.Cable was awful, HBO Family instead of real HBO? Internet was slow, hotel responded that there were a lot of guests in the hotel. NOT an excuse. Worst was moving the bed stand to plug in my computer and there was a nasty white mold all over the plugs. EEK!Had to stay there 4 days for business, and I just cancelled my reservation for next week.  My room on the 5th floor was dirty with mildew smell.  I had plumbing issue, my toilet kept running water all night, notified the front desk the next morning maintenance came to fix but never was fixed.   Shower head leaked drops of water the entire week I was there.  Who has time to deal with that, these should have been corrected before I got there.One evening we reported to the front desk that the floor by the elevators were wet probably from people coming back from the pool.  She ignored and pretended to not hear us. Oh my!  She was not an employee that cares.I'm really surprised that this facility can call itself a Marriott. There are very few things that are nice about this hotel.  They do have the impeccable service that Marriott is widely known for. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Now for my negative rant....The sink faucet was broken. To turn it on and leave it on you had to jam a wash cloth underneath the handle. Otherwise the handle would fall down and the water turned off. The shower faucet was impossible to turn on and once it was on, again impossible to turn off. For a quick stay, it's not horrible, but let's be honest - spend the money and stay somewhere better!If you ever come from the airport, they will act very annoyed and put-upon. Flown through here twice, and am now avoiding Jacksonville as an airport/place to stay. These folks are really terrible.Had a slight glitch on our night of arrival, which was handled very professionally by Sarah at the front desk. She was great throughout, and gave us a great lunch recommendation at the Metro Diner, which we thoroughly enjoyed. So a big thank you to Sarah! The room was clean, and spacious, the usual Spring hill suite quality. Breakfast was good, lots of options, was happily surprised to have the option of blueberry waffles, and Nutella for our toast. Both were a big hit with our 11, 15 and 18 year old kids. I would add however, that our bed wasn't very comfortable, and could have used a mattress replacement (room 314). It was very "springy". Otherwise great stay, clean, great service (house keeping was also very friendly) and good breakfast. Would definitely return!Although my room was clean (except for some peeling paint in the bathroom), I was right above the hot tub and a party went on until 4 a.m.!!  Very loud!!  When I called the front desk, the gentlemen said he would take care of it.  In hindsight, I'm guessing he was part of the party.  I like Springhill Suites, but definitely avoid this one.The customer service at this hotel is outstanding.  The rooms are very clean, and the breakfast they provide is great.Stay here one night for business on January 19th. The workers Were extremely friendly and went out of there way to be friendly and nice . Their professionalism and charm was remarkable! The rooms were extraordinary and nicely sized. The lobby has a beautiful Contemporary "Art Deco-ish" feel. Beautifully landscaped. A ton of good restaurants easily with in walking distance. I will definitely stay here again!!!The good:The front desk staff people we saw were friendly and efficient.   The rest....eh. The rooms are a good size and the almost-kitchenette is handy. I didn't have a ton of cleanliness issues as others have reported but I will address maintenance and upkeep below. Not so good: 1.  I went to lobby around 10:20, hoping I wasn't too late to grab some juice and yogurt.  I figured I was too late but I was relieved to see all the table full and people eating and drinking like it was a celebration.   Great!    Tried to get some juice from the dispenser but nothing happened.   Asked an employee if it was empty.  Her response, "no, it's turned off." I asked if she could turn it on.  "No.  Breakfast ends at 10." Then she refilled her own coffee and sat down and continued her conversation with her brunch-eating co-workers.   There was still hot scrambled eggs and sausage in the pans but it was made clear to me that I missed my time slot.  If the employees are invited to enjoy breakfast on their breaks, that's great, good for them.  But if the paying guests are turned away at least have enough professionalism to do so out of full view of the customers.   So rude! 2.  One of the two rooms we had last night had a backed up toilet.   We called and reported it twice.   We were told someone would probably come up.  No one ever did.   After an hour, my husband went downstairs, requested a plunger and fixed it himself.   He put the plunger in a plastic bag and left it outside the door.   It is probably still sitting there because it was when we checked out this morning.   Clearly, no one cared to follow through with this.  Room 4143.   Flip lock on inside of one door did not work.   Tried to let front desk know as we checked out this morning at 5.   No one was around.   We just took our receipt from the pile left out on the counter and left.  4144.   Tubs have been resurfaced (poorly) and it feels icky under your feet.   You feel like you are standing on something dirty.   It doesn't look dirty, it just feels that way due to re surfacing product.  Rooms 402, 4145. Daughters wanted to sleep in Saturday and they asked housekeeping to come back after 12.  They never returned.  Room 4146.  Trash in ice bucket upon arrival.  Room 4147.  Lamp with no light bulb.  Room 4148.   My bath towel Saturday was fine.  My bath towel Sunday (new towel) smelled musty.  402. 9.   A.C. Unit in 402 causes the wall to vibrate loudly.My first review for 2015. Yay! I am on a business trip in Jacksonville for a week and was looking for something that had free breakfast so I didn't have to grab something before work. None of the hotels in the area were within my company's policy and I can definitely see why now. The hotel options in Jacksonville leave a lot to be desired. However, I stayed at the Springhill Suites by the Marriott because it was only a few minutes from my office. Also, I am a Marriott Rewards member and held the Marriott brand to a slightly higher standard.The pros are 1) the staff is extremely nice. The front desk clerks were not talkative but did their job efficiently. The ladies who took care of the breakfast were sweet, down to earth and so hospitable and friendly. I did not encounter any bell boys, housekeeping or maintenance folks. 2) The free breakfast is actually pretty good but I only got to try Monday's breakfast (please see con #1). They had the best biscuits and gravy I've ever tasted. Granted, I haven't had too many in my lifetime but their biscuits were soft, flakey and melted in your mouth. The gravy was so flavorful and had a good meat to gravy ratio. I now have this sort of expectation for all the biscuits and gravy that I plan to eat in the future. Other options available were your typical scrambled eggs, toast, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, bagels, blueberry muffins, juices, milk, coffee and teas. 3) They have in-room mini fridge, sink, microwave and an ice machine on every floor 4) they have a pull out couch, albeit, the couch was not in very good condition. 5) you can see the TV from either the bed or the couch because it swivels. 6) It is very quiet or maybe I had no one stay in any of the rooms near me. In any event, while I was there, I did not hear any door slams, children running around, no loud TVs next door, etc. All I heard was "nothing" and it was strange. 7) It is within walking distance to restaurants and had nearby shopping.The cons are 1) I wanted to walk right back out as soon as I walked in. The smell that hit me when I walked in was foul but I thought maybe that was just the lobby. So I checked into the hotel and proceeded to the elevator. The elevator had a different smell and was a little dirty. When I got to my floor, the hallway smelled differently as well. When I opened my hotel room it was yet another different smell. None of these smells were pleasant at all. I wanted to check out but it was a Sunday evening and my travel agency was closed. So I stayed the night. I coughed the whole night, got little sleep and am allergic to mildew. So I checked out the next day and went to the Sheraton. It would not have been good for my health had I stayed the whole week as originally planned. 2) the Paul Mitchell toiletries provided were small and I did not like the conditioner. My hair was dry and frizzy. I like to travel light so I always use what is provided by the hotel. 3) the location was not easily accessible.  The hotel is located on Southside Blvd but if you don't pay attention, you could miss the entrance. It is behind a strip of restaurants. So my number one con heavily outweighed all the pros and I will not be back unless they address the mildew and smell issues.Was in town visiting family during holiday weekend. That likely explains the reason for so many kids. Room was very clean and shower was impeccably clean. Continental breakfast was regularly stocked. Sink and mirror was outside of bathroom, first time staying in a hotel like that where you lose privacy (traveling with spouse and in-law).Not the nicest option that exists but for convenience sake and since the staff was friendly, I have to give it two stars.  Thankfully, I only needed the room to sleep in, shower and get on the road for a meeting.   So for what was paid and for the 8 hours total that was spent there, I cannot complain much more. Breakfast in the morning was complimentary and not too bad.  Basic continental buffet type thing.  Now that I know that area a little better, if I have to go back, I may look at a different place.  Just seems outdated and not in the best of shape. Staff was wonderful though.Free continental breakfast...friendly staff but room spelled funny :/Decided to stay with friends in town.Rooms and common areas are OK--typical older style Marriott SHS fashion.  What makes me knock off a star is the super slow internet access here.  I have stayed here several times over the years, and the last few times here the internet has gotten slower and slower.  I wont be back just due to that fact.  gotta be able to work!!Stayed there last week for a night and everything was great. Stayed there again last night with my husband and 5 children in 2 rooms and there was some sort of "event" at the hotel next door. Well we were awakened at about 1130pm to the sounds of gun shots in total at least 10 or 12 I has my children on the floor under the desk when I went down to the front desk they did not seem overly concerned and that they thought the group causing the disturbance was just firing in the air I don't think people need to be reminded of the laws of gravity needless to say did not sleep a wink and had to travel home about  9 hours away upon check out they did comp one of our rooms but didnt like feeling unsafeAs hometown heroes Lynyrd Skynyrd would say..."oo-oo that smell, cancha smell that smell." That was the smell eight years ago when I first stayed here while interviewing for a job in JAX.  And while I must be travelin' on now, I know that things haven't changed.  In fact, the decor is identical to what I experienced eight years ago.  To boot, this Freebird can't get out the door fast enough...because the elevator from the fifth floor penthouse level still takes an hour to reach the ground floor.  Oh, and there's a TGI Friday's across the street!!!Nothing fancy, but a great hotel for a very reasonable rate. Spacious king bed suites. Large flat screen TVs. Sink area outside the toilet/shower area, but still separated from the bedroom. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Very clean, nice smelling rooms. My family stayed here for a graduation, we had 5 rooms in all and everyone agreed with these positive remarks. Again, it's nothing fancy, but it's a clean, spacious, comfortable place to stay at an affordable rate.We are a seasoned visitor to the Jacksonville Marriott Springhill Suites/Deerwood having stayed at the hotel at least six times in the last two years when visiting family.  Our most recent stay was a five night visit December 2011.  The place has seriously gone downhill.  The major things we noticed during this past stay were:  (1) The rooms, hallways, stairwells and fitness center are NOT CLEAN.  This was markedly noticeable especially in any public use areas.  The fitness center equipment was filthy and when I went into the nearby restroom to get a paper towel with which to wipe down the equipment, the bathroom itself was terribly dirty.  (2)  Things just didn't work well - one day, we had no towels after the room was cleaned; another day clean sheets (we think) were left in our room after the housekeeping visit.  Since the bed had been made, did they not change the sheets or did they forget them there.  On three occassions during our six day stay, we had to call to ask for soap or tissues or other basic items that should have been restocked.  One day, the room was askew after housekeeping had been there - the TV was turned, the furniture moved, someone's bluetooth device was left in the room, and our personal items had been rearranged.  Let's just say, we don't believe it was due to thorough cleaning.  (3) Breakfast has gone sunstantially downhill.  It's not cool to serve brown bananas and week old bagels/pastries.  The oatmeal and grits are both in little packages now not "homemade" as before.  (4) The printer in the business center would not work and the PCs there were especially slow.All in all we could not wait to leave.  Everything was just "off".  Please note this is a very OLD Springhill Suites design and the rooms are just weird in their design.  But that never bothered us before because this facility HAD BEEN a comfortable convenient place to retreat to after a long day with relatives.  We'll look for somewhere different to stay next time.  Too bad.

hotel_name: Hilton Garden Inn Jacksonville JTB/Deerwood Park
review_content: From check-in through check-out every staff member we encountered was polite, professional, and helpful. It felt like they actually cared about their guests and their guest's needs. The room was clean, comfortable, and well stocked with all the usual necessities. There was even a Keurig in the room; so no more of those awkward, spill-prone hotel coffee makers. The bed was very comfortable as they have apparently recently replaced them all.The breakfast buffet (small upcharge) offered made to order eggs, omelets, and pancakes. There were lots of breakfast meats available, too; but as a vegan, I was concentrating on the hot oatmeal and abundance of fresh fruit. The breakfast area is large enough that one did not feel crowded by other guest and finished plates were quickly whisked away from the table by warm, friendly staff.We also paid a very small upcharge for the Romance Package. The staff's execution of this service is what took this review from four stars to five. When we opened our door, there stood a bottle of wine on ice, a beautifully made up fruit plate and a bag with many little extras. Again, it felt like they actually cared (which is becoming a rare occurrence these days).I highly recommend this hotel for families, business travelers, or couples just looking to get away for the weekend.This hotel features the freshest, most pungent mold you'll ever experience anywhere. And of course the beds are just a little less comfortable than a cement floor.  Stay away from this garbage place.I travel for work every week and am a Hilton Honors member. In all honesty this was my most disappointing stay. The lobby looks great, but it is all downhill from there. The rooms are outdated and the carpet had a funny smell. The worst part about the stay was that the iron had rust in the steam holes and I didn't find out until it had stained my lab coat. Very disappointing. I will be looking elsewhere for my next visit to Jacksonville.The most uncomfortable bed I've ever tried to sleep on in two years of traveling every week.  Sleepless for two nights in a row now.The front desk clerk on duty was very nice, hence the 2nd star.I had a great experience. I travel weekly and I'm an honors member. I had a problem with my toilet running I called down and in 5 minutes someone fixed my toilet. Then right after the maintenance man left I had a phone call to my room checking that it was fixed and then someone showed up to my room with a goody bag thanking me for my patience, for reporting the problem and apologized for my inconvenience.  It was clean and staff was friendly! They had a manager from Indiana there retraining so if you had a bad experience before give them another try!Ok, so Tuesday the shower head sprung a leak that shoots across the bathroom and the handle on the toaster came off in my hand. Was going to mention at check out. Then tonight the handle to the hot water in the sink came off and I can't turn it off. The desk said no maintenance on duty so keep the door shut overnight. Ugh!We were hesitant to stay at the Hilton Gardens after reading the not so great reviews.  we were pleasantly surprised. The room was immaculate and the size was perfect.  What really made our trip was the excellent front desk service.  Nicholas and Jeffrey were amazing, super friendly, courteous, and helpful.This conveniently located hotel is extremely well run. Staff and manager are friendly and attentive like none I've seen in a while. The breakfast includes lots of fresh high quality fruit, sometimes whole grain bakery fresh breads. The hot food options are great and they offer to make fresh omelets to your specifications. We needed our room moved because it was next to the elevator shaft and the staff couldn't have been more supportive. The hotel is located near lots of shopping. & restaurants.  The St Johns Center shopping area is just 2 blocks away along Gate Pkwy.I used to try to stay closer to the beaches but I've never had a great experience. I will stay here anytime I'm in Jacksonville. It's now my hotel of choice.Old furniture, stiff beds, and boring decor.  Good location but there are several other hotels in the immediate vicinity which are better.The lady at the check-in was friendly and our room was okay.  Everything was clean, they had a Keurig coffee maker in the room with good coffee...but no non-dairy creamer and only 2 half and half cups.  They need more for two people.  The bed was too firm for my taste but that's just me.  They did have a large flat screen tv and complimentary wifi.  The bathroom was pretty basic and they had Neutrogena toiletries in there that were available for use.  The breakfast the next morning was okay, your typical hotel breakfast.  We would stay here again if the cost was less than 100 bucks per night.I expect a consistent level of experience with HGI, it is well known as a top tier business traveler's hotel.  This hotel did not measure up.While attempting to book my reservation, the Hilton website popped up a special offer for a "Presidential Suite" for a very reasonable price (yelp guidelines I think say no numbers here) so I said "sounds OK" and booked it.  Three days before my stay, the hotel sends me an email saying that the reservation is marked as a smoking room and that they don't have any smoking "Presidential Suites" left (who allows smoking in a hotel anyway - isn't that how fires start?)  I don't see the email until the next morning (why they couldn't have called me - I don't know) and respond, but by then, THEY HAD CHANGED MY RESERVATION WITHOUT MY AUTHORIZATION and put me into a "deluxe" room (read that - all other rooms are "deluxe").When I got to the hotel, the checkin and checkout experience was fine, but the room was not what I booked, there was NO HOT WATER either day.  The front desk said they had it checked out and the system was fine, and maybe too many people were showering that morning.  Hey remind me to sign up for my time slot next time.  The showerhead in my shower pointed to the floor and would not stay in place, the thermostat said 76 degrees but it was more like 65, and the common hallway carpets were dirty and needed to be stretched so they were not a trip hazard.Absolutely not what I have experienced at other HGI properties.On the bright side, the breakfast is somewhat adequate, as long as you don't have to pay for it, and the breakfast area waiter will lift your spirits with his enthusiasm and attitude.Hilton Garden Inn is the new Holiday Inn.  Hotel room is average.    Bathroom outdated. I wanted to try HGI for the Hilton brand, expecting more. It's fine as a business traveler choice.   Just manage your expectations. At check in... The attendant offered folks as they checked in if they wanted to arrange the wake up call for the next day.   Everyone including myself took the offer for the morning wake up call.   I'm not usually a good sleeper while away from home and anxious for my early day at the office.... So I slept on and off.   I stared at the clock as the time past for my wake up call.    5 mins later still no call... I dialed the front desk letting them know of the Missed Wake Up Call....not cool!Also, I need to add to my Hilton profile not to give me an adjoining room.  I'm just not comfortable having that door there when traveling alone.  Morning breakfast is busy with businesss travelers.  Most tables are taken at 7:30.  I can see how it may be difficult to find seat at times.  Made to order egg items are available, if you can to flag the server to place your order.   If you don't have time, which most of us business travelers don't, there's a buffet ready with scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits, gravy... etc.All in all.... HGI was an ok place to stay.  There are nearby restaurants and  business offices nearby.They like to make the lobby look great but that's about all that looks good here. For what they charge here you should get a nice room with a comfortable bed...  NOT!! Room was mediocre at best. The bed was like sleeping on a concrete slab. Bathroom water pressure was almost non existent.  The shower head had so much calcium on it you couldn't have moved it with a crowbar. I found dirty napkins in the nightstand drawer and trash under the edge of the bed.  The outside of the place is in disrepair and the Maintenance Supervisor should be fired for letting his place looks like this. Overall this place sucked. It's too bad because my wife and I stay in this area monthly for work. Guess we will have to move on to another hotel for next month!Pretty standard issue for this low cost hotel chain. Rooms are simple but well presented. Has all the basics a business person needs: wifi, quiet room, tv, etc. I don't recall that the TV was flat screen. I think the only thing that was missing was a full length mirror, but I find that's usually a coin toss in hotel rooms. There is an outdoor pool, a well stocked front desk pantry with snacks, and plenty of parking. The fitness center was stuffy, a little too warm for my usual morning jog. It is conveniently located by a mall and many of Jacksonville's business campuses. Front desk and housekeeping staff were spot on during my stay, always greeting me with a smile.i dont know what people expect.  i thought it was perfectly suitable, clean, hospitable people, very comfy bed. my baggage was not sent with me on my flight, United then held it hostage in chicago b/c they thought it was a good idea at the time (I was not departing from chicago either, stupid united.)the staff at the HGI was friendly, hospitable, etc. etc. thanks a bunch!get bravo and lose HBO family, and why the heck did my tv volume not go below 11?!Very mediocre. Lobby is nice, usually offers free water and cookies. Room was fine, nice LG tv's. Bathroom was not nice, very outdated and tiny sink area. Biggest complaint of room was bathroom. Great location, near massive shopping area (St. Johns Town Center) filled with restaurants, shops, bars, movie theater, etc. Walking distance to movie theater, few restaurants, and Starbucks.Dirty, unsanitary, they don't listen, they don't care...My room has not been vacuumed so I complained.  They didn't clean my bathroom counter and tub and had hair on them for two days.  They barely make the bed and leave the dirty fork, used napkin, trash on the floor...again I complained.  I came home to a bed that oviously its sheets hasn't been changed (I've been here 5 days now) and now that I examined it, it had hair and dried blood spot.  I surely hope this is my blood and hair...When I spoke to the manager, he just looked at me like I'm crazy for cmplaining...apologyzed half heartedly and obviously he doesn't care...nothing has changed.  I wish I was staying somewhere else...Breakfast buffet:  Bread inside the bread keeper had a dead ant on it AND some fruit flies flying inside.The maid took time to play with my glasses and moved it from the desk to the bed where she made an "origami" animal with towels and put my glasses on it.DON'T EVER STAY HERE.

Beautiful property. Everything and everyone was so pleasant, from greeting to checkout. Breakfast was surprisingly good. I am a big fan of Holiday Inn Express, but this stay may have me thinking about jumping ship.The only con: the free internet is sloooooow.Now this place is fantastic!From the friendly and helpful staff to the spectacular rooms, I have no complaints.The breakfast was above average in comparison to other hotels that include it. Will most definitely be back.Very disappointed.  First off the location is great, I have stayed here over the years and was happy to pay a little extra to stay in a familiar place.   But I also paid extra for the upgraded internet service which not only didn't work, but the front desk apparently was not aware existed.  The real kicker was this evening when I found the Hotel double billed me for five nights so there is more than $850 extra sitting on my credit card (not a pending charge, but a full second charge). Then some stuff that I picked up the snack area that was included in the hotel bill, then double billed on the second bill was then billed yet again as a separate charge as well.   Seems a couple bottles of water now cost $18 and my room for five nights is sitting on my credit card at $1900!  And...I never did get internet service.I give this Hilton Property one (1) Star due to the absence of the front desk staff. As a Hilton Diamond Member I average over 140 nights a year and the 3 times I've stayed here my wait at the gent desk for service is roughly 15 minutes.   Last year I waited at the front desk for almost 25 minutes for the front desk person to return to the property. This review was generated because I'm tired of hearing; "I'm sorry about the wait"Hard to beat the location.  It was convenient to the Town Center, and a 15 minute commute to downtown Jacksonville.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The outdoor firepit was nice on the chilly night.  The fitness room location doesn't make much sense.  It is a stand alone building beside the pool, so you have to walk outside the hotel to get to it.I needed to stay one night at this place.  I actually used my Hilton points and didn't think I was going to get a good room because I've done this before and usually give me the crappiest room.  Not here! This place was super clean, the staff was nice, breakfast in the morning and the bed was sooo comfortable.  Thank you!!!Great property! Welcoming lobby open feelings. front desk staff friendly and offered great information for local restaurants & very pet friendly! Soft goods very fresh & love room. Also great value.It was clean, nice, and close to everything.  What else is there to say?  They all look the same when you're sleeping.There's nothing better than settling into a clean, spacious and quiet room after a long drive from another state. My husband and I stay exclusively at hampton inns for the reward points. This particular location is one of the nicest hampton inns we've stayed in? I have zero complaints about this location and will definitely be staying here again when we drive through Jacksonville!I stay at this Hampton Inn regularly because it is convenient for business, has an excellent free breakfast and is close to restaurants.  It's always consistent and ALWAYS clean.  The cleanliness and neatness of this hotel is always a WOW for me.New and nice.  Outside firepit is a first for me at Hampton propertiesFirst impression was great.   Special recognition with a special diamond member parking spot.  Very friendly person  at front desk.  Room was upgraded to one that wasn't much of an upgrade but it was clean.  All went down hill from there.  Bed was too soft, bright  light was shining in window all night.  And the chaotic unorganized scene at breakfast was unreal.   The food was limited and what was there looked like it had been sitting for hours.   There was a guy that was handing out plastic forks and spoons with his bare hands from a box. Coffee was bad, oatmeal was cold and hard, fruit was mushy and bread was stale.   Basically it was a cluster and no one seemed to care.Clean rooms, good breakfast, free parking, lots of restaurants, good area, and free wifi. We stayed 2 nights and it was great. We hung out at Trio (right behind the hotel) and caught a movie at Tinseltown which is in walking distance.Very nice suites and great waffles!We are regular Hampton Inn guests and found this to be one of the best ones.  Very pleased with accommodations and staff.I haven't stayed in a Hampton Inn in many years but was very pleased that it wasn't the old Hampton Inn. This was the hotel recommended by the conference I attended.  I was reluctant at first but figured that if it was good enough for 30 CIOs it was worth a try.  My review - I'd stay there again if I was in the area.This place is new and clean.  The front desk was so friendly when I checked in they make you forget the 4 plus hour plane ride to get here. The room was clean large and had everything you'd want. Ok it isn't the Hilton or the Four seasons but for a 'budget' class hotel it didn't feel like a budget hotel.  The comforter was the jumbo style in the better class hotel.  The bathroom was large with granite counter.  The tub/shower was clean and large.  The only small knock was the toilet was tucked in to the wall which had an odd sense but only esthetically. There are tons of restaurants near by and it was close to the conference at Florida Community College, which is another story.

I'm surprised this place has less than okay reviews.  I have stayed in many hotels in this area and I can honestly say this is so far the best one I've stayed in.  Pros:Rooms are clean and pleasing to the eye.Pool is nice.I love that they have a bar and a coffee shop in the lobby.The staff was helpful. Cons:There was one issue in my room where I went to get a cup for water.  The cups were wrapped but when I opened the wrapping, the cup was dirty on the inside.  Wish there was a better way to get inside from the back parking lot.great hotel chain that provides quality, consistent service. This hotel doesn't deviate from the norm. They've replaced the furniture and carpet and we really enjoyed our stay. Will be back again!Had a nice overnight say here.  Booked the room on the app and was able to check in on the app ( very cool by the way).  Once I got to the hotel all I had to do was pick up my keys and that was it.  The room was ready and very nice.  The room was very large with a desk and recliner.  Since I was trying to be romantic, I booked a room with a whirlpool.  It was a nice size and could fit two comfortably.  The room as had a shower separate that could fit two as well.  As always a very comfortable bed with four very fluffy pillows!  So if you are trying to be romantic and live in the Jacksonville area check out the Courtyard By Marriot on Wells road.Very clean, very nice staff, nice inside and out. Probably one of the nicest (if not the nicest) Courtyard's I've stayed. Additionally, they have a nice bar and grille which helps when you've flown all day and don't want to leave.Nice hotel, not too far from downtown. A bit of a ride to the beach but not bad. Will definitely stay again when I visit JacksonvilleThis Courtyard is okay.  My room was clean, and everything worked.  It's been renovated, so the furnishings are stylish.  However, there were a few misses:First off, I reserved a roll-away bed (checked a box during my on-line reservation).  Then, I called at 1:00 pm the day of arrival and asked for a roll-away bed.  When we arrived that evening, there was no roll-away bed, and the front desk knew nothing of my requests.  Why do they have a check-box on the reservation?  (The staff quickly found us a roll-away, which was good, but I don't like to rely on luck at 9:30 pm.)This Courtyard does not have a "Bistro" in the lobby (which I really like).  Nor did it have the old-school, sit-down breakfast that all Courtyards used to have.  Instead, it had this $10/head buffet.  It was essentially the same food I'd get at a Hampton or Fairfield for free, with the addition of an omelet cook.  To make matters worse, they were OUT of most of the food!  Out of bacon, out of sausage, out of eggs.  They made more, but the whole place was waiting for it, so 15 minutes later, as soon as it came out, it was instantly gone again.For a hotel that says that they are environmentally-minded and trying to do their part - by not washing towels every day - it would be great if they added some vegan options to the menus. Products without meat or dairy take significantly less resources to produce and are becoming increasingly popular as people learn of the devastating consequences animal ag has on our planet. Eating plant-based foods has a much larger impact than taking shorter showers or not washing towels daily. My friends and I would have appreciated some items other than oatmeal on the menu to enjoy. Other than that, the room was clean and I appreciated that we were offered the option of a down-free room. I also loved having a fridge and microwave in the room, since we ended up having to go buy all of our own food.This hotel was pretty good, stayed one night for business.  Room was clean, had a balcony. There are some train tracks nearby. If your not a light sleeper its fine. There were some stains on the wallpaper which was creepy but it should be replaced. Overall great stay. I will be back. There is a bar and food for your convenience.Very comfortable clean rooms. Would give at least a 4 for room including the good location but the staff just seemed a little slow. room key would not work for me two times and had to go down to reception to fix.  Bar was too lit up and they charged fancy hotel prices for drinks instead of what the rate should have been.  This is a nice place that with a little work really should be a 4.  Will go back there next time as well and if better will upgrade this rate.I stayed here for one night while in town for a wedding. Overall, this is a good (not great) Courtyard.The staff is very friendly, however I stood at the front desk for close to 10 minutes before anybody from the back noticed I was there. The breakfast was good, but it's not free; I'd rather go to the Cracker Barrel down the street than eat there again. The free coffee in the lobby is a nice perk though.Our room had a strange layout, but it worked. The TVs have a huge number of channels -- basically full digital cable, as our TV had a Comcast cable box. There was an armoire (not a closet) in our room, and the doors were very creaky and didn't shut securely. Still, the room was clean and let in lots of light.Overall, this is not the best Courtyard I've stayed in, but the price was decent and the place was clean.Very nice Courtyard by Marriott that is new, clean and fantastic for a visit to this area. The have a nice breakfast area, laundry, workout room, very clean pool and hot tub, and plenty of parking.The rooms are very nicely decorated and absolutely no problems here.We were with a USTA tennis tournament and the group booked here. The staff even let us check out really late and we were grateful for that.Would have appreciated a call from this place to let me know I had not completed my reservation online even though I got a confirmation email!From an Event Coordinator's Perspective: My company was holding an event here, which was an event we have around 15-20 times a month across the nation. I can say this is the worst experience I've ever had at a hotel. PROS: The sleeping rooms are comfortable. CONS: * Staff is incredibly unprofessional. Our contract, which was signed by me, stated we had the room from 8am till 5:30 on both days. They had a different version of the contract or incorrect BEOs that weren't signed by me, and it stated we had the room until 5pm. The room wasn't ready until 9am and a woman, who is apparently a "manager" named Kim, walked into our room twice to kick us out. In front of all of our attendees, was asking if we were almost done. So unprofessional! Upon talking to Kim to discuss this (I was at our home office), she displayed a very tacky and incredibly horrible attitude and literally said, mid-sentence "I'm gonna have to cut you off right now..." and at the end of the call "You need to communicate better. Now I need to serve these other people so I'm going to go now" and literally hung up immediately after saying that. Worst customer service ever. * The contract took over a month to obtain (that should have been a major red flag)* All of our A/V needs, which were outlined on the contract were not setup/orderedIt gets even better. At a hotel next door, the staff there knew how terrible the service was at this hotel. They have a reputation in the area, people. Do not come here, it's not worth it. If anything goes wrong, I'd rather be at a place where the staff will be helpful, understanding, courteous, and professional. I would hate for anyone to come here and have something go wrong and have to deal with these people.My brother got married (yay for him!) and this is the hotel the couple had set aside for their wedding guests.  Coming all the way from Ohio we were looking forward to a very nice place to crash for four days.  And for the most part we were quite satisfied.I've learned when staying at hotels that how the exterior looks is a pretty good indicator as to what the rest of the experience is going to be like.  When we arrived I noticed that the parking lot was quite clean and the landscaping well done.  No rundown look here so that was a plus.  Check in was very simple, very quick and the staff was most accommodating and patient.  I use the word "patient" because there were two other wedding parties at this hotel along with my brother's and when we walked through the door the lobby was packed with guests in various stages of check-in.  Even with that, it took us less than ten minutes to check in, and most of that time was because I ran into my parents at the front desk and we talked a lot while the staff was trying to check us in.We had a King Suite and the room was beautiful.  Very clean, very comfortable.  Even though it was a chain hotel it still had a nice homey feeling to it.  Plenty of space for me, the wife, the kiddies, and the various family and friends that dropped in to visit.  The lobby was nice and spacious, with two computer terminals for those needing free access to the internet. The only real downside was that the pool area didn't really have a lot of space to lounge.  Plus the water was uber-cold.  In fairness though that made the whirlpool there that much more enjoyable.  The other downside would be the breakfast that's offered in the morning.  It's not complimentary and the price you're paying for what you're getting is so not worth the cost.  Also, there was just one cook working the omelet station which meant a very long wait for our eggs.  I would have thought that the staff would have brought in another cook knowing how busy they were going to be.All-in-all a pretty nice hotel.  What they do right more than makes up for what they do wrong.  Although I don't see myself back in the Jacksonville area any time soon, this would be the place I would stay if I were ever to return.Mahalo, and enjoy.Good, clean, convenient, full buffet breakfast for around $10 (with tip) per person. Bar open at night until around 9ish. Free Wi-Fi and free guest parking. Staff was friendly and helpful. Several good restaurants withing 5 - 10 minutes drive from property.Only issue I had was with the TV. I had to unplug and plug back in to get it to work each time I turned it on, but the hotel now knows about it and this wasn't a big deal once I figured out how to work around it.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton Jacksonville Baymeadows
review_content: This was a clean hotel and the rooms were modern. The bed has a down comforter and nice pillows but it is hard. The rooms was very quiet which is such a nice thing.There is a thermostat and that is always a nice feature and the rooms are very clean. There was a refrigerator but no microwave. A small coffeemaker and paper cups the coffee goes right into. Breakfast of any kind is NOT included. The continental type breakfast that almost all hotels offer was $5.00 and a more generous hot meal was $8.00. You can get fresh made coffee downstairs included in the price although I am not sure if you had to get it to go.Stayed a single night on a holiday weekend here passing through town. Newly built or redesigned not sure, we found a good room for under a $100. Location is handy for breakfast with an iHop and Dunkin Donuts nearby. Plenty of parking is available on site and it's close to I95. The front desk folks were pleasant and had us checked in quickly. Our third floor room was clean and temperature wise pleasantly cool. My bed though had a sneaky old metal spring mattress but was still comfy to sleep in. One of the two complimentary water bottles provided had been opened!? Biggest gripe was the sliding bathroom door than even when closed had a significant gap affording the occupant little privacy.Great hotel for the price. I rezzie'd through Hotels.com, and with that I paid less than three digits per night. LESS THAN THREE DIDGES!!! **Church** (That was me speaking like the druggie dudes on Breaking Bad. I'm a poser. I'm from the suburbs of Orange County, CA. I need to sit down before I hurt myself.)Seriously, great price, great value. The place was clean, the room was quiet. The staff was friendly. The wake up calls did their J.O.B.Couple points to make your stay even better:1.) Park around back. The staff will tell you "You can park up front or around back, by the pool. Choose around back. It's usually empty because all the other knuckleheads park up front, so you'll be golden.2.) Breakfast is not bad...pretty standard "made by a worker, not a chef" type of food. There's a Duncan Donuts in the parking lot, if you want a little bit better coffee.3.) Third floor does NOT have an ice machine/soda machine area. How do I know this? 1:00 AM, I'm rummaging around the floor like I'm a ghost trying to haunt the place, looking for some ice. Nope. You want ice? 2nd or 4th floor, baby. They got the goods.4.) WIFI It's not really written anywhere how to get to the hotel wifi. Why? Because apparently any bonehead (except this bonehead) can figure it out easily enough. Turn on your frickin' laptop and look for the floor you're on under the WIFI list. Click on it and VOILA. (No...I spend 15 mins trying to figure it out, then call down to the front desk like my grandma would do.)Anyway....this hotel is great. Enjoy.You can hardly go wrong with staying at this place... It is somewhat reasonable affordable, clean, great lounge area with a bar, breakfast is pretty good & the staff is wonderful.The room was very impressive & clean. What i like the best is the members have their own floor and a late check out (4pm) which is an excellent perk!!! I will return again at this location!!!I haven't stayed at a Sheraton in about a year.. And in Jacksonville, I had to stay at one for one last night to close out my vacation comfortably. When we arrived and walked in, the aroma was relaxing and I couldn't describe it. It was nice just standing there and checking in. We took our elevator to the second floor and when we stepped out... All we could smell even stronger was cleaning fluids.. 180 degree turn and it didn't make sense. It was about 4pm so I expected them to fix up the rooms and smell by then. Even later in the night, the smell was still there so I just assumed someone puked in the hallway the night before and that's how they were converging up the smell. When we went into the room, it was nice and of course the first thing I do is take a dump. I banged my knee pretty hard on the toilet paper holding thing cuz it was so close (and because I have long legs) and it pissed me off. But the bathroom was also nice and the sliding door was cool. I was concerned the smell might leave the bathroom since it didn't close fully, however, it didn't which was cool (thank god)!I laid down on the sofa in the corner, used their semi slow internet to get caught up on a weeks worth of emails and spent a few minutes on Hulu before a headache kicked in telling me I need to sleep and it was only 5pm. I laid down on the bed and I sunk right in comfortably. I still get annoyed on how well the comforter is tucked in but I was too tired to care and fell asleep. The pillow was a little soft for me, still better than a Holiday Inn, but the bed was too comfortable for me to care. I woke up a few hours later since humans are technically animals and we all know how they sound when devouring food in front of a TV.. And then fell back asleep again. The next morning I woke up since it was bright and they didn't have drapes that covered the windows, only light curtains which was nice at night, but annoying in the morning with the sun rise. As I went down to breakfast, which they gave us for free as we had to pay $10 per person, I was excited. The first thing I took was some delicious milk which apparently went bad and I talked it after 3 thirsting gulps and I've kind felt sick all day and had weird has (-3 stars). The strudel was delicious and I took 2 more and then headed out back home, the end. I expected better from Sheraton when it comes to breakfast to avoid getting sick, especially if I am a weary traveler.Very disappointed ! Not clean and very dated. Will not be staying at an 4 Points again.Duplicitous checkin and charge process has alienated me for life. Charging $80 for incidentals and to a debit card at that!It's like a hotel inception. Four Points within Sheraton within Starwood.Seems like a decent location - not in the heart of the city but not far from the interstate. There's plenty of parking and the front desk was beyond accommodating when I arrived. Free breakfast was included with my room stay and there's also 24/7 free wifi. My room is spacious yet minimalist with a limited color palette of berries, browns and cream. There's a big bathroom, a work desk, a flat-screen HD TV and a couple of comfy queen beds - perfect for a weary business traveler. They have a wine & beer bar in the lobby, a fitness area and an outdoor pool. I'm glad Starwood is making more hip, affordable places to stay, similar to their Aloft chain. :)I have stayed here twice and both visits were quite enjoyable. It is always very clean, and well kept. The rooms are clean. They have a pool and a quality, clean gym. The staff is warm and friendly and checkin was a breeze.The room was clean and nice for the price. The bathrooms were oddly not very private with the door being on a rack that you can see right from the room into the bathroom. I mean I guess you probably won't have anyone in your room that you need to hide from but still an odd design choice. Overall I was very pleased with my stay.The rooms are nice and very clean, but I'm not a fan of having no drawers for storage. I really like that the gym and pool are open 24-7. The cleaning staff are quick and efficient.Recently stayed here and I was blown away by this hotel. My coworker and I got in late and our group had already left for dinner by the time we arrived. When asking the receptionist for suggestions for a good bite and drink she suggested that she would drop us off and pick us up from Stonewood's which is not in walking distance. After we hesitated for a bit and saw that the only other option was to go to MC'D's we said what the heck sure. She used her own car, would not let us tip her and did it all with a smile.The rooms were swanky and the bed was so comfy I almost couldnt get up. No fear the sweet receptionist called me and reminded me that my group was about to depart for the meeting. Great hotel, not much to do around here but if you are visiting NAPCO, STAY HERE!!!!!Very attractive and clean hotel. Rooms were nice and comfortable. Lots of storage areas and hooks for hanging jackets, towels etc. Only complaint is that the rooms aren't very sound proof. You can hear people in the hallway and rooms above/around you. The bathroom doors are on tracks that slide instead of swing. This makes privacy a bit of an issue and they are loud when being closed. Overall very nice, well priced room. Easy access from 95 and decent restaurant options close by.We had a great stay here over the weekend of 3/19/2010. The hotel was clean, very accommodating, allowed us an early check in and late check out. The room was spacious and came equipped with Seattle's best coffee & Tazo teas as well as complimentary water. Everyone on the staff was extremely courteous and professional but also very relaxed. We're fans and for the price considered the stay a bargain.Stayed there this past weekend. Good overall. This largely seems to be a business-traveler hotel. On the weekend, there are few guests and very little help, although if they really work with a skeleton crew on the weekends, they hide it pretty well. Apart from housekeeping and the morning kitchen staff (usually just one server and one chef), there was usually just the one front desk person running the entire show. The front desk person also seems to run the beer/wine bar during the weekend evenings as well. All in all though the service wasn't lacking despite the small staff. We loved our breakfast server Tatiana; she's very nice and personable.The breakfast menu is really just the buffet ($8.00) or what amounts to just parts of the buffet (pricing less than $8.00). Food was pretty good although it's the standard fare (cereal (hot and cold), toast, bagels, danishes, potatos, sausage, bacon, yogurt, limited fruit selection (mostly melon), and scrambled eggs (omelets were sometimes available, sometimes not).The room was very nice and comfortable and very modern, as was the decor everywhere (very much like a mini "W" hotel). Only gripe about the room was the bathroom door was a sliding panel that was very noisy...you'll wake up your other half in the middle of the night with it.The hotel can get busy on weekends though if there's a meeting or something. This weekend it looked like some sort of high school graduation party. The downside is that it can get rowdy. At 2am, guests of the party were taking the stairs to the roof (I'm assuming to either drink or smoke a little weed) and we were on the top (4th) floor so we were awakened by them. However I called the front desk and they took care of that ASAP. While they have security cameras in many places (you can see the monitor at the front desk), the roof isn't one of them. I'm also a little surprised that the door to the rooftop was not locked to begin with (or maybe that's a fire code issue?).The bar area in the lobby is nice but it can get noisy. Sometimes small groups of locals will gather over wine, etc. but the open design means that the noise isn't suppressed well. For that reason, try not to get a first-floor room. I would also say that our room's door didn't do that great of a job filtering out hallway noise.Free wireless worked great though (good speed and availability in lobby and in our room). Pool was also nice but no jacuzzi. Standard/basic hotel workout room is available too.Not perfect but a good value and good service overall. I'd stay there again.

I stayed at this hotel when I first arrived in Jacksonville, the place really stood out for the hospitality. I loved the laundry facilities they had there. I was able to go and stay there with my medium size dog Harley. It was really a good size room and they had a kitchen. If you're moving to the area I mean it was really good price longer term stay type hotel. In my room there was no smell of smoke at all. That right there is really important to me because I am allergic to it and if I stay in a room with the slightest smell of smoke. I will have head congestion and be feeling sick all the next day. I would definitely recommend this to any family trying to move in the area.Nice hotel, it looked bleah outside and lobby, and i was surprised when i walked into the room.  It was bigger than I thought and pretty.  the kitchen was pretty big - if you want to cook, this is the place.wanted to go to the dog park next to the hotel but didnt get to.friendly staff - they were very helpful with info around the town.I have stayed here several times while on business trips. I like the location, rooms are simple but clean and well supplied with most of what you need. Cost is very reasonable. The staff is really great and the place is generally comfortable and quiet. The free laundry is nice too, if you need it. My single gripe is with the Wifi. It is provided for free but is really pretty slow most of the time. On business trips, this can be a real hassle. Overall a good deal however.First let me say that this hotel is in a great location. It's perfectly situated between southside Jacksonville and downtown. It's right off I95 and US1 and is very easy to get to. This hotel is very nice. The front desk staff are helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very contemporary looking. The only thing you need to be aware of is that all of the rooms here have only one bed. Since I travel with a group of 8 people, that's our only issue because we have to get double the amount of rooms. Otherwise this hotel is pretty sweet place.This is an extended stay hotel, but we only stayed a night because the rates were still cheaper than most of the surrounding hotels, and you got a full kitchen with it to boot.  The room was gorgeous, the fitness center, laundry and pantry room were all conveniently located and well appointed, and the staff was very friendly.  My only complaint was that the floors seem to be a little thin or maybe we just had loud neighbors, because it sounded like the person above us was walking on their heels the whole time.  Didn't really hear anyone on either side of us, just some yahoos in the hallway at 2am.  Otherwise it was very quiet and I will probably be staying here again when visiting Jacksonville.Great place.  I little odd in that the building doesn't have the obligatory covered drive-up/unloading area  that most hotels do.  But checkin was a breeze, had a great conversation with the clerk about travel in general, and Grand Canyon in particular.  The room was crisp and clean.  I love how this place has a kitchen, though I didn't use it.I checked out early and without warning and the front desk handled it quickly and professionally.I'll be back!The room was very clean . It was a decent price and the beds were not horrible for a hotel it have slept on way worse. There was absolutely no bugs and plenty of full size towels. Would definitely stay there again . The only thing is we were not there for long so we did not really get to see the gym or laundry facility because we only stayed one night. The staff was very friendly and helpful.Although newly remodeled, with nice appliances, bathrooms and decor....I was greeted with a dead roach upon entering my room. Also, I noticed my nightstand to be sticky and with unwanted hair on it. Furthermore, there was this musty odor in the hallways that almost made me sick. The smell reminded me of an elderly nursing home. Apparently, this is an extended stay type of hotel. For some reason, there isn't someone at the front desk 24/7 like in conventional hotels. There's a sign on the desk with a phone instructing to dial "0" for assistance for after hours. 6pm is after hours for them. It gave me an eerie feeling. I wouldn't stay there again!!Definitely recommended. Nice folks. Dog friendly with a grassy area for walking pets (although I was afraid an alligator might pop out at any moment). They have a gym and an honor-system mini convenience store. Nice.Hard not to give it anything but a 5. I've never been to or even hear of candlewood suites before so I figured what the heck for the price. So glad I chose to stay here. Me and the fiance loved it. For the price there IS NO BETTER hotel out there. Set up as studios it virtually gives you the option to have a much more affordable vacation in the sense you can stay in and cook with the provided stove, fridge, and microwave. Clean room and arrived in town at about 2 am and they have mini safes that have your key in it so you can just put in the safe code and go. Comes with a laundry room for those on a business trip staying for longer. Just a 5 star expierence and hotel.spotless. comfortable. nice decor. renovated.The rates are awesome! It is a clean hotel, very nice. I was kind of sad when I found out it didn't have a pool, but it does have a gym. The pillows are so comfy!!! I have had two complaints though... The refrigerator makes popping noises every few minutes, it got on our nerves so bad that my boyfriend unplugged it. The front desk said they replaced quite a few, and offered for us to move to another room. We were already settled in and declined, it wasn't that big of a deal. The second issue... there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom, let's just say ewwwww if you share your room with someone. (I love my boyfriend, but I don't want to smell him) I would definitely stay in another Candlewood Suite despite the minor issues we had!Staff nice, but room was very dated and worn.   80's era decor.  "Old" smell in lobby and room.The front desk was very helpful, a very quite peaceful place...I stayed here in January and was very pleasantly surprised with how nice this hotel is appointed.  They are in the midst of refurbishing this property.  You have a bedroom, separate sitting area, full kitchen, full size refrigerator and quartz or granite counters in the kitchen and bath.  The recliner looked "tired", but the front desk said they will be replaced as soon as they are shipped.  Quiet location.  Easy access to I-95.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Jacksonville Butler Blvd
review_content: This is our third night on the road. This La Quita is well run, spotless, and very pet friendly. There is a small lake area with benches and poop bags.We were surprised at the value, quality and view out our 5th floor window. Our room is basically a suite with wifi, desk space and, most of all, a comfortable king bed. We had a list of restaurants to explore but since our suite is so relaxing, we are ordering in. It feels like home.Not impressed. Maybe I'm a little pickier than others as far as this brand is concerned (used to work for them).This inn, like several others in the chain, is dated, poorly maintained, over-priced.Being picky, here's just a few things that need attention: elevators dirty, "creekly", noisy, undependable. Painted surfaces on doors and other areas, chipped, dirty. Walls and other "nooks & crannys" covered by outside vendor's menus and flyers. Dumpster area, dirty, littered, noisy from machinery and a generator? Road noise, construction noise...not the inn's fault, but it would have been nice to be given a choice of room location. Morning breakfast was ok. I have a problem with juice pitchers that are left uncapped for public use (picture guests picking up the pitcher, sneezes, loose hair, assorted hands touching everywhere...ewww! Fresh fruit and fruit salad were a nice touch, along with cereal, bagels, muffins, make-ur-own waffles.Our room, clean & dirty...mostly clean, but the fridge and tv area were not. Rug needs shampoo'd. The bedside alarm clock digital readout did not work. The lighting for the room was plentiful but not easily managed (hard to explain, but the way switches and lamps are setup, made it odd).The heating/cooling was hit and miss...mostly had to manage it manually to be comfortable.The furniture, while sort of adequate, really needs the addition of a chair and table. As is, the desk serves as a table and desk with only an uncomfortable desk chair. There is an old, bulky, hard to use leather recliner...yuk. Asked front desk agent for an extra, regular chair. She was not very friendly about getting one and sounded like it was going to be a hassle to get it.Housekeepers were terrific. Since we were DND our entire stay, we just swapped dirty towels for clean every day. They were great about doing this and supplying refills of paper products, taking our trash, etc.At this price, I expect better. On to Marriot next time.I don't understand why this hotel doesn't have a better rating on Yelp. Everything about my experience was first rate. Jeremy, at the front desk, was genuine, efficient and sincerely working to please not only me but each and every guest I observed him with.We stayed last evening and it was great. The room was very clean. The rate was superb. The bed was incredibly comfortable. We drove thru NC, SC and GA before settling into Jacksonville. My husband loved the waffle breakfast! We will stay again!Made our little family's stay in Jacksonville SO much better! Excellent service, polite, and pet friendly!Spending time with family visiting from out of town. Suggested they stay at the La Quinta - Butler Blvd & Lenoir Ave, because it is easy to get to and very centrally located, with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. Also pet-friendly and has free breakfasts, which would make anyone very happy. The hotel is clean, the clerk, Jeremy was polite, friendly and very helpful. Best experience at a hotel in a long time.The room was clean, the WIFI worked and the TV in the room had a menu to navigate channels (comes in handy when you are in an unfamiliar city). The morning breakfast was very basic, but the food seemed fresh. The only drawback I found was in the fitness center. The two treadmills were in need of maintenance and the TV in the fitness center would loose the picture after a few minutes.My family and I have stayed at this la quinta for 2 weeks. We just moved to Jacksonville and our rental home is not ready yet. We originally checked into the orange park location, but we're not happy with that location. So we checked out there and checked in to this location on Butler Blvd. Staff is extremely frienfly. Hotel is clean. Breakfast is a plus. I have 2 large dogs with me and la quinta has the best pet policy. No breed restrictions and no pet fee. Because of this we always stay at la Quinta hotels. We've really enjoyed our 2 week stay here.Had a bad experience with a staff member, who was very rude to my dear friend who is 7 months pregnant! She needed to use the restroom, but the employee on staff did not allow her to because she was not a guest. Employees need to be better screened on having common sense, respect, and courtesy.I have been to La Quinta Inn & Suites before and I have had pleasant experiences, and terrible ones. Unfortunately, I have endured a terrible experience at this La Quinta location. The staff here is very friendly in person, and over the phone, but they are not helpful at all. The member at the front desk was happy to inform us that we were getting a room that was newly renovated, which was nice to hear. Once we got into the room, we had nice carpets, a nice bed, and tv. The bathrooms were not renovated, and the tiling was very old, our bathroom was missing doorknobs Painting in this room was also incomplete. During our stay we had to leave our room so they could install new curtains. (They couldn't do this when we left?) Also, our room was cleaned once, and we had stayed here for over a week. We had put in requests to have our room cleaned 3 times, and it had never happened. During a room cleaning, your supplies are replenished. Since our rooms were never cleaned, we had to request new towels, toiletries, and sheets from the front desk nearly everyday. One positive thing about this location is that it is pet friendly, and they are always happy to have pets in their locations. We stayed here because we were moving and needed a hotel where we could have our dog until we found a home. Hopefully by the time anyone else chooses to stay here, the renovations will be complete, and they will have at least one person here to service rooms full-time.Very disappointing.First problem - the phone didn't work. When the repairman came, we also asked about the air (room was very warm). He checked a few things, and said it was now fixed. We travelled with a baby. her knees were black from crawling on the carpet. When I came back from the hospital, I went for a cup of coffee. The site "Hotels near St. Vincent" said it was always available. No coffee- only in the am. When I went to the room it was still warm. When I complained, the front hostess simply turned the thermostat down to 62. I expect to freeze tonight. Her comment was "well, what did you want me to do?" I expected to get a clean, comfortable room. Silly me!This hotel has always left us with a great experience. I don't care to stay anywhere else in Jacksonville. Clean, tasteful, and friendly.Excellent location and beautifully kept facility at a fantastic price! Before we arrived, we had three different contacts here with the front desk. Haley could not have been more helpful, and when we arrived she continued to make our stay as delightful as possible. The staff welcomes guests as family into their own home! Staying an en extra night this trip, and will definitely return I the future.Worn and tired hotel. My room is spacious but it smells like wet dog and the chair smells like urine. I am too tired to request a new room. I will try Motel 6 next time. UPDATE: The guests next door came back and showed the paper-thin nature of the connecting door. They are loud and I can't fall asleep. This place sucks for sure. I called the front desk to get a new room.UPDATE #2: The new room smells of new paint. I called the front desk to ask if it has been painted (now I see the painter's tape on the back of the room door) and the desk has no records of what has been painted recently. After 10 minutes and the start of a headache, I ask for yet another room.UPDATE #3: I check the next room and it all looks good. Finally! I unpack and yet when I go to the bathroom, there is fecal matter in the loo. Wow, they don't even bother to flush!? That's it. Three strikes you are out.In the end, I called hotels.com to demand a refund. I left and headed for the nearby Best Western. It ended up being cheaper and the room was much, much better. This was my first visit to a La Quinta hotel and most certainly my last.I wish you could give zero stars.In town on business, we stayed at LaQuinta because the company uses this hotel to host overnight visitors. We were greeted by a friendly staffer and quickly settled into our spacious room. It was everything we needed and was as clean as we expected it should be. From our fourth floor window we could see peeps enjoying the hot tub and pool, and although we did not partake, they seemed to be having fun. The bed was comfortable - firmer than at other hotels we've been to recently - and we awoke well-rested. After I take my shower we will head downstairs for a quick breakfast then we'll be off. :-)Clean room for a good price. Nice Staff and fairly quiet. Moved here after a disastrous stay at another hotel in the area. Very relieved to have a better experience here.We needed a cheap place to crash in Jacksonville while down there meeting up with some family. My only condition was that the place was clean and had a nice pool. This place really exceeded our expectations, and we paid under $150 for 2 nights. The rooms were great - pretty much your standard hotel room, but had a mini fridge and microwave in addition to the coffee maker. No balcony, but had windows which opened which was nice. Huge sigh of relief when I saw the spotlessly clean bathroom. Comfy bed with nice crisp clean sheets. Decor was nothing special, pretty much what you'd expect in this price range. Smallish TV, came with HBO. The pool was great! Very clean, not too chemical-ly, and we had it to ourselves most of the stay. Also had a hot tub, but it was about 90 degrees outside for our entire stay, so stuck to the pool. Spent a few hours each morning swimming with our daughter down there and loved it. The location is pretty central, but not in downtown. About 10 minutes from downtown, 10 minutes form the beaches, 30 minutes from St. Augustine. Safe looking neighborhood, lots of nearby restaurants/gas stations/stores, right off 95. One great surprise was the included breakfast. It wasn't just some danishes, but had a make-your-own-waffle station, fresh juices, bagels, yogurts, fresh fruit, cereal, tons of tea and coffee, toast, and of course danishes. Pleasantly surprised, and would definitely return.We enjoyed our stay here. The front lobby staff was friendly and professional and checked us in without fuss or drama. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. It was in line with a moderately priced hotel. We realized the next morning that the windows opened wide and we could have had fresh air all night in our third floor room. Other hotels block their windows closed. Although we did not swim, our window looked out over the clean pool, and other people did enjoy a quick evening swim. The hotel is situated near full service restaurants and in a clean neighborhood where we did not fear that our car would be broken into. We would stay here again.Excellent stay for the price! A very comfortable and quiet night's sleep!

Although, I work from home, our main office is located in Jacksonville, I love staying at Aloft. Their hotels are always so trendy and provide excellent customer service. They have a hip bar area down stairs called the "WXYZ Lounge" where you can mix your favorite drinks and relax with some conversation or watch TV from their many flat screens. They also have a pool area to shoot some pool and play several board games or plug your PC in to browse the internet. They also have a small cafe with plenty of fresh fruit and refrigerated drinks and food that you can take to their outdoor pool area or gym. Their rooms are like I mentioned before very trendy and have that loft NY feel to them. It's the perfect hotel for business or for a short stay for 2 or less. This is not a family hotel so be careful.Reasonably-priced rooms, cool decor, friendly staff and a happy hour with a pool table help make staying at this (or any) Aloft a treat. Two additional benefits of note: - Live music many nights in the XYZ lounge- A fantastic pet policy with no pet fees and a welcome amenity of a dog bed, bowls, treats and (sometimes) a ball. We've stayed in four separate Aloft properties up and down the East Coast as we make our way from MA to FL each year. If you haven't stayed at an Aloft, you're missing something whether you're traveling with or without canine companions.We had a great time. Very modern design and decor. Lovely staff.
