Tyler and Jorge were the best!!!!Nice location - convenient to all places we needed to go. Plenty of parking. Nice soap, shampoo, hair dryer, charging station and TV selection. Only ding....water pressure was a bit on the low side. Free Wi-Fi - love it.Stayed here a few nights last month. The staff was fabulous and always welcomed me when I walked in the door. I appreciate those small touches. Large, inviting lobby that had a great feel. This is the 4th Aloft I have had the pleasure of staying in and I would say this was my best experience. The room was large, open and the bed is so dang comfy. Many outlets which I appreciate. I really like the minimalistic vibe of the whole place as well with the addition of pops of color. Starbucks was right next door in the same complex so I walked over there for my coffee each morning. Overall a very pleasant experience and I would definitely stay again.Aloft was definitely built to be the "poor man's W" and I like it. The basics are there - I was surprised that the rooms don't have the traditional hotel brochures, etc. - that's good, save the planet! Reception was friendly and always willing to help. The pool was convenient as the beach's 15 miles away. Location is good, with conveniently located theater across the street, Starbucks in the parking lot, Publix a short walk away, and plenty of restaurants nearby. Courtesy of SPG, I had an omelette every morning, but on my last morning (different chef) the omelette was half the size! Disappointing :(This was my first time at an Aloft hotel, but am very familiar with the Starwood family and normally stay at Westin & Sheraton. We stopped here for 1 night on our way up the east coast with my wife and 11month old and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel! The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and the room more than exceed our needs. I love the modern feel of the hotel. Instead of a "sophisticated" modern like the Westin is, this is more of a "hip" modern. I love it! Breakfast at the wxyz refuel lounge was great. Also, I really liked the surrounding area. There are plenty of dining options and it is very clean. I'm not too familiar with Jacksonville and a lot of people I know don't have very nice things to say about it, but I thought it was very nice around Tapestry Park. I will definitely be staying with Aloft again in the future!Had a great experience here for a two night stay. The staff was very friendly and knew me by name, and always made me feel welcome. I ran out of lotion in my room and they happily gave me a few more bottles without question. The XYZ bar was pretty poppin on Thursday night, a little quieter on Wednesday night. And the best part was I got 2 free beers after each night I stayed-- they offered a $5 voucher for each night you don't request housekeeping.My wife and I stayed here on a business trip on April 15th and 16th 2015. The staff at the front desk and throughout the hotel were very nice and took good care of us. The bartender was awesome. She made my drinks exactly the way liked them and we had good conversation even though the bar was pretty busy. The room was kind of small but clean and nice. The air conditioning worked good and the Internet was pretty fast. We are SPG members (Aloft is part of the Starwood Hotel Line) and as a member you get complimentary Internet, free bottled water and a few other amenities. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. We didn't eat at the take out breakfast place in the lobby  because I didn't feel like  paying $8 for a breakfast sandwich.  They do not have a restaurant on site but the hotel is very conviently located with plenty of spots to eat nearby.  See my review on Your Pie which is basically across the parking lot from the hotel. They have excellent pizza and sandwiches.  Overall our stay was nice and uneventful. I would recommend it business travelers.I've stayed at many Aloft hotels, and although I like the modern appeal they are generally a little worn down. This was not the case for this property considering it was built around 2011. It's modern, new, and situated in a simple shopping center with simple food choices. Within a few blocks is the outlet malls and a plethora of eateries. Add in the fact the the number of start points is minimal, and this hotel is a no brainer.Really enjoyed my stay here and surprisingly affordable! Pros: cool decor, spacious room, very clean, good service, nice snack bar, great parking, great nearby eateries, great Bliss brand toiletries and unlimited shampoo/conditioner and body wash!! Cons: no iron in room, no baggie to put in the ice bucketWould recommend!Stayed here in a quick Saturday rendezvous out of town with friends. First, the hotel is very cute. I mean like super cute. The lobby and all of the decor was very modern.  Check in was almost seamless, but the check in agent was a little distracted during the process. It was raining at the time of our check in, so the lobby smelled of wet dog (as the hotel does allow pets). The smell was not present upon subsequent visits, however. We received a room on the 2nd floor, with a king bed. Here we encountered a number of issues (minor and resolvable). First, we discovered hair in the bed (under the pillows, under the sheets, etc.). Second, we found that the remote did not work for the TV. I assume this is because the batteries were out or low, and this is not an issue, however I find that it's worth mentioning. Because the room was not booked in my name, my traveling partner went to the service desk to address the issue with the the cleanliness of the room. I was gathering our belongings, so I am not sure of the details of the transaction, but the staff seemed more than happy to transfer our reservation to a new room (3rd floor-King size bed). Shortly after arriving in the new room, the bartender came up to deliver us 2 $10 coupon vouchers for breakfast in efforts to acquiesce the situation. We happily took these vouchers. During our stay I only heard people in the corridor and in other rooms a couple times, being from a college town, I did not find much issue with this, but this may be a less than ideal situation for those that prefer quiet on a Saturday night. The breakfast/snack bar area had an okay variety, but most of the items were very overpriced. (I usually pay $2.88 for a red bull, here they are $4.00). Breakfast and lunch combos are available for $7-8 a pop, including a sandwich/salad, drink, and a side. The location of the hotel is pretty decent, it's a distance for everything we did food and entertainment wise. There are many food options in the area, and a couple fun spots nearby. It's a decent way away from the beach (about 15 minutes from the pier) but definitely manageable.TL;DR: Would certainly stay again if traveling in the area. Staff was very helpful.The hotel was very nice and there is a Starbucks next door. The front desk was always friendly and accommodating. I was with one other person and they only gave us one small water. We asked the housekeeping for another one though , and they gave us some more. The pillows were also very fluffy but kind of hard for us.  The room was very nice and the bathroom was modern and nicely done.  Oh and the Bliss products in the bathroom was also a very nice touch.  We enjoyed our short stay but would definitely come back again .  Oh Rachel from the concierge or reservations line was also very nice and accommodating .Very clean with friendly staff.  The bar was lively and the pool table was nice.  You can get snacks and drinks in their cafe area.  They also have a shuttle van to take you around.$99  a night is a steal for this beautiful and new hotel experience. The decor is quite modern with chic furniture. The hotel itself is pet friendly and get this...no pet fee!!! The outdoor pool is gorgeous and heated. We went swimming in the cool evening and steam was rolling off the pool. The staff was very friendly and greeted us and our dog with open arms.  :)Located in Southside of jacksonville florida, there are plenty of restaurants to visit. Unfortunately we only had 1 night here. I would definitely come back here for a few extra days. We did try two restaurants that were walking distance and both were a hit!!! (Seven bridges brewery with homemade food and your pie with homemade build your own pizzas and paninis)We had a few issues with booking, but Amelia made up for it! Thank you for making my birthday special! We had a wonderful stay at Aloft! We will definitely be back!My husband & I stayed here for the weekend. It was close to restaurants, shopping plaza and the beach was 20 minutes away. The rooms were a bit smaller than other hotels but it was clean with modern furniture. They also have a lounge in the lobby where we sat and had dinner and a drink. They also offers game boards and pool table for extra entertainment. We went in the pool late Saturday night and it was not crowded. The water could use some cleaning but other than that the pool was very spacious. Checking out was easy breezy & I even registered (while Mr. was packing) for the rewards program because we plan on coming back and staying there again. I highly recommend this hotel.Loved my stay here! Only two dings in the room: 1. after a long flight/day a hot shower is all you want, but the showerhead was clogged from Florida's hard water and the water streams coming out of the showerhead felt like getting hit with needles.  Needed a little CLR soak to clean up the holes.  I fixed this by running my fingernail over the holes to free them of debris and this made things so much better.  I know it's a daunting task for every room, but if someone could soak them in CLR once a month, that would help greatly.  2. the a/c unit in the room rattled a lot while running.  Pressing on the outside did nothing to deter this, so it must be on the inside.Good things/people! 1. Michael, the manager was very accommodating on my weird request of vinegar.  I had a stinky wetsuit that I had to rinse off and he gave me a bottle of vinegar, which I used and returned.  2 the front desk ladies greeted us upon returning from our daily activities every time.  3. the wxyz bar has 5-7 happy hour with $3 domestics/$4 well drinks and their well liquor is Smirnoff, bonus points!  4. beds were comfy  5. if you decline room service, which we did a few days, you get a $5 voucher for use in the bar/breakfast/break area of the hotel, extra bonus points!  6. Michael also granted my request for extra towels on my scuba diving days as well. 7. free parking  8. Starbucks is literally in their parking lot!Although I appreciate some what of a response from management, I am in process of taking legal action in order to retrieve the fee I was improperly charged. I'll let my attorney handle this matter in hopes this never happens to another customer that stay at the Aloft Hotel. I have yet to see these photos I have requested on several occasions, I don't believe they exist. To all customers reading this review, please Do Not waste your time or money with this company. They are crooks who take advantage of travelers like myself. I will never do business with this company ever again!!!We've stayed at Alofts in Charlotte and Tallahassee and always had great experiences so when we were booked here by Sheraton , due to no availability at their place, I had no qualms. Unfortunately this was a different deal. First of all, the room smelled like someone forgot to flush the toilet. I was told during check-in that they were at full capacity so I knew there were no other rooms available. So we cranked the AC down to try to stifle the smell. It was worse early in the mornings. The first morning it was so bad that we both woke up with headaches. We decided to get up and get out for some fresh air so we left our room early. We returned around 2:30 in the afternoon in order to get ready for a wedding and to our surprise our room had not been cleaned. I called and inquired and was told that they were really busy. I told them we would be leaving at 5:00 for a wedding and requested that our room be serviced and I was told that housekeeping leaves at 5:00. So no clean room. And still stinky (we propped the door open to get some fresher air in).  To add insult to injury when we checked out we were charged more for our first night ($27 more) than the rate I was quoted when Sheraton booked the room. The front desk wouldn't correct it, saying I would have to take it up with Amanda, the Director of Rooms. Of course Amanda, Director of Rooms was not there and wouldn't be back for 2 days. I wouldn't stay in this place again if they paid me. The only reason for 1 star is the awesome service we received at the Wxyz bar.Enjoyed a great stay at the Aloft hotel....always wanted to stay at one of these hotel chains, but thought they'd be outta my price range. Turns out the rooms were 130.00 a night but they give a great Gov't rate discount for 83.00 a night!!! You will not stay at a better hotel for that price. Rooms are excellent featuring curtain California closets, walk in glass door shower, bed is the most comfortable you will find...I literally sink into the mattress! Curtains close all the way down so no sunlight when you want to sleep late!! They have a bar, heated pool, great gym with treadmills, bikes and dumbells. The lobby has a lounge that is used as an extension of your room, free USA today paper...snacks and drinks available 24 hours a day, mini fridge and iron in all the rooms, no traffic noise, pet friendly-without the noise of barking dogs! Excellent relaxing stay! Book early though as they fill up fast during the week with all the traveling business representatives frequently staying here. They are located right next to several restaurants, bars, and a movie theater! 5 STAR HOTEL in my opinion!
review_content_20: I stayed at Aloft based on a recommendation from a coworker. However, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. While quite trendy I think that you would want to stay at an establishment that would call you back when you feel that you might have left something behind. I lost two beautiful necklaces during my stay at Aloft and when I called I was put on hold for a long time and all the front desk did was leave a note for the housekeeper. The housekeeper never called me back. This made me feel unimportant and that is poor customer service.i stayed at this hotel for two nights recently for a business trip and really enjoyed my stay. the staff is great and really helpful. they already knew me by name on the second day. there's complimentary shuttle service that takes you anywhere within a 5 mile radius. my office was close enough so i was shuttled to and from work - you just need to reserve with them ahead of time. they didn't have my shuttle reservation the second morning (not sure what happened) so i would just double confirm anything you reserve here.my room was fine. modern and clean. comfortable bed and pillows. i love the shampoo/conditioner and body wash dispensers in the shower - so much better than those little bottles. also love the fact that they're from bliss!mitch (who worked the night i arrived) was a lifesaver. i had a nightmare situation taking the taxi from the airport to the hotel - the taxi's ancient credit card machine wasn't work and when we finally got it to start working it wouldn't take my credit card. i tried four cards before i gave up and asked the front desk for help. this was after 30 mins of ME resetting the machine with the grandpa taxi driver. mitch paid him cash and charged the amount to my room so i have record of this horrid and expensive taxi ride. i'll be taking an uber next time.p.s. there's a starbucks right next door. perfect for grabbing your morning coffee and breakfast.Nice hotel but low levels of service with regards to mechanical, heating, AC, etc. Un Uncomfortable enviornment!!!ECJReally enjoyed this location. Room was nice, clean, and pleasant. Great mattress - best sleep I've had in a long time! Staff was friendly and accommodating, even when being queried by one of my party about his room number multiple times after we came in quite late. The price was quite reasonable for the location and amenities.This was the first time I had visited this Aloft and I understand because of it's location weekend nights are quite inexspensive. By far the best $70 room I've had in years. Bed was super comfortable and room was laid out well. The hip Aloft feel prevailed and did not disappoint. If I was in the area again it would be the first place I would look to stay, having restaurants and a brew pub accross the street didn't hurt the experience eitherI visited Aloft last night (29AUG2013) for a social event at their bar.  It took me 25 minutes to get a drink.  I had ordered and then I could tell 5 minutes later that the bartender forgot my order.  The decor is awesome and is very modern.  Checked out the outdoor pool and workout room and these looked excellent.  Empanadas and Chips and Salsa were set out for appetizers.The hotel had closed down for 6 months and just re-opened.  I heard a rumor that they had black mold and had to replace the drywall.  I don't know if this rumor is true.I'll go back for a happy hour sometime at the bar but might wait 2-3 months and go on a slow night.We have stayed here during two separate trips to Jacksonville and really enjoyed it each time! We have always found the rooms to be very clean, quiet, and relaxing. Very cool and modern design. The price is perfect as well. I would definitely stay here again next time. I have also stayed in an Aloft in Colorado and found that hotel to be extremely similar in style and cleanliness as well. Overall, I would prefer to stay in an Aloft when I travel. Very good value for the money.Good location, not so great staff. Our entire stay, the lobby was crowded with private parties or children running around everywhere. On Saturday, they closed the bar early because they felt like it. The pool is small, but it's a good layout. The woman who checked us in seemed overly eager to inform us there are NO cots, NO double beds, and we would probably not be able to have any extra pillows/sheets/blankets. The hotel itself is well-designed and the room was small but functional.Can't say anything about the rooms, as I didn't stay here, but I did come to the hotel for a few days for a conference held in the hotel. Although, the person I was with had stayed in the hotel before and sent me pictures of it, so I know the rooms were nice. Everything here looks classy and modern.Staff wasn't overly helpful or friendly. I think over the multiple days I spent there, I never talked to or was greeted by anyone. The people behind the desk were usually talking to each other.Their system for ordering food, etc. was weird. I didn't realize why the kitchen was so bare or why there were stomach soothers in a modern looking display case until people started ordering them at the desk.Pool looked nice, but I never saw anyone in it.The bar and lounge area looked nice, but in the evening, the music in the bar area was very loud. Walking past it made me want to get out of there, as it wasn't conducive to relaxation or conversation.Overall good location, as you are close to shopping and a lot of restaurants.Place needs a good scrub. Floors are dingy and peeling.  The bartender was rude and on her phone both nights.  They have fantastic cocktails,  but when I pay $12 for a drink I expect at least a Hello. I love the aloft concept,  but would probably not stay at this specific property again. The hotel rate was really reasonableOkay so after one additional night, my review has changed a bit. First, the AC kicks on and off within few minute increments which is weird and especially because the AC is a little noisy so the noise, silence, noise, silence every few minutes is annoying. I had some guests check in next door to me and this is when I realized that the walls are paper thin. I have my two year old in the room with me and the people next door, went to their room, and "got busy" instantly! Not a hater...for I like "getting busy" myself. But why did I have to know they were getting busy? I could literally hear every moan, howl and "gurgle" they made. I had to speak over their "gurgling" noises because my two year old could hear them too...NOT COOL! Also, maybe it's because it's the weekend, but people don't seem to sleep in this hotel and they have late night, hallway cellphone conversations. I don't know if this was the same guest but It happened several times in the two days that I was here and it sounded like the person was talking in front of my door but I'm sure they weren't. So here it is 4am, and my neighbors are at it again. Therefore, I'm awake. Sure wish they would have put some sound proofing in these walls! I know the hall noises are not the fault of the hotel and neither is this late night rendezvous going on next door but man I wish they could find a way to make it quieter in this place.Aloft is one of my favorite travel hotels.  The lobby, bar area and rooms have a hip feel to them.  The Aloft in Tapestry Park is pretty new having opened in January 2011.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I hung out in the lobby bar after dinner making light conversation with some fellow business travelers.  Viola, the bartender, was super nice and funny. A few interesting things I noted about the bedrooms that were different from some of the other Alofts I have visited.  Room key cards had RFID chips instead of the magstripe.  And, there was a cool charging station for your mobile device.Tapestry Park was a 5 minute walk offering a variety of restaurants from steakhouses to Thai food.  Nice location.  Will be back.Beautiful, green hotel.  Room well decorated, comfortable.  Unusual but nice bathroom. In room safe.  Nicest shampoo I have ever used, wish I could have bought some.  Left my hair squeaky clean, full, and smelling great.Very comfortable bed.  Only negative is location, next to a busy road with traffic noise all night.  Must be near a hospital or fire station, because there were also sirens all night.  Very friendly, helpful staff.  Breakfast for purchase from refrigerators.  Microwave it yourself.  Did not partake of this, went to Cracker Barrel for breakfast. Plenty of free parking.  Is located in a shopping center that has several excellent restaurants.  Beautiful lobby.  Pet friendly.We stopped at the Aloft for the night driving from the Florida Keys back to North Carolina. Started off as a great hotel & would've given 5 stars until we were awoken at 1:00 am to a fire alarm! Turns out some idiot got mad about something & pulled the fire alarm.  It took staff a good hour to figure out how to reset the system, so that meant not getting to sleep until 2:00. Fortunately the beds were super comfy & check out wasn't until Noon. Breakfast was ok - nothing to write home about. Amenities were nice. Good price for this class of hotel.Cute property and concept but no insulation in the walls. I could hear EVERYONE and EVERYTHING that was going on up and down the halls of the hotel. Likely won't stay at one again for that sole purpose - it woke me up at night.Modern, chic and trendy! Not too mention their very friendly staff, and how affordable the room rates were :]Their location is right next to a shopping mall, surrounding bars, fast food chains and local restaurants!  *two thumbs up*I know the Aloft is supposed to be the essence of the W, but I was still surprised at the quality of this hotel!The rooms were set up very economically, and I really enjoyed all the green aspects of the hotel.  Among others, they had soap and shampoo dispensers in the shower, rather than passing out little bottles.  There was a "green roof" on part of the hotel, which looked really cool from the fifth floor looking down. The lobby was set up in a very modern manner, with plenty of places to sit and a very friendly staff.Uber friendly staff. Modern amenities and decor really Comfy bedContinental breakfast had a lot of food options for the vegetarian and meat eaters. even yogurt! Yum. temperature is controlled near the entry door, not over by the actual heater/ac unit. the shower was nice, and they supply you with the shampoo conditioner and body wash in the big push dispensers on the wall.I stayed at Aloft in Jacksonville 9-11 Sept (Sun-Tue) and glad that I did.  It was closest to my BCBSFL meeting in Tapestry Park and appeared to have a better fitness center than nearby Hotel Indigo.The hotel is "chic modern" -a very industrial feel with poured concrete floors and exposed ceilings (w duct work) throughout the public areas, multiple stainless framed windows, bold colors, modern furniture, lighting and music.The Lobby is one large room that also contains the "w xyz" bar, reception, a spacious seating area, multiple televisions, their 24hr kitchen area (known as "re:fuel") and a pool table.  This is the first hotel that I have stayed at which had a pool table in their lobby.I arrived early - 2pm on a Sunday - and there was no wait (no one in the lobby at all) and I was given a room on the 2nd floor (#217) facing the green-roofed (aka "living") meeting annex.First off, the RFID chip key-cards are FAR BETTER than the mag-striped: just wave in front of the sensor and the door unlocks.On entering, the room is small but very well appointed.  With a bowl sink, sliding mirrored door to the toilet/glass shower (w wall mounted pump shampoo, body wash dispensers: nice touch!), and dorm-like curtain covered closet space, it was very modern and comfortable - a space for everything. They even managed to fit in a settee.The fitness center was VERY user friendly: 2 each elliptical, bike and treadmill machines - all of the latest Life-Fitness brand (so built-in television, iPod docs, etc).  There was also exercise and medicine balls, yoga mats and importantly (to me anyway), a full set of dumbbells and cable machine.  What worked well for me is I used the space 4 times during my stay and only once was I interrupted when someone else came to exercise (and then only for 20 minutes).The fitness room faces the infinity style pool. During my stay, the ambient temperature ranged from mid 70s-80s so while not heated, it was not shockingly cold when I swam and after doing some "laps" (it is only 30ft long), it was very comfortable.  Again, the times that I swam, there was no one else in the pool area.  The bar - known as "w xyz" - was as expected, dead on Sunday night (4 patrons) but a bit more lively on Monday (20 patrons).  The bartender (I think her name was Nicki) was very nice on both nights and attentive and the drinks reasonably priced.  I did not eat from the bar menu as it was limited (hummus, chips, etc).I did however have some grub from the "re:fuel" kitchen area in the lobby.  While better than nothing, it primarily consisted of better-quality but still microwaveable boxed pizza, burritos and the like as well as some premade salads.  On the night I ate (Sunday), the stocks were bare - very few choices - and I was told that they did not make food on those days as it is not busy - so not fresh to say the least - but filling.As alternative, there is a Starbucks and Sushi Restaurant in the parking lot and several restaurant's serving a variety of fare across the street. The big problem areas for me were:- The flat-screen television "froze" in my room and while the manager came in within minutes to repair it (simply unplug it and let it reboot), he said that this is a normal occurrence as they are on a dish antenna system.- The towels are literally threadbare: I replace mine long before they reach this stage.  I thought it might be a fluke but on the 2nd day, both towels were again shredded.  When I mentioned this to the manager, he said that they replacements had been ordered.  But realistically, they should have been replaced a long time ago.- On the second day, I found what looked like blood spots on the cover to my bed.  There was no sense in mentioning it as thankfully, the maid volunteered and replaced all of the linens in the room.  Still though, it was a bit creepy.- There is something growing in the bathroom shower - or at least it looks that way.  The floors are black and this is white and gooey.  I'm pretty sure (I hope anyway) it was some type of grout or sealant but they need to clean it up and use clear because it looks bad.Overall, the stay was good and I would return.  However, I am fearful that if they are not keeping it up now (it's only been open a year), it will not be habitable in a few years.Although I'm not a fan of the party hotel concept, I knew what it was when I reserved a room and am not taking away stars for this. Before you stay here, know you're walking into a bar that happens to have a hotel connected to it. All Alofts are like this. If you want a quieter room, ask at check-in. If checking in at night, expect to have to speak at yell volume to communicate with the "front desk" because the music is LOUD. I get that. If you're above 30 you might feel out of place here. Besides that, there were some things I didn't like about this particular hotel. For instance, if you put out the do not disturb or do not clean sign at any time during your stay, they will not clean your room unless you ask. Even if you take the sign down on night 2. This needs to be disclosed up front. I've never been in a hotel that did that. The dual-mode toilet (full/half flush) I loved but it still didn't seem to have the pressure of a normal toilet. The shower water pressure wasn't great. In-room safe and mini-fridge was a plus, though. The TV was modern and nice, with a connection module on the desk for hooking up a laptop, etc. The open design was mostly good except if you wanted to sneak away to the bathroom in the middle of the night. Any light you turn on, including the commode/shower room, lights up the whole room. I really want to be fair in my reviews. This place wasn't awful and I might stay here again. The price was right this time, it was clean and it felt safe. The location is great - near a HUGE outdoor shopping mall with easy access to I95/I295. JTB is a mile away so it's easy to head to the beach from there. A Starbucks is in the same parking lot and a movie theater is in walking distance across the street. Restaurants are also in walking distance. And even though I could barely hear myself think in the lobby, my room was quiet as can be. But it's not my favorite hotel in the area.
review_content_40: Great hotel, great location, great staff.Love this place. Its green. New. Clean and Industrial style hotel. Very minimal and simple. Would definitely stay here again and again....Only downside is that there is no restaurant on site. Perfect location to the town centre that has the BEST shopping!  Staff is friendly. Cool place.I felt embarrassed while I was in a military uniform and in front of my wife and newborn.  I called the Starwood corporate office and immediately opened a claim against him and this hotel.  I also recorded some of the conversation on my phone and I'm sure that the hotel has a video that I would like to get of this incident.  Although these words may have not have hit you directly or painted the picture of PURE RACISM, RACIAL PROFILING or extremely poor customer service, it's one of those things that you had to be there in order to understand the true feeling and experience which took place.  Also like I stated before the hotel has this on camera so that the ones who are in charge can get a better picture of what happened.  I have never in my life experienced something like this and it will must be stopped.  I explained to him that how I felt and what he should have did as the GM.  Show some empathy for the customer since is he the General Manager of this place.  How he is the leader of this place and shows no empathy for customers.  The hotel attendant and the Chef were amazing.  I didn't want anything from this place but for the situation to be resolved and so that I can finish and enjoy my 4 day weekend.  It was his actions that made me understand that what I was a victim of.  It's like something you hear about on TV and to know it actually can happen to you.  I really don't care if this guy has a million people tell him that he is amazing he needs an immediate correction.  I don't know if any other African Americans or other ethnicities feel this way but I definitely was treated as if I was just a person lying and looking for free handouts.  It's a lot more to this story again this is just the small portion of what happened and I want the hotel video tape so that everyone can see what the GM of ALOFT Hotel in Jacksonville acts.

review_content: Stayed here for three days. The service was great. Everyone I had an encounter with was super nice. The staff is very friend. The hotel is super clean . It does need a little work but management does communicate with you . We tried the food for breakfast and it was hot and tasty . You can tell that this hotel is run beautifully . I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family .The hotel is ok, but the breakfast was deplorable. $13 for a buffet of 6 items. Can't even make your own waffle. Not even butter for toast. The hotel should be ashamed.I had a reservation at Radisson Jacksonville (Florida) which was supposed to be booked for July 30 - August 1, 2015. I was in town for the USATF Junior Olympic National Championships with my 2 children. The coach for my daughters track team reserved a block of rooms for the team, in March. The parents were given the reservation numbers to change the name, method of payment and date of stay for their rooms. I called on July 15, 2015 to the reservations number and did just that. However, when I arrived on July 30th I was told I did not have a room because my reservation was booked from July 27, 2015 through July 31, 2015 and since I did not arrive on the 27th, my reservation was cancelled. Because of the event that week, I was then told that the hotel was completely sold out and they would not be able to accommodate me.I travel fairly often, both with and without my children, but this was the first time this has ever happened to me. I traveled from Georgia to Florida for this trip and you have no idea how disheartening it is to feel stranded with two children. The front desk clerk, who "helped me" happened to also be the Manager on Duty was unapologetic and suggested I check with the Marriott next door to see if they had any rooms available. Now if this is how The Radisson hotel and its affiliate hotels deals with their customers, you can rest assured knowing this will be the last time I ever attempt to stay at one of your properties. I will be sure to share this experience with everyone possible because this is completely unacceptable. In the end, the Marriott next door was able to accommodate me and my family and turned a horrible experience into a pleasurable one. They gave me a discounted rate for being left stranded by the Radisson.The place I clean and aesthetic to the eye. However, the bed is like a brick. The sink drain slow. The pillows hard and flat. This is the last time I will stay at one. Second Radisson, second city, both suck for the money.Disgusting. Deplorable service.Filthy rooms, understaffed (and poorly staffed) front desk, management that is wholly unavailable for major issues.I travel alone for work. This trip was 10 days long and my days are long. I always leave lights on in the room so I don't stumble in to a strange room alone in the dark. Night one, all my light shad been turned off despite a no housekeeping sign on my door. Who came in? I'll never know because management never called me back.I had 2 packages delivered and the first one was left at front desk and I just picked it up. Second package they once again came in my room without permission. No management to return phone call.RUDE front desk, so so so rude. Unhelpful, disinterested, rude.Hotel is in disgusting need of repairs and updates. I immediately booked another hotel and went there after a couple of nights in this hell hole.Utterly disgusted. After a very long day of travel I shouldn't have to inspect all bedding before letting my kids sleep. Broken phone. Bodily crusty fluid on comforter. I want to leave but I'm too tired.If your last name happens to be Rubble or Flintstone you are probably accustomed to sleeping on stone slabs, if not your not in for a good night's sleep. This hotel chain has the worst beds & bedding on any 3 1/2 star hotel I have ever been in. Absolutely the worst night sleep. I was able to book the room 1/2 off ($48 + tax) via priceline, but even that seems too much. *disclaimer our room was not supposed to have a sleep number bed, but we suspect they didn't replace the sleep number mattresses just locked the setting in place* On the good side the hot water was hot, decent shower and free wifi.I attempted to stay here last week while I was in town on an IT project that involved taking a site survey. I used a corporate lodging card to book my stay, and they proceeded to put a $50 hold on my personal credit card for "incidentals." Well, considering the fact that I didn't plan on ordering breakfast, room service, or anything else, that bothered me. When I got to the room, the one amenity that I was truly counting on, high speed Internet, was a joke. Whoever installed the wireless access points in the hotel obviously thought that a heat map is something that you do with a globe and a thermometer because between the lobby and where my room was on the sixth floor, the signal on my laptop never went above two bars, and I was able to connect faster using my smartphone as a wireless hotspot. In short, if you have money and want to waste it, stay at this hotel. If you want to get anything resembling work done, go stay at the Econolodge down the road.The hotel was near Mayo Clinic where we needed to be. Restaurant was open late and we were hungry~ there was only one other table with people and a few folks at the bar. It was about 8:30 pm. Food was so-so. Waitress was very sweet. The bread on my sandwich was so hard at one end that I couldn't eat it. My husband only ate half of his~ badly put together club sandwich. Room was OK. Furniture very dated and chair was beat. Sleep number beds did not work at all. Pillows were entirely worn out. Did not sleep well. We did get a Mayo discount which is the only reason I didn't voice more of a complaint. I took the survey after our stay and got the standard response from the manager. We are heading back to Jax next month but I won't be staying there. Will pay a little extra for better accommodations. We did get a free glass of wine voucher upon check in which I had with my meal. The breakfast buffet was $12.99 per person so we skipped that.I really like the decor of this hotel, the lobby and the rooms. Staff is professional. The bar is small but has 2 big screen tvs, so you can sip on your drink and be entertained if you're by yourself (as I frequently am, travelling alone). The lady bartender who works there M-W is sweet as can be, and even made everyone a shooter at the end of the night.The room has adequate seating with a lounger and chaise, as well as a really nice desk. Internet is free and there was a fridge in my room, hidden by wooden paneling. I have to say again, that I loved the decor. Dark wood, paneling at the bed's headboard, earthy and rich brown tones. The bed was very comfortable as well.Would definitely stay here again! Class, convenience, without all the nickel-and-diming you see at hotels that are 4 stars and above. One of the nicest experiences at a hotel I've ever had.The service here is really amazing! I was just here on business and it made me want to stay an extra day. The pictures and the written amenities don't really do it justice. There is a huge human factor in this hotel. The people make the place. However, if you don't like to talk to anyone and you just like to hole away it might not be as great. It's a very comfortable but simple hotel. Sleepnumber bed, mini-fridge, coffee maker and microwave are all bonuses though. Upon checking in I asked for a quiet room and Geraldo at the front desk really took a moment to give me what he thought would be a good room. It just so happened that the AC had a weird rattle noise and the WiFi wasn't working. He sent someone up immediately to fix it and then helped trouble shoot the WiFi. It still wasn't working so he put me in a new room. (I'm seriously such a pest but he was so gracious about it all). The bar tender/waitress/everything in the restaurant was so awesome. Her name is Carolyn and she is obviously a staple. There were several people that came in just to say hello to her and give her a hug. I met at least 5 regular patrons who come here several times a year. It was actually really weird- I thought, this is a simple but nice hotel, what makes people come back over and over again? The service, the food and the affordability. The room service breakfast was also insanely good. Tanner moved my order up and accommodated my requests and was super friendly. Everything was perfectly seasoned and tasted like it was made with some heart. The evening chef also loves to watch Jeopardy at 7:30, you should go have a drink and order something after the show so you can hear how knowledgeable she is (if you order during than you won't get to experience that). After my first day another front desk attendant (Chelsea) called to see how my stay was. That's just great service. I don't know if I'll ever have a need to come back to Jacksonville but if I do I'd want to stay here.I recently stayed here on business and the staff was very nice and friendly, and the overall hotel was nice. However, my MAJOR complaint was the fact that every morning, without fail, the housekeepers (4th floor) would be literally SCREAMING spanish back and forth down the hallway as they were cleaning rooms. I'm not talking one or two yells, but a constant conversation that lasted over an hour plus. This happened EVERY morning and woke me up each day.Not bad. Hotels.com got me a very good rate for three nights and the room was clean, spacious, and had all the normal amenities. Loved the wired internet; much more reliable than wireless. The desk was kinda weird but hey, it works. TV, flat screen, fine; but the channels are lame (again not their fault). Very quiet until Friday night when crowds checked in. Not much they can do about that so I'm not dinging them.I did not try the restaurant but I'm guessing you can do better elsewhere. The bar has alcohol. Enough said. Now the bed. My room (327) had a sleep number bed, which is basically an inflatable mattress with a control to set the degree of inflation on each side of a queen sized bed. I am not a fan. Others may disagree. If I stay here next time I'll try to find a room with a normal mattress. Looking out the window I see a nice pool and jacuzzi. No bathing suit so I didn't imbibe.Pretty convenient to Butler Blvd, and I-95 just south of Jax. If I return I'll stay here again.I normally wouldn't review a chain hotel, but this one was very clean, staff were friendly and everything seemed to be newer. What i'm saying is, if you need a hotel off 95 in Jacksonville this one will do just fine. And show your AAA card (if you have one) for a discount.Nice clean room at a very good rate.My husband and I have stayed at this hotel about 4 times over the last few years. It was our go to spot in Jacksonville for quick weekend getaways. It is such a shame that the management has allowed the property to deteriorate so quickly since the last renovation. The lobby is still impressively beautiful but beyond that we were totally disgusted with the filth of the hotel. We booked our stay about 4pm before arriving in Jacksonville around 6:30pm. Check-In was wonderful, the clerk was very friendly and we went straight up to our room. We were initially disgusted by the horrible carpet stains as soon as we got off the elevator. I mean if it is that visible to guest, why can't management see it and get it fixed? We entered the room and were in shock of how many visible things were wrong with the room. I mean don't the cleaning staff see these things? Toilet stains, mold in the shower, stains on the chairs. We were in a rush to get to a dinner reservation for 8pm so we went back down to the front desk and asked if we could check out due to the cleanliness issues. We were only there for 30 minutes before we decided to leave and just book another hotel in the area but the clerk was adamant that we still would be charged and there was nothing she could do because we checked in before the cutoff time. Whatever. We didn't want to be late for our reservation so we left and she agreed to switch our room when we got back. We didn't want to waste our money and we had enjoyed previous stays so we figured a new room would suffice, it was just one night. Wrong. The second room was just as bad. Once again we asked to just have the hold removed from our card so we can check out and we were told, NO. It was after 11pm and we were tired so we just dealt with room number 3 which was slightly better than the first two.I didn't say anything at checkout because I hate being viewed as a customer that is just seeking a discount or something so I decided to just never return to this property and post my review and pictures. I just want others to beware.It is such disappointment to see such a quality property that we once loved with so much potential decline over little things that can be fixed if management cared enough.I cant complain about this hotel everything was GREAT the outside and inside swimming pool was nice and hot tub the only reason I gave them a 4 star they need more stuff around the hotel to do there is one thing within walking distance and that DAVID BUSTER I mean literally walking distance from the front door of lobby to D&B front door lol the front desk clerk are nice. The hotel is close by the interstate 10 min from beach they have a mall like 5-10 min away. The rooms are spacious with sleep # beds you have a microwave, refridge, FREE WIFI, TV, Phone and etc worth the money.

I spent a lot of time trying to find a place in Jacksonville and finally decided on Hotel Indigo.  It is not the most expensive, nor is it the cheapest.  This place has overall great reviews and I can see why!We arrived on a Friday evening and were promptly greeted in their beautiful lobby next to the bar.  We made it up to our room, and it is probably one of the nicest hotel rooms I have been in, in awhile.  Have to love the hardwood floors!  The bed was a little rougher than I would have liked, would have been the icing on the cake if it was softer.  The shower was amazing.  It did not have a tub, but I would rather have the HUGE shower instead of the tight bathtub/shower combo you have in most places.  They give you the typical shower items - shampoo, soap, etc.  But ladies, they also give makeup wipes each day! Score! :)The location of the hotel was great for us.  I'm not sure on it's proximity to things in Jacksonville, but we were just staying there for two nights for travel to and from Gainesville.  It is in walking distance to a lot of things.  We walked to dinner Friday night and to breakfast Saturday morning.  There is also walking around a pond that we explored Friday night.I highly recommend this beautiful hotel!  Great place to stop and get some good nights sleep!We stayed here December 26-27.After a long journey, arriving at Hotel Indigo was like finding an oasis. The staff was friendly, cheerful, humorous, and helpful. This hotel has a youthful vibe, as opposed to some hotels where the feeling is old and stuffy. The wi-fi was strong, and very easy to access. The bed was clean and comfortable. The shower was huge! It could easily fit five adults. The water pressure was surprisingly low, but enough to get clean. It would be better if the room had full, solid curtains for those who would like privacy and to sleep in later. Don't be surprised if it takes a little bit of time for the lighting to warm up to its full brightness level. There are better LED and CFL bulbs on the market that don't take as much time. The positioning of the hand towel rod is strange, as it is attached to the bathroom counter down low. The TV had issues in that it would lock up the image, and then wouldn't turn off. Then it wouldn't turn on. This happened multiple times. The hotel does have dining options on site.  We didn't eat here, but I browsed the in-room menu. Their modest attempt to use local ingredients seems more of a marketing ploy than an actual desire to support local farms, but the food options seem better than what you might find in other hotels in this price range. A Keurig, with both regular and decaf organic coffees is provided in the room with real mugs instead of paper cups.Despite the few negatives I've mentioned, this large, cool, clean, and contemporary hotel is a great value. For the price of $89/night it felt quite plush.First timer at Hotel Indigo and would recommend to anyone staying in the Jax area. The room was undeniably spotless. Hardwood floors, comfortable beds and a giant walk in shower are just the tip of the iceberg. Upon entering, a fully stocked Keurig machine rests comfortably on a wooden shelf. The window views overlooking the lake were relaxing and peaceful. Amenities included a 24 hour fitness center, which I took advantage of instantaneously. For a hotel gym, it did the trick. Next to the gym, there's a small pool. If weather permitted, I would've went for quick swim. Lastly, the lobby houses a bar and ample seating for breakfast and conversation. The service was inviting and accommodating. I did have a slight issue of my credit card being charged, instead of my boss's card. The front desk attendants were patient with me and a few days later my credit was returned. Overall, a great experience here.Stayed here after a company Christmas party and was very impressed.  The rooms are smart, stylish, and the service is fantastic.  Even their wifi (which is usually problematic at hotels) was reliable and free.Everything about this hotel is designed with comfort and class in mind and they definitely are doing it right!On my last business trip to Jacksonville, I was rather comfortable about where I was. It's almost like comparing apples and oranges. Very similar to OC in terms of the weather and the laid back atmosphere. The land is more flat in JAX and the humidity makes it warmer, but they have this thing called Southern Hospitality that just permeates from the neighboring states. On a recent drive thru Anaheim, I noticed the city also has a Hotel Indigo. The one in JAX is almost identical in it's modern design and look, making it a stylish boutique hotel that reflects the culture and vibe of the surrounding area. It's located in Tapestry Park, overlooking a beautiful lake. Across, from the Merrill Lynch campus, you can take a bridge and just stroll over to the other side.There are several restaurants within walking distance of the lodging, making it very convenient to go back and forth. The St. John's Town Center is a couple miles down, with Downtown JAX being just a few minutes away. The staff is ultra friendly, with a clear focus on comfort, and a firm belief in taking care of the guest. Compared, to the other hotels I've experienced outside of LA, it was a pleasant surprise.Along with the contemporary design, there's a lot of color inside and out. My room had a hardwood floor, a couple rugs, and a spa inspired bathroom with an open shower (no door). I'm talking about FREE Wi-Fi, toiletries provided by Aveda, and a great air conditioner that blasts to infinity and beyond. I don't care how cold it gets in the room. You wanna keep me happy, get the A/C working right. The bed is oversized, plush as well. 32 inch HD TV, lounge char, and a separated section that acts as a draped closet. As for the services and amenities - Fitness Center, Outdoor Pool & Hot Tub, Business Center, Same Day Dry Cleaning, Laundry Service, and FREE parking. The 98 Forty Bar & Bistro, located on the lobby floor, prepared my expensed breakfast every morning without fail. Not to mention a few signature cocktails during Happy Hour. Did I mention that the place is pet friendly? Would definitely consider this hotel during my next stay in JAX.I've only been to Jacksonville Florida a few times, and this was the first time I stayed at the Hotel Indigo. It was very clean, and the staff was exceptionally friendly. If I had one criticism it would be that the hotel needs to invest in better mattresses. The mattress in my room was very uneven and lumpy.I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Indigo and I would recommend it. The drawbacks are that the pool is tiny and there isn't much sunlight. The gym is of 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical and a work out bench. The gym window is where the pool is.I love the layout of the room and the hardwood floors add a touch of class. The bed is very comfortable and the room had a nice view.We've done Indigo before and have always liked it.Keyword here, dog friendly! Bad point, they add a $50 fee /per stay for the four leg one. Roomie said, that ain't bad. And I said, that's 2 case of beer! Good points, staff are friendly, bar is great, parking is free, wifi is fast enough, room is clean. Shower was hot, facility to walk our dog is beyond good. Great shopping walk about too.This hotel is beautiful but the staff is what sets it apart from all the others. The staff goes above and beyond. If your staying in Jacksonville, you want to stay here.Enjoyed the stay, nice property although some of the furnishings in the room we stayed in could use a renovation. But overall it was clean and comfortable. Would stay again if in town.Amazing hotel! First time in this hotel and first time in this city. The hotel is beautiful, super clean ,modern and comfortable. Super friendly staff. The room is a beauty, super clean, comfortable, modern. Super comfortable bed, great, amazing bathroom. The truth that we Super recommend this hotel is beautiful of all we have visited over the years, is one of the most beautiful it is definitely one of the most beautiful and comfortable. I post some pictures so you can see it better. Great Hotel!Update 02/26/15 ...Stayed at this hotel again.  Good news/bad news:Good news:  The wi-fi works with iOS devices now.  The staff is still friendly and seemingly competent.Bad news:  If you are a business traveler (or other) and require the use of a VPN with wi-fi (some businesses require it for remote access and smart travelers often use it to avoid having their wi-fi communications eavesdropped on) you are OUT of luck.  VPN is blocked by the Hotel and/or its ISP.More bad news:  While the hotel says it is "pet friendly," what that means to many of us is that our allergies will go crazy.  They did.  Pet friendly = guest unfriendly, in our experience.  Sleeping was difficult.So, it's a nice hotel, but depending on one's circumstances this one might not be for you.Beautiful hotel. Comfortable, clean, quiet with beautiful grounds. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Dog friendly!  One of our go to places when we are passing through.This hotel was very nice and I loved every minute of it, EXCEPT one small thing. The picture on their official website of the pool uses EXTREME measures to make the pool look much bigger than it really is. I was looking forward to swimming some laps and having a good time. When we got out to the pool it was the smallest little pool I've ever seen for a hotel rated with this star. While it was clean it was still like urghhh so small. The biggest perk was the hot tub it was really nice.The location of this hotel made everything perfect. It appears to be in a newer area that is kept up very well. There are lots of restaurants to choose from and a movie theater in walking distance. The hotel is right down the street from the St. Johns Town center if you enjoy shopping. 5 min drive. The hotel is situated right by a small lake and also in a business park. Everything felt safe.Customer service was great no issues. Housekeeping mistakenly threw our entire pizza away. We went to the front desk to tell them about the situation and they reimbursed us right on the spot which was exceptional customer service. Also, since we did have left over foods from some of our restaurant's they kindly went to heat up our food in the kitchen which was nice, since no microwaves are in the rooms.Not to mention this hotel has hardwood floors which makes the room appear to be much cleaner than nasty carpet eww. They also have big showers which was a plus! The bed and pillows were very comfortable.  I'd DEF go back if I visited Jckville again.What a great place at an awesome price. The rooms and  hotel  are modern looking and tidy, with  great eye appeal around the grounds. Had breakfast before we left and it was top notch. Get  breakfast coupons included  in the room fee because it is a little  pricey. ...but good eats.I'm torn with this hotel because I absolutely love it. It's better than any hotel I've ever stayed at. It is in a prime location, is quiet, clean, and comfortable. The first night I was there they accidentally charged me $385 extra and the second night they charged me $114 extra on top of the normal cost for 2 nights. I literally begged the front desk for a call back from a manager as reassurance that it wouldn't happen again, because I really wanted to come back but never received the call they promised. If you do stay here, I recommend you double check your account after your stay. I wish I could say I was coming back because I loved the hotel but I can't because I don't trust them.Hotel was lovely. Very clean and comfortable. Stayed a night for a concert that was in Jacksonville. Shower was amazing. Very much enjoyed our stay.Great location near a lot of eating & shopping spots and located next to a lake that's so serene especially at night! There are a few bars located within walking distance of this hotel which is plus if u wanna get your drink on then walk back. Check in was soooo easy and we were able to check in early. We requested a room away from elevator and on highest floor in which they accommodated, the staff were really friendly but my favorite part is the hotel bar! Andy was an outstanding bartender who engaged with every drinker in conversation and superb drink making skills.A lovely hotel on the outskirts of Jacksonville proper. It is situated in a quaint little restaurants and shops strip called Tapestry Park. The hotel itself is on the end of the block overlooking a lake and other hotels nearby. The grounds are well kept, the lobby is colorful, and service at check-in was very friendly and efficient. The room is tastefully decorated and modern touches are in every detail. Lastly, room service and free wifi (my two favorite amenities) are also offered at the Hotel Indigo. Very solid place!I have had several stays with Hotel Indigo while in Jacksonville and the experiences have been subpar to say the least. The beds are extremely small, the showers are huge but have trace amounts of mold that is visible, and the staff seem unbothered and at some points were down right rude. Obviously they don't honor late check outs like most hotels, I was NOT feeling well and was hoping to get an extra hour or two in bed before departing and was denied. When I called the front desk I was told "she had to ask the maid service and get approval." I have stayed at many hotels, five star included, and NEVER EVER heard of anyone having to check with the maid for a late check out. The front desk then returned and offered NOON as a late check out as if NOON wasn't their regular check out time. I'm in and out of Jacksonville often for business and pleasure and Hotel Indigo will NOT be an option for me moving forward...
review_content_20: I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Indigo. There was a combo of things that made the overall stay explained by category below. Like previous Yelpers - they were pretty much spot on with their assessment and now here is my $0.02Venue: Located in a community, village type neighborhood. If you from or live in Atlanta, it is similar to the West Village as far as setup or Lindbergh Station. It is surrounded by shops, restaurants within the community. There's a small lake right behind the hotel which is gorgeous to walk along on a nice spring/ summer day. FREE Parking and plenty of it in the back. The neighborhood is in a quiet corporate park and seems very safe at night in SE Jacksonville.Decor: When you first walk into the lobby, you notice the different color furniture, the walls, the paintings. I actually liked it. I found it unique. I found it kind of different and trendy. Had no issues with it. The actual hotel room was hardwood floors, quite comfortable bed to sleep on, flat screen tv, huge shower. The room was comfortable.Service: The bartenders, room service & cook was pretty much awesome. Environment: Quiet, peaceful, just the way I lke it.Food: They have cheap happy hour drinks. They will try to be stingy on the liquor but ask for more and tip when appropriate. The breakfast served, go for the breakfast quesadillas. If you are a cheese feen like me, add feta cheese to the quesadillas, quite delicious.Prices: Hotel Price seemed to be spot on for what you were getting. The room service prices was actually great itself, no complaints. Breakfast and lunch items at or under $10Huge Pros: Gang of restaurants right near by. The Jacksonville Beaches are a straight shot down the road. There's a movie theatre within 1 minute drive up the road on the service street without getting on the main road. Downtown is about 10 minutes away without getting on major interstate. Very easy to get to and most importantly--safe neighborhood. In addition, management was very attentive when having issue with A/C unit. Came up right away to explain the problem to make me comfortable of the issue & solution.Debbie Downers: This is reaching but the fitness center is just a couple of treadmills. The pool was cold. That is because the shade from the building blocked off any sun light that hits the back area where the pool and patio is located.Conclusion: If I was to visit Jacksonville at a good price, don't want to pay a huge amount of money on a room and don't want to be located to downtown, this is my new go to hotel when staying in the 904.Overall: B+We travel travel to Jacksonville at least twice a month to visit a sick family member. We usually stay at her house, but it's old, small and not very comfortable, so I put out for a hotel this time. Aaaaaahhhhhhhhh! What a breath of fresh air! Although we were staying for one night, it was worth the money to be in a clean, modern and very comfortable room. This was the first time I was able to completely relax during my stay in Jacksonville.The staff were great; very friendly and check-in was a breeze. Didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food.There really isn't much to see in this part of town, but it is really cute and has plenty of restaurants and a movie theatre within waking distance. Also, if you're a fan of shopping, and eating, you'll be happy to know that St. Johns Town Center is only a few minutes away!Hotel Indigo is pet friendly. I'm assuming that's why the rooms have hardwood floors, which I like much more than carpet.Two points of disappointment - very small gym, and the pool area is shaded by the building which means no sun bathing.You will love this hotel. It's hip, vibrant, and clean. Free parking, cute lake and my doggie loved it! We'll be back.This place rocks! It is very modern and clean - it is always full so book early! It's the best business park hotel I've ever stayed at and they were ranked in the top hotels for the whole chain! You won't regret it!Check in at 3pm or later, insane. I never heard of this in a hotel in my life. For sure I will not be coming back here any time soon.Service is GREAT. Rooms are clean and modern. Bedding is soft and comfortable. No issues whatsoever. Watch the room price which varies day to day even if you are staying for several days in a row.Breakfast package - a true breakfast is not given. You will receive a $10 voucher for breakfast. Juice & typical breakfast will cost you $12-15 plus tax and tip so be prepared for pay a few $ for breakfast.We stayed on the 5th floor (water side) and it was incredible! Beautiful rooms, awesome open shower. Really enjoyed our room and I really liked how the floors were hardwood (nice and clean!). The staff are super nice and friendly. Would def recommend staying here!!!Upon entering this place I smelled some rank sewer fumes. Not joking. The next day it was gone so I can only assume they were having some issues that one day. That being said, the hotel is just fine. It's owned by Holiday Inn but it's a different style hotel and much likened to a newer contemporary style like Alot and the like.I was put in a handicapped room and to be honest I didn't think it was a big deal until I got in there. A shower was not easily achieved if you can imagine and the bed was nearly on the floor. Not really sure why I was given this room b/c the place looked 40% empty.Front desk was quick and polite so that was a plus. This hotel is near some very nice places to eat as well (walking distance).The Indigo is amazing & instantly became my favorite new hotel! The price was right ($79/night on hotels.com), service was excellent, and some other great things I'll list below:AREA. Okay, the Indigo is in the Southside (a JAX neighborhood filled with business parks), but it is in a town center like area within the business park with restaurants and little shops. Take note that most of the restaurants are closed on Sundays as we found out. The Seven Bridges Brewery & Grill is within walking distance and was open on Sunday, and had excellent beer (try the sampler!). The St. Johns shopping area is only a couple of miles away. It is an outdoor/open air mall, with fun restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, etc.) and good shopping. The hotel is maybe 15-20 minutes from both the beaches, and downtown Jacksonville.HOTEL. It is beautiful! It is only 3 years old and feels brand new. The lobby is cool and the bar/seating area when you walk in has a good vibe. The rooms are the best! They have hardwood (laminate) floors throughout, and the rooms are modern but cozy. There is a frosted glass partition when you walk in which separates the entryway from the sleeping area, which is nice - the layout of the room is a nice variation from the typical standard hotel room. I love when hotels have washable sheets as the duvet because you know they're washed after every guest. The beds and pillows were super comfortable. Love the Aveda bath products, Keurig coffee, and spa like bathroom. Here is the best part. When I booked online thru Hotels.com, I opted in for the $5 breakfast buffet (for 2 guests was only $5 total, bringing the room charge to $84). When we checked in they gave us two breakfast vouchers for $10 each! There is no breakfast buffet, but you can use these vouchers at the cafe for breakfast OR for ROOM SERVICE. So, we had $20 to put towards room service breakfast. The food was AMAZING and arrived within 20 minutes!With the free parking, free wi-fi, and breakfast vouchers this is hands down the best deal in town AND an awesome hotel. I wish there was an Indigo in every town I traveled to.My first stay here at Hotel Indigo and I am impressed! Great location, cute mini "town center" and the staff is every friendly and efficient. I am in town because a family member is in the hospital and the bright colors and beautiful decor of the hotel have lifted my spirits!Friendly staff, attractive hotel and room, and a good location for walking/dining (especially during heavy rain, as when I was in town.) My one 'nit' has to do with the closet in my room (418) which was designed into a corner, making it difficult to access. However, that detail is easy to overlook when everything else is good, and that it was at the Hotel Indigo.Unloading my car while five people smoked under the awning in front of the hotel was less than welcoming. Check in made almost impossible by the 50 people standing around the front desk talking. I guarantee you I am not exaggerating the number. Having some sort of event in the lobby with no regard for guests or fire code. Upstairs in my room - barking dog next-door. Bathroom smells like the sewer is backed up. Went downstairs to inform the front desk about the bathroom and the dog. It was so loud the front desk person could not hear me. All she heard was dog and proceeded to tell me they are a pet friendly hotel. I think that's great, I just don't want the dog next-door barking. Tried again to explain about the bathroom. She just looked at me like I was a crazy person. Went back to my room and closed the bathroom door. The next morning when I told the person at the front desk about the bathroom she didn't apologize or say I'm so sorry what can I do to help she simply stated 'oh you're the lady who complained last night'. Really? Does customer service even come up in your training? It just leads me to believe they view the business traveler as one and done. No need to impress because you'll never see them again. Very bad business.If all I had to do was look at the Hotel Indigo and it's rooms I'd give it 5 stars. Once I got over it being pretty and actually started using it as a hotel room I think I was disappointed. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed. The wood floors, good size desk with easy to reach outlets, comfy chair and ottoman, large bathroom with a big walk in shower, single cup coffee machine, very nice decor, and a few other appointments were impressive. But wood floors are cold in the morning, and you can hear the people above you easier. The walk in shower was pretty, but had no door and therefore was a tad drafty, the floor of the shower was also quite slick when wet. The towel hook outside the shower was installed upside down, so your towel just kinda slides right off it. Yes it may look nice to put a wooden bench in the middle of the shower with the floor mat folded on it and the tiny bottles of shampoo and conditioner sitting on it. But now I have to walk into the shower, move the bench, put the floor mat down, move the tiny bottles. I know this doesn't sound like that big of a deal, but I'd rather not have to "get ready" to take a shower. The towels are housed under the bathroom sink, so make sure you think about that before getting into the shower too. And seriously, who the hell is going to sit on the wooden bench in a hotel shower?? Free wi-fi sounds like a fantastic deal too. Especially if you're considering working in your room after a day of meetings. But, you'll have to call the help line and wait for them to call you back if you want to connect. I talked to two other guests who had the same experience. Once you do connect, it's painfully slow. For my company's rate of $99 a night, it was an ok place to stay. If I were paying the hotel's rack rate of $135 for the same nights I would be annoyed.Wow!! We paid a little over $100 for our one bed room and that was the least we paid for a room our entire nine state road trip. When we first got to our room we called the front desk to make sure there wasn't a mistake. The room looked and felt like a $400 a night room to us, everything was brand new looking and feeling. It was very modern and stylish with a great view of a lake. We couldn't believe it was only $100 after we had paid $130 for a dump in St. Augustine just a half hour away. This was the nicest hotel my girlfriend and I had every stayed at, hands down.I'm picky and high-maintenance when I stay at hotels; I travel to Jacksonville at least every three months when I have appts at Mayo Clinic. Hotel Indigo was THE best in its class, especially the customer service, the location, not to mention the ambiance of staying in a modern-style hotel. One shouldn't avoid this hotel if modern design isn't their cup of tea. Trust me, you will leave your stay with a smile on your face. I have a few illnesses (explains the Mayo comment,) and require a room located in a VERY quiet location and Late Check Out. I'm a Priority Club member, but that doesn't guarantee my requests, especially if the place is booked. This hotel is a bit out of my price range at the time, but through the PC, found a unbelievable deal. Assuming the deal was open to all PC members, I didn't think I'd get what I requested as the hotel was completely booked, or so it seemed.Upon my arrival, the lobby wasn't crazy or loud. I felt calm and stress melt away. At check-in, the clerk greeted me right away. I didn't mention my requests, feeling that it would make me look like a cheapskate as the price I paid was next to nothing. Immediately, upon seeing where my room was located, I was shocked. The most quiet room is usually the upper levels, all the way at the end, on a side not facing a busy highway. That's exactly what I received and more. Oh, I booked the room two days before my arrival, so I was grateful. The very top floor all the way at the end, with a view of the lake. Stunning.Reasons to stay at Hotel Indigo: Friendliest hotel staff I've personally encountered. Especially housekeeping!Hardwood floors. Cleanliness. Location: in the middle of a quiet, quaint area by nice businesses, minutes from St. John's Town Center outdoor mallFood: Room Service and meals at the lounge are comparable to restaurants, delicious food and giant portions. From the towels to the awesome shower head, the peace and quiet, blissful bed and pillows, Hotel Indigo is worth every penny. I stayed in that location because I wanted to go to the mall nearby, but instead, never left the room.Great place for company eventsThis is a very nice, new hotel with friendly staff. Easy check in with ample parking. Nice variety of places to eat within walking distance. Love the hardwood floors, comfortable bed, bath and products. Allows pets with only a $25 dollar fee. Rates are very reasonable for quality of room and location. We will definitely stay here again when passing through Jacksonville.A nice lively hotel that served our needs in terms of affordability, cleanliness, and something with a contemporary vibe. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. They were able to meet our request for a late checkout (albeit only half an hour later than standard checkout @12pm). The room was modern with nice wood floors and a great modern floral mural that I believe is standardized across all rooms. Only gripe was the wood floors seemed clammy and damp. Otherwise a great hotel that I may also consider for business trips!Loud loud loud last night. Bring ear plugs. The floors are wood laminate and sound traces right through them. Good atmosphere in the lobby but not a good nights sleep.I do not give high fives ever!!!! So believe me when i say " this is a nice place". Decor, neighborhood, staff, value... You get it all!!! Everything right in a little village. Sweet!!! Peace out.I loved this hotel and I am picky. Great service, beautiful LARGE rooms, great little pool with jacuzzi. I would definitely stay here again. Super comfortable and clean bed with soft pillows. Quiet too.
review_content_40: Clean hardwood floors. Very affordable. Colorful decor. Comfortable beds. Plenty of restaurants and shops around, some of them within walking distance. Would definitely stay again.Great experience during my stay. New construction and friendly staff.Great location for restaurants and shopping.Awesome hotel. Great decor and everything is spotless!  Close to shopping and nice restaurants. Lots of limos around at night.This is the BEST Hotel Indigo that I've ever stayed at. It is brand spankin' new, and so gorgeous!This adds to our Hotel Indigo collection which includes San Antonio, Nashville, & Atlanta.Love the brand!This hotel was nice--brand spanking new!With hardwood floorsand down comforters too.And the price wasn't bad(I added the fifth star for that),and they get bonus pointsfor letting me bring my cat!Well located near lots of food options for travelers.Hey Folks, if you like modern type hotels this is the place for you. Uber pet friendly. Clean inside and out. kinda far from downtown but taxi ride away. I'll stay there againNice trendy hotel with decent restaurant. Unique and fairly healthy choices.

review_content: I stayed here this week while on a business trip. I understand that it has been going through a remodeling. Upon my arrival it looks like it is almost done.I found the property to be in good shape. The hotel is of an atrium design however I was put in a room in the south wing. My suites was nice and everything in order. The fitness room and pool looked nice. Front desk check was courteous and friendly. Breakfast was typical Embassy Suites which means good.I enjoyed my stay here and can say this property delivers what you should expect from Embassy Suites. I would be happy to stay here again.We arrived for check-in at 6 P.M. on a Sunday evening.  After waiting 20 minutes for a front desk attendant, we weren't met with a friendly greeting.  It appeared that the front desk clerk hadn't slept in weeks.  We gave him our relevant information and were told that there were no clean rooms available.  I had to scratch my head as it was 6 P.M. and the hotel's stated check in was 3 P.M.  We were then told that there was a mixup with the room types and our requested 2 queen beds in the room was not available.  I stated to the clerk that this was unacceptable based upon the number of guests sleeping in the room.  He told us to give him 15 minutes and he would try to find another room.  We went to the complimentary evening manager's reception for some drinks and appetizers.  What a mistake.  We have no clue how they consider this a reception.  The drink selection was extremely limited and the food consisted of a bowl of pretzels which was crawling with bugs.  The reception should be a complete embarrassment to the hotel.  After waiting 15 minutes and battling the bugs for the pretzels, we went back to the front desk to check on our room.  We were told the room was ready.  We then proceeded into a filthy elevator up to the second floor.  The elevator doors opened to a hallway filled with dirty dishes and garbage all over the place.  We dodged the plates and garbage to get to the room.  After opening the room door, we discovered a room with the wrong bedding.  We then proceeded back down to the front desk and requested to speak to a manager.  The manager informed us that the majority of the housekeeping staff called in sick and that was the reason for the late check in.  She apologized and said that she could not find us a room.  We stated that the hotel should provide two complimentary rooms to solve the bedding issue and compensate us for the hassle.  She apologized again and agreed.  We then went back into the filthy elevators and proceeded to two new rooms.  When we opened the door to one of the rooms, the pillows were thrown all over the place with no pillow cases.  We called down to the front desk and they stated that it would be taken care of.Despite the hotel's attempt at making up for it's deficiencies by not charging us for the rooms, I would steer clear of this business.
