This is an Embassy Suites and there is an expectation for better service and a much better product.As I understand it, the hotel is nearly finished with a $12 million renovation. To be fair, I will start with this disclaimer: I would have rated it with 4 stars except for the following. 1. Outdated and slow elevators. 2. Horrible bartender working at the restaurant. (Worst old fashion I'd ever tasted)3. In-room coffee maker didn't work4. New glass shower door leaked water all over the floor soaking the bath-mat. Now for the good stuff:The room was really nice. I stayed in a 2 room suite with a balcony. The room included a lounging area and business nook, as well as a kitchenette and mini-fridge.  The bedroom was equally as nice and the bed was extremely comfortable. The rooms look nothing like the pictures from years ago. I will add updated pictures from my next stay here. That's right, I'll stay here again...just won't enjoy any adult beverages here.The rooms are comfortable and clean. But I would give them 5 stars for Excellent customer service! Housekeeping was very nice, the free breakfast was great...Rebecca, the breakfast chef was very friendly and makes a mean omelet and Stephen, the General Manager was very attentive, and friendly to every one. He even jumped our car after we ran the battery down overnight.  Great job!I would give this hotel a much higher rating if the AC in our room had worked.  We were here for a convention and other people said their AC worked fine and others said their room was hot.  Ours was not cool.  I've stayed at other Embassy Suites properties that were far superior to this property.  Nightly bar and snacks were nice.  Breakfast was not overly tasty.All the other bad reviews are sadly true.  It's loud, outdated, overcrowded and dirty.  Worse than that, management doesn't seem to care.  They had a wedding reception going on there but not enough space to host events.  Halls were crowded with rowdy annoying guests.  The pool was filthy and small.  When we complained, management asked us what we wanted them to do about it!  We were told to deal with it.  We told them to keep their room.  We stayed at another nearby chain and much happier.  I'm stunned Hilton allows this place to call itself an Embassy Suites.  Sad, sad, sad.I pose these questions:1) Should a hotel's website indicate that extensive renovation is underway?2) Should the hotel close while said renovations occur?3) Should the hotel offer financial incentive, i.e. discounted rates, to those who stay?Answers: yes, yes and yes.  (Though -- to embellish question 2 -- a shut-down isn't realistic and would cause employees financial hardship.)If you read this review before booking reservations, I suggest you call to determine if the renovation is complete.  When we were there, the path on the main floor, from reception to dining room/bar was in essence a construction site, and dreadfully cold.  Drilling, pounding and other such noises start before 9 a.m. and continue till dinnertime.  They hadn't  worked out plumbing kinks and  throughout the night, we'd hear high pitched squeals.  (No!  Not the neighbors!!  The plumbing!!!)On a positive note, when renovation is complete, the hotel is bound to be beautiful. And from our experience, Embassy Suites generally deliver.  But in November?  Caveat emptor.I'm giving them one star since zero stars isn't an option. This is the worst Hilton property I have ever stayed at. It stared at check in with an unfriendly front desk person. I'm diamond with Hilton so I should have received bottled water and snacks - got nothing. Gave her the benefit of the doubt thinking it was already in the room. nope it wasn't and when I called down it was like I was lying. Got in the room and it was very warm and the shower was dripping. Cranked the air down and it was still warm. Called down - she said there was a problem but they have fixed it so it should be better soon. Took til about 3am to finally get cooler - never cold. And the air conditioner sounds like a 747.And the dripping water? All night long. It's like some kind of Chinese water torture. The Saturday morning breakfast doesn't start til 7:30am and the line is huge because of course people are hungry. The place isn't even clean. I'm telling you I would rather be camping than stay at this hotel again.I came here before my physical prior to enlisting in the Navy and I had a pretty great stay. They are undergoing renovation, CLEARLY, because one of the elevators was blocked and there's a whole lot of wood walls everywhere. There's a restaurant, small gym (with lots of equipment surprisingly), and I believe a bar on the first floor. Not to mention a neat atrium with a huge area filled with tables, chairs, and benches for people to sit. The people there were very friendly and nice, the rooms were spacious and clean (I stayed with a roommated in a room with 2 beds, a kitchen, and living area). So really, can't complain.Staying open during major renovations may not hurt the bottom line of this location financially.  Nevertheless, I'm sure the reputation of this location will take quite a hit for some time to come.Visited this location as part of a professional training.  I was very afraid of what I might find, having not read the reviews until the day before my arrival.  (As a result, I'd even looked up rooms at surrounding hotels in case I'd have to leave.)When I arrived, while it was less bad than I anticipated, it was still pretty bad.  Just imagine street construction in an enclosed hotel.  Yes, that bad.  As I checked in (as well as throughout the day during my stay, which included a great deal during the on-site training), an unseen drill sounded like someone was trying to get to the middle of the earth.  It was kinda silly, really, considering that people pay to stay in hotels for the purposes of being comfortable during their stay.   Not utterly annoyed.  Granted, construction occurs only between the hours of 9am-6pm, but the dust, disarray and alarms are 24/7.It's Mid-March and, apparently, the organizers of the training had been assured by management that these long-lasting renovations would have been completed by now.  They were not.  They will not be for a while either.  The entire atrium is less than half-complete and from what I could see (& thanks to my HGTV-given expertise), a lot of drywall remains to be put up.It's a shame to leave this hotel with such an impression, given that the rooms look gorgeous on the inside.  But it's hard to appreciate that when fire alarms are going off all throughout the day, you're bumping into construction workers constantly, paint dust (it's a thing) & concrete dust is flying everywhere.  By the way, dust and the overall smell of construction lives in the nice new carpets in the rooms after being tracked all through the hotel.  Pros: Huge suites w/ microwave & fridge as well as separated living area and bedrooms.  Many things appear to be upgraded, including tv's, interior furniture & carpeting.  Pleasant staff at check-in, decent on-site restaurant, great hot and cold food complimentary breakfast w/ omelette station, evening complimentary reception with drinks and snacks.(Huge) Cons: Indoor construction with dusty facilities and ridiculous amounts of noise.Cons:  Stiff beds with small, bumpy pillows.Great staff and customer service.  Everyone had a smile and went out of their way to make this trip special.  The evening manager and reception bartender stood out!  I will definitely stay here again.My wife and I stayed at this Embassy Suites 12-15 June 2015 while visiting the Jacksonville, Florida area.  I am a Hilton Honors member and we always try to stay at Embassy Suites due to the exceptional accommodations and service we normally receive.  We did not have a good experience at this hotel.  As soon as we checked in we were told there was a large softball group at the hotel and that it would be a busy weekend.  The softball group seemed to be the hotel's justification for most of the issues we encountered.Some of this was not the hotel's fault, as renovations were taking place and over half of the parking lot was off limits.  We parked at an adjacent parking lot, which was not a major deal, but there were no signs indicating that it was allowed to park at the other business and this was never expressed at check in.  We drove around the limited spaces in Embassy Suites' parking lot for quite some time waiting for someone to leave before I went and asked the front desk who then said we  are allowed to park in the adjacent business' parking lot without being towed.  The front desk said that because of the number of guests with the softball group, that the parking lot was at overfull capacity.Housekeeping was horrible at this location.  We were gone from our room for an entire day, and upon returning at approximately 6pm, nothing had been touched in our room.  My wife called the front desk to inquire about housekeeping missing our room.  She was told that it was probably missed because of the large softball group that was staying at the hotel. They then indicated that they would send someone right up.  After a short while a housekeeper showed up and asked me what the problem was.  I indicated that our room had been missed.  She then asked what I needed?  I again said that the room had not been cleaned.  She asked if I needed towels.  I said that we did, but rather than address my comment about the room not being cleaned she handed me a stack of towels.  I asked if the trash could be taken from the room.  She handed me a garbage bag for me to exchange with the trash that was in the receptacle.  Not that I am above removing trash from my room, but the attitude presented was as if I was putting her out to have her to come to our room regarding a job that was never done in the first place.I didn't address anything to the front desk.  I just dismissed this as everyone has a bad day and maybe today was the housekeepers bad day.My wife and I then went to the manager's reception and this is where the line was drawn.  While visiting at a table, someone from the upper balconies threw an M&M at our table and nearly hit my wife in the face.  I told my wife that we were going to talk to the manager and cancel the rest of our stay and go somewhere else.We spoke with the manager, who was very apologetic but understood our reasons for wanting to leave.  She credited our room and said that she hoped we would give them another chance in the future, and that things weren't normally like this.  It was suggested that possibly some kids from the large softball group may have been responsible for throwing the M&M.We then went to get our bags from our room and call some other hotels to book a stay.  Every hotel that we called was full due to a large Country Music Festival that was being held at Everbank Field.  We decided to finish our stay at Embassy Suites due to this reason.  The hotel manager was kind enough to mail us a voucher for a free night's stay so that we would give this hotel another chance.  We decided to give it another chance, as we have never had bad experiences at any other Embassy Suites that we have stayed at other than this one, so maybe this was just an off weekend for this location. The voucher we received indicates that it is for a free weekend night's stay.  We plan to be in the Jacksonville area again in the near future and will need lodging for four nights.  I called the reservations desk for the Jacksonville Embassy Suites to find out if they would honor the voucher on a weeknight rather than a weekend night.  They said they could not do this.  I said, "So you are telling me that if your hotel is not fully booked, you would not honor a one night voucher on a weeknight, even though you will have a paying customer for three other nights?"  They said this was correct.  I said "I will book my stay elsewhere then."  At this point they went to verify this through a supervisor.  I was placed on hold shortly and upon their return, they confirmed that even if the hotel is not fully booked, they were willing to lose a paying customer for three nights because they would not honor the voucher that was sent to us to cover the fourth night.  In my opinion, this is a very strange and backwards business practice.  With this being said, it doesn't look like this hotel will be getting the second chance that the manager asked of us.We are DIAMOND MEMBERS of the Hilton honors group, with that being said, we stay at many hilton properties all over the world and have never seen a embassy suite ran or managed as poorly as this one. Renovations look like they are still taking place almost a year after what I have read already in the comments, which is absolutely ridiculous during tourist season.Cleaning was worst I have ever seen, I placed our extra blankets in the closet so we did not have to go get them again..(our phone did not work to call the desk) and the cleaning staff actually had the nerve to take them!!! It took them 3 days to get back to us on why our phine was put of service, due to renovations, go figure!! Elevators were slowest I have ever seen, so we took the stairs only to find a sign, ON THE FIRE ESCAPE STAIRS I MIND YOU, to read do not enter construction!! Very u safe!!I will never stay at this embassy suites again!! If there were minus stars they would get a minus 5!!! Very unsatisfiedI arrived to learn that I would be shuttled between rooms during my stay due to renovations.  OK, I can live with that, especially since the conference I was attending was being held at the hotel.The room was damp and dank, with the signature crappy Embassy Suites ventilation.  A veritable Petri dish for Legionnaires' Diesase.  Oh, well, I've stayed in enough Embassy Suites properties that I'm used to their strange and inherently unhealthy HVAC systems.  Room decor of rust and yellow stripes was straight out of an early '70s porno.  The bed was lumpy and dingy with 3 tiny lumpy and dingy pillows that would only be suitable for a dog to sleep on, as long as the dog was small and not prized.  Exhausted, I nodded off, swaddled in stagnant dingyness.The fire alarm first sounded around 0445.  It shut down momentarily, but then continued again for another 15 minutes, rousting the entire hotel into the parking lot.  According to some conversations I overheard, it happens e-v-e-r-y night.  Shouldn't the Jacksonville Fire Marshall have something to say about this?Breakfast was decent and cheerily served.  In fact, the entire staff, from breakfast to front desk was top notch.I attended the conference, but it was a bust.  Poor sound reinforcment equipment coupled with the sounds of renovation made it difficult to participate.I know when to fold a losing hand.  I checked out at noon, never to return.Embassy Suites Jacksonville - Baymeadows is a pox on the Embassy Suites brand.STAY AWAY!Haven't been to Jacksonville on business in a while.  As a loyal Hilton customer, Embassy Suites are usually pretty decent and this one is close to my office.  But this place should really be closed during renovations!  The room isn't all that bad, seems to have been renovated with some new things intermixed with some older things.  But there's a terrible smell throughout the place which I'm guessing is coming from the bright and shiny floor throughout the lobby and atrium.  Looks like some kind of sealer/polish they've put down on the tile.  You can see the difference between the tile floor and the tile on the steps.  It absolutely stinks!  To the point I thought about changing hotels tonight but it's late and I'm tired.  I'll definitely stay somewhere else tomorrow night.  Here's to hoping I don't wake up with a terrible headache.Update the next morning...Looks like housekeeping is questionable as well.  Someone else's hair in the shower, someone had a drink and roasted peanuts which was left in a very prominent garbage can, and one of the hand towels in the bathroom had clearly been used for something.  I'm out of here, never to return.I will not be returning. Tom Getman the director of operations is a nasty racist individual who uses his authority to treat people bad. He made comments to my guest as if he had a problem with black people. If you have stayed there recently you know the site is under construction He stated to my guest "we have new things here and we want to keep it that way" as if my guest were going to tear up the place. there were soft ball teams wedding partys just alot going on and i really believe we were singled out. TOM GETMAN DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS NEEDS TO BE DEMOTED!TOM GETMAN @ EMBASSY SUITES BAYMEADOWS RD JAX FL NEEDS TO DEALT WITH....The hotel should be closed during renovations. This place is old, musty & dusty.During a Girl's Weekend, 4 of us traveled 4 hours to find this hotel was very disappointing & does not fit our prior Embassy experience. We switched rooms 3 times. The 1st room smelled old & musty. The white comforters had obviously not been changed in months as there was red lipstick, food and daily handling stains on both beds when we folded back to check the sheets. There was what looked like dried splattered blood on the wall & door of the bedroom. The bathroom ceiling had attempted to be patched. When I asked the front desk how often they changed the linen, the response was "im not sure about this location, but it should be after every guest".We were upgraded to the "Executive Suite". After what seemed like a 10 minute walk through hard hat construction area to the otherside of the building, the room key did not work. Back we go to the front desk. It was suggested we use the house phone....the old yellowed, what was ivory gadget on the wall? The 2nd room was much smaller than requested, smelled of cigarettes and appeared clean until we looked up at the bathroom ceiling....mold!! I asked an unhappy looking staff in the hall how old was this hotel. His response "it should be brand new by January."After apologies and offered 1/2 off the stay, we were met by a staff member to open & inspect room 3. Although dark & still musty, it passed our 1night stay inspection. After we sprayed and used disinfecting wipes, lit a candle, we were ready to get our weekend started.  After a long evening of food & fun, we were awoken at 7am to a fire alarm. Startled, searching for our bras, we made our way to the door, towards the exit next to our room, down a flight of stairs, which led us nowhere. Back up the stairs we go towards another exit....but wait the elevators are working? WTH. So we load the 1 working elevator towards the door...the alarm stops. A hour later the alarm goes off and again 30 minutes later and once more 30 minutes later for the road. If it wasn't for the other ladies that wanted to stay in the area, didnt want the hassle of locating another hotel suite for 4 with Pittsburgh Steelers fans in town, I definitely would have found another hotel. Not even the free cocktails, free breakfast or $50 stay made this worth it. The dry water feature in the atrium has the potential to be nice though.Unfortunately, we stayed at this hotel the week of November 10 at the suggestion of our clients as the proximity to their office was desirable. I was originally put in a room back in the "executive building" far away from the rest of my team, but decided to check it out before requesting to move. This back building is a hike from the rest of the hotel and you must go through a construction zone past all of the working and not working/smoking workers to get there. This building obviously hasn't been updated in a very long time and felt more like a retirement home/rehab facility than a hotel. The beds are very low to the ground, the cabinetry and furniture was very worn and dusty - not at all what I would expect from this class of hotel. After requesting to be moved to a room in the main building, I was very happy to find that my new room had recently been refurbished and while it still smelled of paint/chemicals, it was much better than the alternative. As for the rest of the main building, the lobby is very dusty and there are makeshift ramps and boarded up sections. After all of this, I really could have dealt with it, understanding that all that is part of the process of renovation...then I got sick. I came back to the hotel around noon on Wednesday feeling like death, fever, vomiting, etc... and just wanted to sleep. However, the construction was going on directly above or below (not sure which) my room. The noise was such that I was unable to sleep even with earplugs and my coworker who was attempting to speak to a coworker on the phone had to actually leave the building and go outside. I called the front desk and after being asked to hold three times, I asked if there was any possible way the workers could work on another room that wasn't right next to me and while they did offer to see if they could move me, I was in no condition to pack up all my stuff and move rooms. The jackhammering that literally felt like it was going to come through my ceiling was not a pleasant thing to deal with at the time, but I understand that most people are not at the hotel during the day. If you plan to be, stay somewhere else. A few other things to mention...My coworker came back to her room around 5:30pm only to find there was a maid who was just beginning to clean her room. We had been gone since 8:00am that day.Depending on who checks you in, you'll get wildly different service. I left the hotel around 3am to catch an early flight and there was no attendant at the front desk, so I called the next week to ask for a receipt. When I mentioned why I needed it emailed, I was very promptly cut off and corrected and told that there was always someone at the front desk and I should have rung the bell if I needed something. All in all, the hotel is in no condition to provide a restful or productive stay and the staff really don't care much. You get what you get and you don't throw a fit....that's what I tell my 3 year old (but then again, they aren't paying $150/night to live in my house).Heavy renovation going on. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. It smells and it's not easy getting around the hotel.Right off the highway. Ok on weekdays absolutely never stay friday or Saturday night. This hotel becomes a kids party zone with each room having dozens of kids. This has happened to me three of the last four weekends. Forget the complimentary breakfast when the line is a dozen deep. on the weekdays despite the construction this place is ok and well located.
review_content_20: I stayed here for a work trip and survived.  As a loyal Hilton member, I chose this hotel as Embassy Suites tend to have more room and a decent free breakfast.  Hotel is pretty dated and run down. When I checked in, right when I opened the door of my room, a whaff of cigarette smoke/mustiness blew in my face.  I called the front desk to change rooms, and my second one was better.  Apparently they don't have smoking rooms, yet they don't  implement the no smoking rule or check to see if the room smells like smoke for other guests.  Gym was your typical hotel gym- small with only 2 treadmills and free weights.  Because I shared a rental, the location is near some places to eat.  There's a barbeque place called 4 Rivers Smokehouse which was decent.  Breakfast was alright.  I've had better at other Embassy Suites. The coffee was pretty horrible; very weak.  If I came back to Jacksonville, I probably wouldn't come back to this hotel.This hotel is the worst one I've ever been to, the renovations are still going on, the elevators are terrible, the quilt that was on my bed when I checked in was nasty with orange looking spots on it and long black hairs all over and I know they were not mine, so I call the front desk and they said they would bring me another one.. hours later and nothing so I call again, hours later and still nothing, finally I call again and at 10 at night they finally decide to bring the quilt but the new quilt they brought was disgusting as well so I didn't even bother calling again, I was over it! And don't even get me started on housekeeping, I had left the next morning to explore Jacksonville I left at 10am, I got back at 4-5pm and they still hadn't got to my room yet, I was fit to be tied, housekeeping was terrible, and the the pool area was a hot mess, the hot tub wasn't working and it was flooding the whole area! Chances are this hotel is independently owned because I highly doubt that the Embassy Suites chain would not have allowed this kind of nonsense, never again will I stay here and I'm making sure to let everyone I know NOT to stay here....horrible!I was in Jax for a week working, my boss picked this place. It is old and dated, had the option to play N64 through my TV. If your on the north side you will hear I-95 and Baymeadows most of the night. Beds were comfy, so it cannot be too bad. Managers happy hour was actually serving Shiner Bock so you don't lave to drink Bud/Miller light. Within walking distance is an Orlando favorite 4Rivers Smokehouse, but let's be honest, it's Jacksonville and you could throw a rock and find great BBQ. I was excited for a taste of home and no crazy line. When traffic is not aweful, easy access to I-95. And you are downtown rather quickly, again if traffic is cooperating.A bit disappointing.The atrium is nice although the water features were dry. The first attempts entering our room where frustrating until we discovered the door handle is broken and only works in one direction now. Hotel repair staff said a lot of the doors now do that and did not fix it.The first micro-fridge was leaking but was promptly replaced. The ceiling above the tub had obvious water damage and an active leak plugged by napkins. The pull out bed mattress is not recommended for use, even for children. Breakfast area had a wide variety and standard quality for free hotel breakfast. A positive. In case you missed it from their adds:  You have to pay extra for wifi. Staff was friendly and courteous. The staff indicated this hotel which is much in need of remodeling and repair will soon occur based on vacancies.Not the best of Embassy Suite can offer. Yes the hotel is dated. Furniture is dated.. Bath room is small and cramped... But the bed is comfy... Too bad for the pillow.. Not sure why thd pillow is so small. Breakfast is acceptable... But i do wish thd beacon is thicker.. Its so thin.. You dont feel it at all.We really enjoyed this place. The entrance was pretty bad ass. They had an open floor plan where all the rooms are around a big open area with tables to eat at and a gazebo. It was designed to look like you were "outside" when you inside. I like stuff like that. We booked on expedia and got one of the last rooms since we were there for the Jacksonville Bank Marathon. Our room was HUGE. It even had a 10 person conference table with chair which we didn't need, but was cool since we could lay our all our race stuff. There was also FREE breakfast (nothing fancy) and FREE Drinks during Happy Hour (house liquor). You can't beat the room and amenities for the price.That all being said, the rooms definitely need to be renovated. Nothing wrong with them, they are just due for a new look.This is a large hotel conveniently located off I95 for both business and family. Overall, a tired property in need of refresh, investment and improved maintenance.Pluses: Breakfast made to order; complimentary Happy Hour, 5:30 - 7:30; and Wi-Fi at the hotel that works well.Minuses: Dingy, no outdoor pool, very few balconies you can use, no luggage carts in the back of the hotel, and overall a tired property. As a frequent Hilton guest, this property needs renovation and better upkeep.Proof:  Double door lock failed to lock twice, and emergency escape instructions on back of door were for a different floor and different room. Really!The Hilton standards inspector must have seen nothing. He/she could referee wrestling.Tip:  Stay in the back of the hotel for more quiet.If you think this review with photos is useful, funny or cool, I'd appreciate ur feedback by clicking below.Yuck! I smelled mold in our room. My husband smelled saw dust. It's the kind of room you don't want to take off your socks in fear of what is hidden from the naked eye on the floor. The kind of place you question the top cover on your bed. Did I say yuck?Really? An Embassy Suites Hilton that offers no free wifi unless you are gold or diamond Hilton Honors?  In a mediocre part of Jax? Curt front desk staff?I travel about 80 nights a year, will not come back and recommend no one stay here. Oh yeah...it's a business hotel but breakfast doesn't start until 7:30am. Hilton is sliding fast on my charts.Outdated. Great prices. Paid 89 dollars on a Friday night on Easter weekend. Rooms were clean but old. Still can't beat the price with included breakfast buffet.Good place for business travelers and corporate events.  The staff is nice and helpful.Nice stay.  Clean room.What you expect from these chain hotels.I enjoyed the 5:30 - 7:00 Happy Hour.The Sangria was nice and helped put me to bed :-)The morning breakfast was perfect.I had my omelet made to order.Plenty of juices to choose from.A great way to start my mornings.One star off for not calling me for the requested "Wake Up Call".Good thing I'm not a good sleeper when traveling and had woken myself up anyways.I did take the tip to request a room at the new part of the hotel.The rooms were clean, but still dark.... cant' imagine what the older rooms look like.All in all a good stay at this conveniently located Embassy Suites.I was very unhappy and disappointed in this hotel.  My boyfriend and I was looking for a nice getaway place not far from Atlanta but near a beach to call our mini vacation spot and this was our first stop.  Based on this experience it will definitely be crossed off of our possible locations.  Upon checking in we're told that we qualified for an upgrade because I travel a lot and always stay at a Hilton brand hotel, when as soon as I open the door to our room I Thought I was at a Howard Johnson or Days Inn and not an Embassy Suites Hotel, it was that bad.  The furniture is outdated and poor in quality and the room smelled.  The carpet was dirty and the restroom didn't have enough towels for 2 people to shower.  We checked in early so we though we still had time for breakfast because at other Embassy's breakfast is served until 10:30, well this hotel stopped serving at 9:30am. So that was out!Later on that night we decided to try the manager's reception for cocktails and the drinks were awful and watered down, which was so unnecessary because they were already serving very cheap liqour to begin with and it made both of us sick. I have never had such poor service at an Embassy hotel and this hotel should just sell to a Ramada or Motel 6 because it is definitely not up to Embassy standards!!!!!!!!So we decided to just make the best of it because it was father's day weekend and we wanted to enjoy it.  Well that didn't happen either, we were up until 2am because some kids kept running down the halls and shaking handles then running away All night, we had to call the front desk 3 times.When we did finally check out and voice our concerns after all that they gave a $40 credit on a 3 day stay,  I guess they feel like that was doing us a favor, we Will Not Be Returning!!!!!!Stopped here on my way back home.  Seems like all Embassy Suites need some major updating.  This one clearly has seen it's hey day.  Rooms just felt dated and old.  Somewhat cheap.  Main lobby area and open area was very humid as if the A/C wasn't working.  Breakfast was nothing to write home about.  Best part was the free drinks.This hotel gets the job done. Happy hour from 530-730 is a nice perk. We stayed here for a week long business trip. There is a distinct difference in cleanliness and room quality between the old and new sections. Some of my colleagues were in the new section (7 floors) and I stayed in the old. Cleanliness was less than to be desired for a 90/ night hotel. Breakfast was pretty good with lots of variety. You have to pay 10/day for internet if you are not a Hilton rewards member. Bottom line is that If I was traveling to this area again, I'd look somewhere else.Checked in and had to change rooms 3 times at 1am. Rooms keep getting worse. From wet floor, leaking faucets, extremely noisy a/c ,bad smell, baby size pillow, etc etc you get the picture. Should have been given a full refund instead was offered 10,000 points, which help me how ?? I've stayed manyyyy times at Embassy around the world and this is the very worst. Excuse was construction, why don't they even mention that anywhere in the website so we can be informed? Either way what does construction have to do with offering a decent, odor free, adult size , leak proof  room? Disappointed beyond belief. Will be filing complaint with cooperate office .  Please don't stay there. You've been warned.This hotel is not up to the Hilton standards.  It looks grandiose when you walk in; they have good reception from 5:30 to 7:30 and a good breakfast as well in the morning.  The rooms however once you enter in are very dirty and look old.  It is right to say that they are similar to the ones you will find in Motel 8.  The hotel just seems very dull and depressing.  I will not be staying here again after my first visit.  The Wi Fi is free but only for HHonors Member or AT&T members, it is slow as well.  I would not recommend this hotel.Rooms are large - Staff at front desk is great except Blonde older women with accent- She is unfriendly, not very willing to help and I think has been there too long to understand that she is the 1st impression. On the other hand the rest of the desk staff cannot do enough to help and the manager was very friendly and helpful. Someone needs to have a talk with this women.Great lobby, food, happy hour etc...  Thanks for the serviceAffordable. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Friendly staff. Lots of amenities. Easily accessible. Abundant parking. All you can eat breakfast, which I made liberal use of. We had a major water leak in our room when we checked in. They were not as prompt to move us as I would have cared for, but did so upon request. My cousins wedding was here. Everything went quite well. I would stay here again, given the option.This place is dated to say the least, dirty broken old also describes it   Bad customer service even for diamond members.  Desk clerk just a kid.   Could be the night I got here but it was packed full of kids and noisy.  We didn't leave the room after we got in.  Deck was dirty. Bathroom put together with tape and rusty.  Think it is time to burn this place and rebuild.    Very disappointed in Hilton for this one.
review_content_40: Dirty and worn out, but at least the bed was comfortable and breakfast pretty good.  Not many choices in this part of Jax so this is the "best of the worst" in my opinion.Awful.  This once proud hotel doesn't look like it has been touched by a renovation in a decade.  The rates were cheap which seemed inviting for a family traveling through the area and, yes, it was generally pretty clean.  However, I'll start with the pull out bed which had no blanket and no extra pillows.  Required two separate calls to the front desk.  Each visit by someone took 20+ minutes (for what should have been stocked already).  The room shows signs of wear everywhere you look but the biggest debacle was the breakfast.  You couldn't be any cheaper with their breakfast.  At 8:30, they were out of bacon, sausage and fruit loops.  The orange juice was so watered down that I thought my son was messing around with me when he asked me to taste it (never trust a 10 year who says "eat this" or "smell this").  They also had no forks.  Every table in the breakfast area was covered with garbage from previous diners.  It was truly terrible.The good... Lovely & well maintained atrium and all suite hotel. Food and service at the Omaha Steakhouse was good. The bad. Rooms are a bit dated as is the building, staff is mostly young and seemingly inexperienced. We were there for a birthday party and the catering staff was not ready with the food that was ordered. The ceiling was leaking on the dance floor. The food and service at the breakfast buffet was awful. There was a slew of rowdy kids staying at the hotel and making a royal ruckus and mess of the place. Playing hide and seek across all levels and screaming and throwing food at each other. There were no parents or hotel staff attempting to reign in the little brats.  We would not stay here again and would not recommend this facility for events.I'll go back because the wine is better than the Residence Inn. Overall, it is hard to find a reliably clean, well-serviced hotel in this part of Jacksonville. They're all iffy. Why?Overall - very comfortable. Service in the free happy hour is really good.Sometimes the rooms and hallways are clean, sometimes not. Sometimes there are plenty of towels and washcloths; this time I had one washcloth (for 3 days) and no bathmat. Sometimes there is a packet to make coffee, sometimes only decaf.Rooms in the #15-#10 area are noisy-airconditioning and other hotel machinery is outside that area. E.g. Room 310, room 711 - too noisy to sleep well.Rooms on the street-side get noisy early, Baymeadows is a major thoroughfare,Rooms in the "executive" area at the back are different, but it was nice and QUIET back there. That's what I'll ask for again.This hotel is a stopping point for young men and women on their way to military service. They are not allowed to frequent the free happy hour, and have a separate dining area. They generally are reserved and keep to themselves. But sometimes the quality of the rooms reflects this audience.Great sushi delivered from Sushi House!!!Stayed at this hotel for a work event - big mistake! Customer service is poor, they never answer the phone at the front desk. They also charge $10 for wi-fi per day despite Hilton's advertising free wi-fi throughout their hotel chains. I should have read the reviews before selecting this hotel. First and last time I stay at this hotel.The worst embassy suites I have stayed in...no competition.We stayed in 3 ES properties to and from our vacation in Florida...and I'm pretty sure I won't be staying in one again unless it's the only option.  I counted in one pass through the atrium...3 family reunions...and a wedding.  The hallway outside the pool (same that you have to use to get to the elevator) was slick with water from the children running (and yelling) in and out of the pool area.   Worse, nobody from the hotel seemed to care that the rest of their guests wouldn't find this entertaining, there was no attempt to curb the behavior.  Maybe this is the new 'target client' for embassy suites.  If so, then message heard...we won't be back.The AC in the room would not cool the room down...even as I sit here writing this after a night in the room, it's still hot in here.  The bathroom has yellow growths on the ceiling, and something is wrong with the water.  It tastes and looks wrong.For families, the rooms only offer 2 doubles.  I assume that's because the bedroom area is too small to hold 2 queens, but even so that's substandard.  I haven't seen 2 doubles in a hotel room since I don't know when.  The minimum is 2 queens.Worst of all...i wasted 35,000 Hilton points on this dump.Nice and clean but for an embassy suites the walls are thin. You can hear the toilet flush in the room above you among other things.This is the loudest hotel I have ever stayed. I feel like I in a stadium.. Cant sleep.. closed the drapes and doors.. still If you are coming for business find another hotelCleanliness is bad and mgmt really doesn't care!!!  First time I stayed I found a hunk of mold that was about 2 inches in diameter floating in the water tank of coffee maker.  When I complained, they said they just got these coffee makers and they are still training their people to clean the water tank.  I understand mistakes happen so i stayed there again.  Guess what... stale water in the water tank of the coffee maker again.  I decided to run the coffee maker with no coffee grounds - bright yellow water.  When, I complained, it took 2 days to respond and when they did, they called to apologize that my room wasn't clean and for me to call them explain what wasn't clean about it.  I gave one star since I could have gotten sick and you don't mess up when it comes to what people eat or drink.

review_content: Stayed at the Omni for one night while in town for a concert on a Friday. I was drawn to this upscale establishment because of all that it offered. Location to the Veterans Stadium where the concert was. It is also close to the Landing area. Both are situated off the river. Next was the amenities that are provided. Restaurant, in room service, not a normal but awesome late check out option (5 p.m. checkout at a cost that was worth it). All the extras that you could want are selectable while making reservations online.I had non-smoking king suite. it was spacious and functional.  You get the typical creature comfort like a closet (with a safe, iron, iron boards, starch which was a plus, wood hangers and a laundry bag), a dresser that has a 32" TV atop of it, refrigerator that has a variety of assorted liquor shot size bottles and candy snacks (but you have to get a key for and pay for what you take), there's a desk with chair and lastly there was a chair wit a ottoman. The bathroom was clean and spacious with the basic tub with stall with a shower head. there was plenty space on the counter to spread your beautification items (in my case my lady arts and craft tools). The water was perfect and didn't take long to heat up. On this stay I purchased the option to have breakfast in bed. And it was amazing and fulfilling.  I think my only complaints were that room service disturbed me while I was utilizing staying later as I paid for late checkout. They also were extremely loud while cleaning the room next to mines as I tried to sleep in. Lol! Nothing major and it was over quick but still annoying. I will definitely stay again if ever in town because the whole experience was great from valet parking to check in to checking out.This review is specifically for The Dinner Detective Interactive Murder Mystery Dinner Show that takes place on the 2nd floor inside of the Omni Hotel. First of all, was it a horrible time? No. Was it worth the money? No! Would I go again? Not unless it was free. Needless to say I went in with a lot higher expectations than I should have. I just assumed for $64.95 + 14.55% in taxes & service fees per person we would have had a better show. Lets get right to business! ...Check-in for the show begins at 6pm..once you get there make sure at least one person from your party has their id because they do verify the tickets. After you check in you have to make up a "name" of a person you want to be for a night & wear it as a name badge. This was particular difficult for me I don't know why. I ended up being Vanna White & my bf Harrison Ford. They take your picture & later on during the dinner and show try to sell it to you for $35.. (yea..no thanks!)Once you enter the private room they have several tables set up with 10 people at each. Again not really what I had imagined. I was thinking the room would be decorated and we would all be sitting at a long rectangular table when someone got murdered! lol It felt more like a banquet dinner. They had a chips and salsa bar as you waited for the show to start. Drinks are not included not even soda. A liquor drink was $8 a piece, a bud light/corona was $6 and a can soda was $4. They also ONLY take cash just FYI!!The service & the food were both good. I had the chicken dinner which included a whole grilled chicken leg, red bliss potatoes and a squash medley. Before the meal you were also served a salad as well as bread. Dessert included cheesecake which was also pretty good. My main reason for giving 2 stars was the show. To be completely blunt it just sucked. It felt like a couple college kids got together and tried to make a murder mystery show and it was just lacking in a lot of areas and extremely cheesy. If you picked the murderer & a good description of why you thought they were the murderer you won $100 at the end which was pretty cool. Another reason for my two stars was one of the ladies at my table was extremely rude & annoying. The butler picked up my salad plate that I had eaten off but there were a few tomatoes left and when he started walking off with it she said "excuse me," took the plate from him and finished eating off my plate. Ew!I do hear there are Groupon deals of this event around for around $85 for 2 people and also comes with a mug so I would look into that first before paying regular price for a ticket!!It's ok if you don't consider it an upscale hotel and just think of it like a Days Inn. That's about the level of customer service you'll get. Room was dated and a bit run down (and very dark). Customer service was very hit or miss. Room wasn't ready when I arrived. When I was checking in (late afternoon) their phones were ringing with dissatisfied guests asking when their rooms would be serviced. I just skipped service since I was only there two nights, but I can confirm it came very late in the day when people were trying to get ready for dinner.  Icing on the cake was the bogus "mini bar charge" on my credit card that showed up days later, even though I never touched the mini bar. They reversed it when I called to ask about it...but that kind of crap just makes the whole operation seem slimey.  Silver lining was the room was pretty steeply discounted ($130). I certainly wouldn't pay more than that for it.Don't believe the views in the photos! They were clearly done with trick photography. My view of the parking lot was excellent, however!The property is very nice, clean and centrally located. It is next to a convention center and the Jacksonville Landing, which if you reference my review of it you will find out it sucks! You are next to the St Johns River which is pretty cool. You see minutes to the Five Points area that has lots to do.I did really like the quiet, comfortable hotel that is clean and pretty luxurious-feeling. I travel quite a bit but I haven't stayed at many Omni properties. It has a bar and restaurant inside, and they provide a list of nearby restaurants and entertainment.Jacksonville is a really decent city and this is a place is stay again!Super top notch Hotel in the Jacksonville area. We were put up in this hotel for one night and I'm totally glad we didn't stay anywhere else! The Omni is exactly what many hotels should model themselves after. Exquisite service, a cool decor & beautiful spacious rooms. I loved the clean lobby which had a cool modern vibe decor that made the place look very chic and upscale.The room we stayed in had two queen beds, was very spacious and had a nice writing table that looked very study and clean. The interior room also had dark furniture which if I were buying new furniture for my home I would probably think about purchasing myself.I would highly recommend this place to any future guests as the staff were very accommodating to our needs - Thank you! The lobby also had a cool water dispenser with fresh oranges for flavor which was a nice touch. The hotel bar was also very modern looking and had a nice drink selection at the bar.For hotels in the Jacksonville area the OMNI truly is one of the best!We got invited to perform for a wedding and got to stay at this lovely hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 12 luckily the rest if the group arrived at the same time. The event organizer a book six rooms for the entire group and luckily we got the rooms early and was able to get some rest before the performance. Ome of the best feature of the hotel is the security of the guest that no one can access the hotel rooms without a key to get on the elevator. Felt secure. the room was amazing. With a bar and all the alter in the room. I Had a comfortable sleep after our peformance.And it close to the landing where you can just walk around for food and shops!For an Omni hotel, I was definitely disappointed with the place. It is in desperate need of remodel. To begin with, we checked in and were informed that the pool was not open, but could walk the 3 blocks down to the Hyatt and use theirs.. We booked the hotel for the fact it HAD a rooftop pool. The website did not mention that the pool was closed, as apparently it sprung a leak and suddenly had to be fixed. After explaining that this is unacceptable, we received a lower nightly rate, and headed to our room... WHICH WAS LOCATED NEXT TO THE POOL. Literally, our sliding glass doors were on the pool deck. Super awkward room, I had the curtains drawn the whole time, as if anyone were outside smoking, or if the pool would have been open, you would have had no privacy.The walls are super thin, and we were awoken several times by our noisy neighbors. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is the staff. The manager was very apologetic about the pool situation, and two different front desk staffers warmly welcomes us each time we entered the hotel. Kudos to you for the customer service! FYI - The location is... not ideal. If you are here for the night for a football game, by all means book the hotel. If you are staying here because you are vacationing in Jacksonville, I recommend looking elsewhere.Had some major issues this my stay but after talking with their corporate offices and the location management, they comp'd a full night and parking. They seems to realize the issues we had and seemed to actually care about fixing them. I will probably give them another chance and stay again when in town.Nice hotel, and the location is phenomenal. It is close to the Landing, which can make getting to the hotel a pain if there is an event going on. For the money, however, I expected a few amenities (free WiFi should be standard these days) that weren't included. Also, I've stayed several times at the Hyatt Regency a few blocks away, and it is much nicer and less expensive.3.5 stars...counter agent has a certain arrogance, not real endearing after travelling for 16 hours...great parking staff, great room service, bistro was out of certain items offered on their menuStopped for drinks after a show last night. Wasn't too busy. Waiters let us sit there forever before begrudgingly waiting on us. Took a while to get 5 drinks. 2 people ordered Irish Coffee which they brought and it tasted like 2 day old coffee grinds. Totally not drinkable. When they brought them back to the older, female bartender with the blond hair she rudely said "well what do you expect it's coffee!" Rolled her eyes and went to wait on others. No "I'm sorry." No "would You like another one or something different." Everyone at the table tasted it and it was disgusting. Waiter was slightly nicer and came over after the bartender complained to him that we complained about the drinks. Felt like a Red Roof Inn rather than the OMNI. Yikes. Time for a new bartender less full of herself and more Focused on customer service. Would never go back.On the positive side, the service here was amazing and very attentive. However, I know that they are so good because I had so many problems when first arriving. My room had a mysterious wet spot on the carpet and a backed up shower. Disgusting! I can't believe these things escaped the notice of the cleaning staff, and it made it a little hard to get comfortable. For such a nice hotel, I was surprised at these lapses. However, the staff was very helpful in resolving the issues, and the downstairs JBar was pretty good!I guess this is as good as it gets in Jacksonville.corporate clients must keep it going.dated rooms.tub shower combo is so ten years ago.well trained staff.bed was soft.PROS-staff very friendlyCONS-rooms very small and cramped-hotel was dirty-ice vending was broken-charged for basic wifi-room lighting was very badWould not stay here again.Worst hotel experience I've ever had. Service was terrible. The ladies at the front desk were annoying and condescending. Way way overpriced.Beautiful hotel and attentive reception staff. The hotel is close to the Jacksonville Landing so you're close to food and shopping. The hotel and rooms are outstanding. The parking is relatively good prices you have a few choices. I wish they would have explained how to use the elevators a little better cause a lot of my group got confused or stuck on the elevator because you have to slide your card to activate the buttons but it isn't very conspicuous and while I was in the elevator with a bell hop he neglected to explain how it work and simply smiled when I couldn't get the buttons working. Great location very close to the heart of the city and only 30 minutes from JAX beaches.I've never stay in a room at the Omni but I went to a room someone had reserved to sell sheet sets and the room was beautiful I know they take good care of you while you are there in the lobby they have fruit, coffee and puuch for the customers the desk clerks are very friendly even if you are just walking through the hotel and it is so clean.I am here for business only 2days.... hotel staff...from the front desk to the cleaning are so sweet and helpful...all is great, it is a older hotel..but been kept up....and the shower is a real shower, if u know what I mean.Simple yet cute rooftop pool. There's a telephone for bar/food service, but we decided to avoid the extra service fees and order downstairs.This is a beautiful Hotel in the heart of downtown Jacksonville, Florida. It is one block away from the Jacksonville Landing, they Skyway, and the beautiful Saint John's River. The Omni is connected with the Enterprise Bldg.. Juliette's Restaurant is one of my favorite places to eat for a quick lunch, but even better for dinner. They have a daily Monday-Friday Lunch buffet for about $10.00. Not bad for the different variety of foods you have to choose from, with a chef their to cook special dishes for you with your choice of foods. I go here for days I feel the need to "treat myself" days. You also have a menu to order from, if buffets are not you cup of tea. They also have a full bar. I highly recommend this place to any who wants to dine with style. We also have our Christmas dinners here for the company I work for. They have always done a perfect job. If you have a bad meal, they want to know and will make it right for you. A dish I had one time was too salty and the gave me something in place of that dish.
review_content_20: We got a great rate day of.  Came for the Harry Connick, Jr. concert at the Union-Times Moran Theater.  Literally right across the street from the hotel.  We joked that it took us 1 minute and 31 seconds to get there.  The young man at the front desk was courteous, efficient and had us in a nice room within minutes.  The room was nicely appointed, perfect temperature and very clean.  My one little gripe is that the maid woke us up at 8:28.  In her defense we did not have our privacy sign out, but still that was early.Check out was a breeze with 2 coffees in hand, our valet brought the car, offered to load and sent us off with a wish for a pleasant day.We will be back.Nicely appointed rooms with a view of the River, and an airy atrium with friendly bartender and highly decent breakfast buffet. I'd definitely return.The recent review from Jon is nothing like what I experienced. The valet was super friendly and the front desk was just as sweet. The man who handles the luggage is the same man and even remembered me from my last visit (2nd time here for this year). The room is a little dark but has large space, clean bathroom and comfortable bed. The pool area was a little plain and small but I still really enjoyed my stay. The soaps and shampoos smell nice enough to use at home. The gym was very clean, has modern equipment, towels, disposable headphones and a water jug. The gym connects to the pool, which can be kind of annoying since people walk in and out every once in awhile.The restaurant on site has pretty good food and full bar. There is room service and the breakfast (10-$15) was a nice splurge since the rooms do not have kitchenettes. There is a store but hours aren't posted so if it is slow, they may not be opened or on break. The parking is valet or a private lot without re-entry. I went with valet, which was 20 bucks a night. Chance of return: 90%The Omni was nice. Best water pressure I've ever had in a hotel. The staff was very nice.  The room was clean, Kureg coffee machine and Wolfgang Puck coffee is nice.  I know I keep saying 'nice' but that's all it was, nice.  The parking situation is not the best. You either pay $20 a night for valet parking or $10 a day in the lot BUT if you leave the lot you pay the $10 and if you leave and come back the same day you pay again so valet is probably your best bet. The area is not nice. We went to River Walk which is like a block away and had 2 different people ask us for money, one asked for a cigarette.  I would not feel comfortable walking around at night for sure and we actually left a day early because my husband did not want to leave his truck parked in the lot overnight. I had driven up a day early in a rented car and didn't care about that but after spending the day in the area he did not want to take a chance parking in the lot.  I was attending an event at the hotel so I was kinda stuck there. But I would not go back and stay in that hotel again just because the area is yucky.Well, I initially started to give this place a better review, but when you mess with someone's finances, you have a problem. I am not happy at all. They leave a lot to be desired when it comes to their billing. FIRST, let me, a customer, tell you how this works --- when you call and go thru the timefull process of giving all of your information to make your reservation waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay in the beginning including giving your account and debit/ credit card information, don't expect to be charged like you would think. Don't expect someone to tell you with courtesy that you will be charged upon arrival. Don't expect any information on the billing, check-in, process, or anything... Don't expect crap. YOU WON'T GET IT. What you will get is someone pretending to charge your card and act like everything is normal when it's not. Then, when you get to the hotel, they charge you. Then they hold another charge on the room and then they add money to the card!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! What a mess! Then, you go to clear it up and management tells you, "Yeah, it's a problem we have..." no kidding! NO KIDDING! Try charging people when they call. Perhaps that is the reason why they are calling when they call is to reserve and PAY for their room. UGH. #PostingDivaLike this hotel. The lady at the front desk was very friendly when we checked in. Close to greyhound bus station.Nice hotel but the pool facilities suck!  Get more lounge chairs!  The rooms are nice and good amenities in the bathroom but it was not enough to overcome the sucky pool situation.The location for the hotel is a great especially if you're going across the street to the times for him for a show. Unfortunately there is really nothing within walking distance as far as restaurants or entertainment. As far as the room, it is a step above basic and very comfortable. I did experience a problem in which there was a piece of used chewing gum attached to the soap that they had placed in our room. It appears that they had put new carpetin recently which is great but unfortunately it was pilled up and really needed to be vacuumed quite badly. The stuff and valet were very nice and the chicken was very efficient and easy.Great, thoughtful and welcoming employees throughout the entire hotel. Restaurant is OK, but service is A+.We came for a birthday weekend (Friday, Saturday, Sunday) as a change of pace from what we usually do to celebrate at the Omni at Championsgate. While I am glad to have tried something new I found myself comparing everything about this hotel to the one at Championsgate.We checked in at 1 AM and were greeted by valet who was absolutely a delight considering it was so late. Check in went well and within 5 minutes or thereabouts we got the keys and the bell boy assisted us to our room for the weekend.Upon settling in for the night I realized as a Select Guest I only got one instead of two morning complimentary beverage tickets. Select Guest Gold Members get one for each night of their stay. I was okay with that because we were planning to go out for breakfast anyway. We had booked with our reservation their "Home Away From Home" package for out four legged family member. Unfortunately, we never received anything and upon check out we were billed for it anyway. I will get to more on that later.The hotel itself was beautiful give or take a few quirks. The bathroom and closet doors stuck and made annoying sounds when opened or shut. The windows didn't seem to have proper sealing because they made funny sounds. The room was immaculate, we had plenty of towels, but the two double beds I had booked my reservation for was changed at some point for one king. The river walk view wad replaced by tall buildings and a parking lot. Not only did we get robbed of two beds but my dog was forced to sleep between us because he was without the dog bed he was promised. Valet parking was $20/night instead of the $20 for the duration of your stay as stated on the website. We were also billed $60 plus $10 extra every night for our furry family member instead of the standard $50 one time fee.The pool was nice but small and quaint but to my surprise no hot tub. The fitness center was well equipped for the small space it was located in. A perk was that it was indeed 24 hours for us insomniacs. Would we return? Maybe. We love traveling and staying at Omni because of their attention to detail and the way they make you feel welcome. We just aren't sure about Omni Jacksonville just yet.The hotel itself was nice, the staff was very friendly and the room was clean. The bathroom was dated but everything worked. I chose the hotel because they allowed pets and I was forced to spend the night in Jacksonville due to horrible traffic during a long travel day. They charge you $50 extra for a dog for the first night and $10 extra for each additional night. It doesn't come with a treat, a toy, water bowl or anything it is strictly for cleaning....fine. When it comes for the dog to relieve themselves there is no place for them to do so. The hotel is all concrete outside. There is a small flat parking lot with grassy parking medians that we had to make due however there were no waste bags or trash cans to be found....obviously this is an issue in a pet friendly hotel.In addition they offer a best rate promise if booked through their website. BEWARE of the fine print as they do all they can to get out of honoring it. I would have saved $10 per night through trip advisor, hotels, orbitz, expedia, ect but chose to use their website thinking they would match the price and not have to pay the third parties any fees. I figured I was helping them out and saving them money, I was wrong. Their customer service department was quick to point out I needed to book three days in advance to get the price match promise. They call it policy, I call it used car salesman tactics. For the guy above that said it had a "Las Vegas Vibe"....no, no it doesn't it's Jacksonville there are a few subpar bars across the street, there are plenty of druggies and homeless around the corner. The people frequenting those bars are less than desirable. It is nothing like Vegas...Business travelers - AVOID. If you need to use Internet for your job and it is important for your stay at a hotel, avoid this hotel like the plague. Internet speeds are 8% of what is advertised, and  there's nothing they can or will do to fix this. Sure, you can demand a refund downstairs. But wouldn't you rather stay at an honest hotel that has working services so that you can actually use your room?The business center is even worse. $6.95 every fifteen minutes for a download rate of 147 kbps. Super nice employees here but its ridiculous. I can't believe that Omni isnt upgrading this hotel.Not a fun stay for how expensive it is.- Dark, old feel room in a bad way.  It didn't smell fresh.- Pillows were linty which made them seem dirty- Wake up call at 6am I didn't ask for.-Ahi tuna came drizzled with wasabi sauce, not described on menu, which made it inedible.  I thought it was avocado based, there was so much of it.  -Tiniest most awkward fitness center. I don't expect a lot from hotels in this area but this was ridiculous.  There is no way to work out if more than 3 people trying to use machines / weights at same time.  - Wrong items brought for breakfastAt first, the hotel looks really nice and exquisite. Even the lobby looks expensive, but , that's not the case. We got double beds, and there was a lot of little hairs on the sheets. The pillow cases were also too big for the pillows, which made them look really messy and not neat at all. Ps the pillows inside were yellow(stained). When I entered the bathroom , I saw that one of the towels had a lipstick stain on it (no one had used the bathroom yet). I thought "Eh I guess it's okay if it's a stain and it's not dirty" , but I took at piece of toilet paper and rubbed it onto the lipstick and it EASILY came off. I was pretty grossed out to say the least...Then, I looked into the shower, and the inside curtain was stained yellow and brown in many places. THEN, when we were walking out of the hotel at night to go look around the shopping area nearby, we saw the employees fighting and smoking out in the front, it was very unprofessional. (Some of them still had their uniforms on)Amazing place to stay when in Jax. It's right next to the Landing, has great views of the river, yummy room service. Only downer was having to pay for WiFi. Would go back here anyway!By far one of my favorite hotels to stay in. The only downfall is parking, otherwise it's always an enjoyable stay.My credit card information was lifted by one of the employees. I stayed here for business and everything was paid for by my employer except breakfast and valet. Somebody at the front desk or in the restaurant stole my information and used it again at this hotel months later.Overall great hotel. The Location is Fantastic, right next to landings and right off the interstate. The reason I am giving this hotel III, is because the gentleman that checked me in was completely rude. He asked us where we first time guess we said yes and asked if there was anything we needed to know. He did not give us any information on the hotel not even that we needed to use our room key to use the elevator. Nor the location of the elevator so we had to ask the guest assistance at the front door. When we came back after checking in our room with questions he had a very ignorant attitude. So we decided to walk away from him and ask him next person next to him. To whom gave us amazing feedback and information. On top of that he did not speak to us like we were a burden to him.We got a great rate through Hotwire on our room. I thought it was clean, nice, classy, and great customer service.  Everyone was really  nice and we enjoyed our stay.  The room is cozy and the beds are comfy.  We would stay here again.  The room service was especially yummy.  We were very surprised by how good the food was.  Highly recommend!Ok, so perhaps if I were here on pleasure this hotel would be fantastic. However, I travel for business mainly, and to me this place was a logistical nightmare. I need to get in and out quick. You cannot do that here. You must park in a garage for$12 a night. So if I leave something in my car I have to get on the elevator, go to the huge lobby, cross the little street to the garage, get on another elevator, get my stuff, and then come back. This is the evil of huge hotels. Now, if you are attending a conference at the hotel, it's a dream. You never have to leave the premises. You have in house restaurant, gym, pool, concierge, everything. Get ready to be nickel and dimed here. You pay for the garage, pay for in room refreshments, pay for Internet access, and yes, if you use the business center computer, you must pay for that as well. If you want to print something, you can from your room, however, you will also pay .49 cents per page. The hotel itself is lovely. The rooms are well appointed, room service was actually quite nice, and they have wonderful toiletries and an ipod dock. It's just for my purposes this hotel does not work.
review_content_40: Overall very nice hotel. Clean room. Nice stocked mini bar. Great water pressure. Bed was slightly hard. Restaurant in hotel was great for breakfast but I a little pricey. Starbucks Coffee!!!Well priced and nicely located for the business traveler. Its adjacent to the skytran central station. Its located a couple blocks from Jacksonville Landing (though struggling mall) and Laura Street. The lobby is really nice and welcoming. Very nice staff. The rooms are comfortable and pretty current.  There is a nice roof top pool.  The restaurant bar is nicely decorated but the service and food is not on par with the rest of the hotel. Its a good option for downtown Jacksonville.I had a really great experience here, staying earlier this week. The staff is super friendly and the hotel, while getting older, still has a very nice ambiance and is nicely luxurious. Having seen some other hotels my colleagues were at, I have to say the Omni beat them all by quite a bit. The only compliant I had was dang did it take a long time to get served and attended to at lunch in the J Bar. Might want to tell the waiters to check on tables three times as often as they do. But even that complaint was mitigated by the food being terrific.My stay at the Jacksonville Omni was tolerable, but not the most relaxing of experiences. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were okay, but check-in was quite the hassle. I had booked through kayak and confirmed my reservation with the hotel staff the Wed. before my arrival. The staff confirmed a Premier River View room, but when i arrived the hotel stated the reservation did not specify the type of room because it was not booked through the hotel website and they had no river view rooms available. I was both confused and frustrated by this information, especially when i had confirmed it just 2 days prior.Long story short, after looking at 3 different rooms, i gave up and chose one which offered a slight view of the river. Upon check out i asked for a receipt which showed that i did not stay in a "premier river view room" so that i could obtain a refund from Kayak (Omni stated they would not reimburse me), the front desk stated that i was staying in a "river view room". At this point i was done trying to communicate, understand or deal with the Omni. Breakdown:1. Friendly staff, but not good with communication and had the feeling they were lying to cover their mistakes.2. Rooms are dated, but clean. I expected more for the price, but perhaps my expectations are too high.3. Be prepared for the 7am wakeup call day of checkout (not optional)4. Valet was friendly, polite, and quick.5. charge for water6. charge for wifiGood luck!Stayed at the Omni Jacksonville for business Feb 26 - 27, 2012.  The property is about 15 min away from the airport. Cab driver was very nice and personable. (Gator Cab Company) The property is flawless in a rather rough part of town. Perhaps it was the dark clouds and rain but it seemed to be a jewel nestled in town.  Check in was not bad though they had me down for checking in the next day - easy enough to fix. The gal who checked me in was very polished and polite. The room rocked. Lots of space. Clean. Fabulous TV and bathroom. The shower pressure was perfect. It didn't have a in-room safe which is always a HUGE bonus for me so I deducted for that....the fitness center is on the 2nd floor and very small. The pool looked decent but it is outside and it was Feb. :)  The business center was more of a business closet and while I couldn't get online to print my boarding passes for free for Feb 27, I asked the front desk about it and they immediately offered to do it for me on the spot - huge points for this and the front desk was very accomodating in helping me out.  Room service was very prompt and very nice. Served it right in the accurate estimated time and was extremely polished in savvy in "presenting" your meal which I've come to love so much.  I'm convinced if you choose to stay at a nice property and order room service, presentation, taste and timely delivery is everything. It's an experience. Food was awesome and their menu had a LOT to choose from....Breakfast in the restaurant on site ROCKED. Huge bonus points for this one. Ordered off their healthy side - spinnach friatta with provolone, multigrain toast and fruit. It was HEAVENLY. Awesome meal for the cost of maybe $12 with an ice tea - sweet or unsweet? I asked for half and half and it was spot on. Overall, go for it. The staff truly makes it a nice experience even down to those whom you run into in the elevator who are very welcoming and definitely show their professionalism.  Didn't venture out as I was there on business for all of less than 24 hours so I didn't see too many local hang outs but don't let that stop you.  The price is right. The staff is amazing and the food rocks.  Had low expectations in the cab on the way in and happy experiences to report and share with you on the way out back to Columbus.Nice hotel for the price.  Great location close to Jacksonville Landing.  Parking on the 8th floor was a little bit of a pain but overall a nice stayMy wife and I stayed at the Omni over Thanksgiving.  We had a deluxe room in a corner of the building.  The views from the room were quite pretty with views of the river and bridges.  The appointments and comfort of the room was really great.  We loved it.  The staff at the desk couldn't have been more pleasant and accommodating.  Several shifts of people that we dealt with had a really positive attitude.  Credit to the hiring and training of the staff.  Very consistent.  We also liked the valet service very much.  They knew us by name and didn't need our number for the car...ever.  We enjoyed our time and would come back the next time we are in town.After a long week of business travel, I ended up at this hotel for the most recent 4th of July.  I am so happy I chose to stay here instead of by Jax Beach.  This hotel has a good view of the St. John's River and is just a block away from the Jacksonville Landing.From the time I arrived at the hotel, the valet staff was very friendly.  The front desk made me feel very welcome.  The hotel lobby was clean and well laid out.  My room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable.  (I really appreciate when a hotel gets the mattress right.)  One thing I noticed when I first got in the room is that it didnt have a flat screen TV.  It still has a 25"-27" tube TV.  I couldnt believe that this hotel hasnt updated all the TVs in their rooms.  Also, the bathrooms need some updating.  Yes, it had the granite countertop, but the tub and tiling was old and it showed.  My other complaint was that the elevators were stuffy and all had a funky odor to them.  I thought it would have gone away but when I heard another couple complain about it, I knew I wasn't the only one it was affecting.I still give this hotel 3 stars because the pool area, which is on the 4th floor and overlooks the city somewhat, was nice with plenty of seating.  The fitness room was also spacious.  The Wi-Fi is free if you are a member of there members program (easy to sign up on the spot, if needed).  I will definitely go back when i'm back in town.Omni hotel brought it's A game for a mere $150/night.  Top 3 things I love about this hotel.1. The water pressure.  No flat hair from water saving shower heads and pawltry water flow here.  At times the intensity of the spray almost hurt...hurt so good.  I actually don't even need any other reasons than this to make this my favorite hotel, but in case others aren't as critical of their water pressure...2. The fitness center and rooftop pool.  New machines with individual TVs.  Everything works, more than two people can work out at once, and none of the machines squeek.  The pool is nice and relaxing with comfy lounge chairs, bags/corn hole boards, and a fooseball table.3. The rewards program.  Sign up free to get: free paper of your choice, free room upgrades if available, free juice and coffee brought to your room every morning, free presssing, and a free stay or airline miles for every 10 visits (each night counts as a stay).  I'm halfway there already!  The hotel is also in walking distance of the river and plenty of restaurant options.The omni has lost "it". My last fee experiences here, and in Austin, have shown me an omni without the typical high quality I expected. From missing reward benefits, to be shuffled through multiple rooms due to broken fixtures, to very poor internet, rooms not being cleaned upon check in, and the fact that they lost my pressed clothiers the night before a big meeting. All of these faults with a poor front desk and customer svc attitude. It makes me sad because I used to stay at the omni in Brookfield and was so impressed with my visits there. The company overall must be changing as they made rewards and free nights harder. Overall I think I will take my annual stays back to hilton.Stayed here for our weekend trip to see the New York Jets take on the Jacksonville Jaguars.I give it three positive "C's" : Convenient, clean and comfortable.It's a mile and a half walk to Everbank Field, home of the Jaguars and it's just a block away from Jacksonville Landing, a spot to grab corporate chain food and drink.The room was clean and comfortable.My only negative "C", for complaint, is that the only stationary recumbent cycle in the fitness center was broken.Other than that, it was all good.I was not feeling well when I checked in. I was so grateful for the Valet. So nice and offered me self park. The checkin was fast and friendly. The room was really nice.  Warm colors.  Higher end. The bed was Fab!!!! Seriously wonderful. Bath was above normal nice. I am not a hotel lover. I usually stay in BnB because I want a superior experience. This hotel gives that.Everyone was friendly and welcoming. Omni Jax you have a fan!The hotel is nice! But the restaurant is not. Had a shrimp pasta, no taste the portion was a joke compared to the price. I returned the plate.Where do I start. I stayed at this hotel for Florida/Georgia weekend so naturally the rates were much higher. Unfortunately the quality of hotel no where near matches the rates. I give it two stars because the employees were all very nice. The room itself was awful!! I have stayed at nicer holiday inns. The beds were full size if that, extremely small and uncomfortable. To top it off they didn't have a fitted sheet on the bed just another top sheet tucked in. The bathroom was dirty and old. The tub was disgusting and I felt dirtier after I took a shower. Needless to say $700 for 2 nights was ridiculous. I know it was a busy weekend but I would have rather slept in a tent.
